libya</s><s>target residence leader moammar gadhafi</s><s>gulf war force bomb attempt hussein president iraq</s><s>review house precedent operation circumstance	one goal afghanistan raid kill osama bin laden	objective august raid afghanistan kill bin laden men	us admits osama bin laden lieutenants object august attack	aug attack al qaeda camp rekindle assassination debate  legal	one of the clear but unstated objectives of last august 's raid on afghanistan was to kill osama bin laden and as many of his lieutenants as possible , administration officials now acknowledge . </s><s> according to the officials , white house lawyers conducted a secret review in the months before the attack and concluded that such operations are legal under u.s. and international law . </s><s> the officials said the raid was timed so that more than 70 cruise missiles would hit bin laden 's camps at the moment when the central intelligence agency believed he would be meeting there with his chief operatives . </s><s> a 1976 executive order bars anyone working for the u.s. government from plotting or carrying out assassinations . </s><s> but officials said the white house legal opinion drafted before the afghan strike asserts that the president has authority to target the `` infrastructure '' of terrorist groups that are attacking americans . </s><s> a top u.s. counterterrorism official said this week that the infrastructure of bin laden 's group is mostly `` human . '' </s><s> `` as we said from the time of the aug. 20 strike , the objective was to disrupt the training , organization and infrastructure of the bin laden terrorist network at the khost camps , '' said david c. leavy , a spokesman for the national security council at the white house . </s><s> targeting infrastructure , officials acknowledged , can also mean destroying the leadership of a terrorist group . </s><s> `` command and control of an enemy is a justifiable target , '' leavy said . </s><s> senior administration officials said they never discussed killing bin laden in their planning sessions . </s><s> his death , they said in interviews after the attack , would simply have been a side benefit . </s><s> u.s. intelligence officials say they now believe that bin laden was in the camp on the day of the attack , but he appears to have left unscathed before the missiles hit . </s><s> officials said there were reports that at least one of his senior lieutenants may have died in the attack , and that total casualties in the complex were between 50 and 100 . </s><s> administration spokesmen have drawn a distinction between attempting to kill a specific person like bin laden and attacking a group of people who command a terrorist organization . </s><s> administration officials have denied since august that the raid was intended to kill bin laden , a saudi exile who has been charged by federal prosecutors with leading a global war against u.s. interests . </s><s> he has been linked to the aug. 7 bombing of two u.s. embassies in east africa . </s><s> but a less subtle explanation was offered on oct. 13 by defense secretary william cohen , who said during a visit to saudi arabia that the united states had been `` going after '' bin laden and his colleagues . </s><s> `` we were n't quite successful , '' cohen continued , `` but we sent a message . '' </s><s> kenneth bacon , the pentagon spokesman , said the secretary had not retracted his statements . </s><s> the los angeles times recently reported that the administration believed that it had a legal right to use deadly force against terrorist leaders . </s><s> bin laden 's organization was a significant concern for the clinton administration even before the bombing of the u.s. embassies in east africa . </s><s> last spring , officials said , u.s. intelligence considered a daring raid into afghanistan to capture the saudi exile . </s><s> officials said that at roughly the same time , the white house drafted the legal justification for military attacks against a terrorist leadership . </s><s> that review , officials said , provided the legal basis in august to fire cruise missiles into the meeting at which it was believed bin laden and his lieutenants would be gathered . </s><s> the review , by the national security council , was the basis for saying this operation did not violate the presidential order banning assassinations . </s><s> that ban was imposed by president ford in 1975 , after congressional investigators uncovered evidence that the cia had plotted to assassinate fidel castro , the cuban leader , and others . </s><s> the order said : `` no person employed by , or acting on behalf of the united states government shall engage in , or conspire to engage in , assassination . '' </s><s> while it is , on its face , a sweeping and unqualified ban , it has been subject to interpretation and intense debate over the years . </s><s> in 1986 , the reagan administration responded to a terrorist attack against u.s. soldiers in germany with a bombing raid on libya . </s><s> the targets included the residence of the libyan leader , moammar gadhafi . </s><s> and in the gulf war , u.s. forces used powerful bombs in an attempt to kill saddam hussein , the president of iraq . </s><s> the legal review conducted by the white house would appear to provide a precedent for future operations in similar circumstances .	one goal of afghanistan raid was to kill osama bin laden	objective of august raid on afghanistan was to kill bin laden and his men .	u.s. admits osama bin laden and lieutenants the object of august attack	aug attack on al qaeda camp rekindles assassination debate ; legal or not ?

fear us	sometime in the summer of 1997 , an operative for osama bin laden sat down at his personal computer in a hideaway in kenya . </s><s> he was worried , he wrote in an angry dispatch , about the security of the `` east africa network '' of bin laden , the saudi exile accused of masterminding a worldwide terrorist conspiracy against americans . </s><s> the organization , the author complained , had declared war against the united states , yet he had learned of that only from the news media . </s><s> the writer , who federal authorities believe was haroun fazil , who was to become one of the central suspects in the bombing of the u.s. embassy in nairobi a year later , noted with alarm british press reports about the arrest of an aide to bin laden . </s><s> striking almost bureaucratic tones , he said he was worried that `` an important man with close links '' to bin laden , seemed to have `` fallen into the enemy 's hands . '' </s><s> he said the americans were breathing down the necks of his associates in nairobi and that he had to take precautions . </s><s> `` the cell is at 100 percent danger , '' the operative warned . </s><s> the letter , an extraordinary bit of digital evidence in a cloak-and-dagger case , was retrieved from a computer in a house where fazil had been staying , according to papers filed in u.s. district court in new york city . </s><s> the papers said the computer was seized in august 1997 in a raid by kenyan authorities that was attended by an fbi agent . </s><s> the documents did not make clear whether the fbi had translated and read the document before or after the bombings of the u.s. embassies in nairobi and dar es salaam , tanzania , on aug. 7 of this year . </s><s> the timing is potentially important because there have been mounting questions since the bombings about whether the united states adequately followed up warnings of a possible terrorist attack on american targets in kenya . </s><s> officials of the fbi and the u.s. attorney 's office in new york city refused to say tuesday night at what point fbi agents learned of the computer file , nor would they make any other comment . </s><s> fazil eluded american investigators after the bombing as he traveled from kenya to his home in the comoros islands and then to the middle east . </s><s> he remains a fugitive . </s><s> the dispatch provides a remarkable insight into the workings of a terrorist network in the twilight of the 20th century . </s><s> the author talks of how he and his fellow operatives follow events on cnn and use the internet to communicate . </s><s> he refers to himself as the media information officer of the east africa cell and complains that he is not being kept in the loop on big decisions . </s><s> along the way , in an almost casual fashion , the document seems to confirm two of the central charges of the federal case against bin laden : that he had planted a terrorist cell in nairobi and that his operatives carried out another of the crimes laid at bin laden 's door by federal authorities _ the attacks on american soldiers in somalia in 1993 and 1994 . </s><s> the writer of the document warned that the followers of bin laden , whom he referred to as `` the sheik , '' had `` become america 's primary target . '' </s><s> he said his comrades in east africa `` should know that there is an american-kenyan-egyptian intelligence activity in nairobi aiming to identify the names and residences of the members who are associated with the sheik since america knows well that the youth who lived in somalia and were members of the sheik 's cell are the ones who killed americans in somalia . '' </s><s> `` they know that since kenya was the main gateway for those members , there must be a center in kenya , '' he wrote , concluding : `` we are really in danger . '' </s><s> the government has asserted that one of fazil 's duties was to prepare and transmit reports to bin laden and his top lieutenants . </s><s> federal authorities said that khalid al fawwaz , a london-based associate of bin laden , directed fazil to `` report periodically to bin laden about the `` security '' situation of the cell . </s><s> fawwaz , who served as an informal press spokesman for bin laden in london , was arrested by british authorities in september after the embassy bombings . </s><s> he has denied any connection to terrorist activities . </s><s> a translation of the report was part of a package of documents american prosecutors have sent to britain to support the extradition of fawwaz for trial in new york . </s><s> it is not clear from the materials whether the report in the computer was forwarded to bin laden . </s><s> the documents , which were initially filed in secret , include a federal complaint that accuses fawwaz of conspiring with bin laden to kill americans overseas . </s><s> a second count charges him with soliciting others to do so . </s><s> the report made clear that the organization was being run on a shoestring . </s><s> its author wrote that his mother has fallen ill , and that he would like to return to his homeland for a visit . </s><s> `` what do you think ? </s><s> keep in mind we only have $ 500 . '' </s><s> he repeatedly expressed his fears of american intelligence , which he believed was in the midst of a worldwide search for bin laden and his associates . </s><s> `` there is a war and the situation is dangerous , '' he said . </s><s> he wrote that american forces kidnapped anyone who threatened the national security or american citizens . </s><s> the author noted with alarm a recent cia operation in which a man accused of shooting agency employees had been lured across the border in pakistan and returned to the united states for trial . </s><s> according to federal authorities , fazil went on to play a pivotal role in the bombing of the nairobi embassy . </s><s> prosecutors assert that he rented the villa where the bomb was assembled and surveyed the embassy 's security precautions . </s><s> on aug. 7 , they charge , fazil drove a pickup truck to the embassy , leading the way for a vehicle carrying the bomb that killed more than 200 people , including 12 americans . </s><s> the author of the report said that he stood ready to `` fight the forces of atheism and dictators who wreaked havoc on earth . '' </s><s> he said that the group did not have to inform its nairobi-based operatives of all its global plans , but they needed enough warning to go `` underground for a while '' if authorities intensified the pressure in nairobi . </s><s> `` we , the east africa cell members , do not want to know about the operations plans , '' he wrote , `` since we are just implementers . ''	letter from bin laden operative sheds light on operation of network	in summer of 1997 , east african bin laden network worried about security .	dispatch of osama bin laden operative gives insight into terrorist network	1997 , terrorist computer ; bin laden cell kenya ; somalia attacks ; fear of us

scoop us  take plea  charge way	if osama bin laden ever stands trial in new york for the bombings of the u.s. embassies in africa and other acts of terror , it is already clear who prosecutors will call as a chief witness : one of his senior aides who has been talking to u.s. investigators for two years . </s><s> the government has identified the aide in court papers with the pseudonym cs-1 , saying the person pleaded guilty to terrorism charges in a secret proceeding in u.s. district court in manhattan . </s><s> according to the government , the informant worked closely with bin laden from 1989 to 1996 , a period when prosecutors assert that bin laden was ordering deadly attacks on u.s. soldiers in somalia and elsewhere . </s><s> from the court papers filed in the investigation of the embassy bombings in east africa in august , it is clear that the informant has provided crucial information to federal investigators . </s><s> they have cited the source in the papers filed to support the extradition of two associates of bin laden who are under arrest in germany and britain . </s><s> bin laden , a saudi exile , is thought to be living in afghanistan . </s><s> the source is also the basis for many of the significant charges in the indictment against bin laden himself , including the assertion that he directed the attacks on u.s. soldiers in somalia and that he attempted to obtain nuclear weapons . </s><s> it is not known whether the source is in custody somewhere , or hiding under government protection . </s><s> as recently as 11 days ago , records show , the source swore to a 5-page affidavit before a new york notary summarizing his allegations against bin laden . </s><s> government officials adamantly declined to say anything about the identity of cs-1 , which stands for `` confidential source . '' </s><s> but at least one operative of bin laden 's group in east africa concluded more than a year ago that he knew the identity of a crucial turncoat : sidi tayyib , a businessman who was married to one of bin laden 's relatives . </s><s> the operative 's concerns were inflamed by a report in a british newspaper that tayyib was cooperating with saudi and u.s. authorities . </s><s> in an august , 1997 article , the daily telegraph said tayyib had been in custody in saudi arabia since may and had given intelligence officials details of bin laden 's bank accounts and businesses . </s><s> the news of tayyib 's possible defection , the east african operative wrote in a report apparently intended for the group 's commanders , `` almost made me explode . </s><s> `` an important man with close links to '' bin laden `` seems to have fallen into the enemy 's hands , and we have to take all the appropriate security precautions against that , '' the operative , haroun fazil , wrote in his summary of security concerns . </s><s> fazil has since been charged in the embassy attacks and remains at large . </s><s> the report was typed on a computer seized last year by kenyan authorities , according to a government filing last week in u.s. district court in manhattan . </s><s> thus far , u.s. prosecutors have charged at least six members of bin laden 's organization with terrorist activities or conspiracy . </s><s> in one recent filing , they said their case will in part be `` based on the testimony '' of the confidential source , suggesting that the informant has agreed to testify at any trial of bin laden or his associates . </s><s> the arrangement appears to have resulted from a plea bargain in which the source is cooperating in hopes of receiving a lesser sentence . </s><s> there is no indication that the source has yet been sentenced and it seems likely that sentencing would take place after the investigation and ensuing trials are complete . </s><s> in the affidavit prepared last week , the source acknowledged pleading guilty to terrorism charges in the united states and said they stemmed from attacks on u.s. targets , which were not specifically identified . </s><s> the source described taking `` an oath of allegiance '' to follow bin laden 's orders , and gave a detailed account of bin laden 's group , including its history and inner workings . </s><s> the source told of private statements by bin laden to other al qaeda members , encouraging them to attack u.s. troops and other citizens stationed in the middle east and africa . </s><s> `` i either heard these statements myself , '' the source said , `` or i read them or learned of them from other al qaeda members . '' </s><s> the government has also said in other court papers that the source helped identify bin laden 's signature on a 1996 document urging muslims to kill americans . </s><s> tayyib 's whereabouts are unknown and he could not be reached for comment .	former top bin laden aide source of u.s. evidence on terrorists	us has informant who worked closely with bin laden as senior aide 1989-96 .	osama bin laden associate now an informant in u.s. investigation	osama bin laden 's in-law gives scoop to us ; takes plea ; more charges on way

certain	in a critical ruling for the north american national basketball association and the players ' union , arbitrator john feerick decides monday whether more than 200 players with guaranteed contracts should be paid during the lockout . </s><s> if the players win , the owners will be liable for about dlrs 800 million in guaranteed salaries , although they have vowed to appeal if they lose . </s><s> the league already has sued the players over feerick 's jurisdiction . </s><s> `` if we win , i think it just emboldens the spirit and resolve of the players , '' union director billy hunter said . </s><s> `` but i do n't think there will be anybody celebrating because there 's no guarantee that it will end the lockout . </s><s> `` it only means they have to pay some 200 players , and they 've indicated to us their intent to file an immediate appeal and take it as far as they have to in order to avoid payment . </s><s> `` so even if he does rule in our favor , at most it 's a hollow victory . </s><s> the players are n't going to get paid nov. 15 in any circumstance , '' hunter said . </s><s> if the owners win , it will remove the last wild card the players had been holding . </s><s> the sides have not negotiated since last tuesday , when the union proposed a superstar tax on the highest contracts . </s><s> the league made a counterproposal friday , asking that the tax be imposed with a much lower threshold . </s><s> hunter dismissed the league 's latest proposal on friday afternoon , then said both sides would be best served by awaiting feerick 's ruling . </s><s> it 's unlikely any negotiations will be held this week , since the union is holding a meeting for all nba players and the agents advisory committee in las vegas from wednesday through friday . </s><s> `` we 've got to get a sense of where the players are , what they consider to be reasonable and what they 're willing to do in order to get the season to commence , '' hunter said . </s><s> the union filed a grievance with feerick before the lockout was imposed july 1 over the owners ' announcement june 29 that they would not honor guaranteed deals . </s><s> in a six-day hearing over the summer , the union argued that owners should have protected themselves from being liable for guaranteed salaries during a work stoppage by inserting lockout language into the standard player contract . </s><s> the sacramento kings inserted a lockout clause into center olden polynice 's contract in 1994 , and it was approved by the league . </s><s> the union used the existence of that clause to argue that all the other teams should have protected themselves similarly . </s><s> most players are due to receive their first paychecks nov. 15 , although a dozen or so had clauses entitling them to be paid over the summer . </s><s> none has received a paycheck . </s><s> the nba argued that a tenet of labor law allows employers to withhold pay from employees during a lockout . </s><s> the league also called former union director simon gourdine to testify . </s><s> he said it was his understanding when he negotiated the old labor agreement in 1995 that players would not be paid if the owners chose to reopen the agreement and impose a lockout .	$ 800 million at stake in arbitrator 's decision on pay during lockout	decision due mon .  if over 200 nba guaranteed salary players will get paid .	arbiter to decide if players are to be paid during owner 's lockout	pro-player ruling by feerick would cost nba $ 800 million -- appeal certain .

exception rule	larry bird  original exception salary cap  induct hall fame	nba owner use larry bird exception exceed player s salary cap	exceptional larry bird induct basketball hall fame	larry bird  salary cap exception  hall fame  basketball  ewing	he was the classic small-town prodigy , with the creativity of a big-city profiteer . </s><s> when there was no shot to take , he invented a new one . </s><s> when there was no one to pass to , he reconfigured the play until a teammate was open . </s><s> larry bird , in the indiana countryside or inside boston garden , was a luminous exception to the governing rule . </s><s> that is why , six years after his retirement from the national basketball association , his name is again basketball 's most prominent , beginning with his induction to the hall of fame before 7,000 bird watchers at the civic center here on friday night . </s><s> deservedly enshrined as forever exceptional , he again becomes bird , the exception , the case study for a contentious and potentially disastrous labor war . </s><s> `` no , not really , '' bird said , when i asked whether he is troubled by the likelihood of his legendary name soon representing a symbol of greed to unsympathetic millions . </s><s> `` there 's always a player 's name attached to these things . </s><s> i know at the time i was very happy about it . '' </s><s> that would have been 1988 , when the celtics wanted to compensate bird with a $ 4.9 million bonus to push through his back pain , go on as their savior . </s><s> three years later , in a contract arbitration involving the knicks ' patrick ewing , the agent david falk would contend that the nba conspired with the celtics to circumvent the salary cap , in order to satisfy bird . </s><s> alan greenspan , i am sure , would agree that this salary cap is convoluted enough to give anyone a headache , so let 's just say it is a cap that does not exist when a team is negotiating with one of its own . </s><s> the process of unsealing the cap to re-sign a particular player eventually became known as making use of the larry bird exception . </s><s> and that is where we stand , as this onetime exception has become the very expensive rule the owners do n't want to play by anymore . </s><s> `` i can understand both sides , '' said bird , safely in the middle , between bird , the former exception , and bird , the present indiana pacers ' coach . </s><s> `` without getting into the exception , i think it 's very important for players to stay in the same place . '' </s><s> important , he meant , for franchise stability and fan identification . </s><s> `` you have a son who is 7 years old , he goes from 7 to 17 in the 10 years you 've played , '' bird said . </s><s> `` a lot of people in boston told me that they had followed me , from the time they were very young to when they were in college . '' </s><s> the bird years numbered only three celtics championships , but he was the best player pro basketball 's most famous team ever had . </s><s> he and magic johnson created a basketball renaissance that began during a college title showdown in salt lake city and spread worldwide , like an infectious smile . </s><s> they stood for the pass , for team play , but now their decade of selflessness has given way to one of selfishness . </s><s> the nba of michael jordan reached greater heights than anyone imagined it could , but it is a league that now suffers from a sickness of the soul . </s><s> `` if larry and magic had n't done what they did , we might not survive what we 're about to go through , '' said bill fitch , bird 's first celtics coach , who , with bill walton , stood with him on the night that , he said , gave closure to his playing career . </s><s> the owners , as always , are exaggerating their misery , but this time , it is much easier to not root for the players . </s><s> the president of the union is ewing , who one day commands players to boycott the world championships because the nba 's corporate fingerprints are on them , then the next day helps himself to some television commentary work for david stern 's women 's annex . </s><s> ewing leads the fight to protect the $ 100 million contracts for 21-year-olds who have achieved not a single playoff victory , linked to the big payoffs for agents like his friend falk . </s><s> the battle is waged in the name of a salary cap that makes exceptions of the unexceptional , rewards everyone as if they were bird . </s><s> `` i believe that in any field there has to be an allowance for the truly special ones , '' walton said . </s><s> `` but that group is very small . </s><s> when i was growing up in this sport , the only players who got the recognition were the champions , the ones who always made you feel good about the game , about sports . </s><s> that 's how larry and magic played , always dreaming of the special team . </s><s> it was n't about hype , about money . '' </s><s> that is not quite the case , nor should it have been . </s><s> bird was a businessman 's ball player from the day he arrived , with his flannel shirts and blue-collar ethic . </s><s> he hired the late bob woolf , one of the original heavy-hitting agents , and got himself a record rookie contract . </s><s> then he went out and turned a 29-victory catastrophe into a 61-victory contender . </s><s> a rare bird , an honest exception to the rule .	larry bird , original exception to salary cap , inducted into hall of fame	nba owners use the larry bird exception to exceed a player 's salary cap .	the exceptional larry bird inducted into the basketball hall of fame	larry bird , salary cap exception , hall of fame , basketball , ewing

labor dispute player  salary cap	nba cancel 144 preseason game  start regular season also doubt	nba labor talk collapse  preseason cancel  work stoppage threaten	in a decision that will almost certainly lead to the first work stoppage in national basketball association history , the league monday announced the cancellation of all 114 preseason games . </s><s> citing stalled negotiations with the players association over a new collective bargaining agreement , league officials said they would decide next week whether to cancel the first week of regular season games . </s><s> while the decision had been expected for 10 days , it nonetheless sent a strong signal that the owners and players will probably be willing to cancel at least part of the regular season in order to settle their labor dispute . </s><s> both sides agree that it would take at least three weeks to hold abbreviated training camps and sign over 200 free agents to new contracts . </s><s> privately , officials on both sides do not believe the season will start as scheduled on nov. 3 or even before december . </s><s> unlike major league baseball , the national football league and the national hockey league , the nba has never lost a regular-season game to labor strife . </s><s> `` since we 're not even negotiating , you have to conclude it 's very likely that we 're going miss some part of the regular season , '' deputy commissioner russ granik said monday night . </s><s> `` we 'll try and defer any decisions until the last minute , but right now it does not look good . '' </s><s> the two sides will meet on thursday _ their first official bargaining session since aug. 6 . </s><s> commissioner david stern and a group of owners walked out of a meeting after dismissing the merits of a new proposal from the players . </s><s> neither granik nor players association executive director billy hunter sounded as if this week 's meeting would go a long way toward the signing of a new agreement _ the precursor to playing again . </s><s> `` i do n't think you have any choice but to miss games at this point , '' hunter said . </s><s> `` in fact , i think the they 've intended it all along . </s><s> they 've locked us out , they 've refused to negotiate and they 've given us a proposal that 's ludicrous . '' </s><s> not only are both sides still awaiting the outcome of an arbitration decision that is due before oct. 18 - the fordham law school dean john feerick will rule whether or not more than 200 players with $ 800 million in guaranteed contracts should be paid during the lockout _ but the owners and players also are making time to win public opinion before they test their fans ' loyalties by canceling games . </s><s> monday in 11 cities throughout the country , the players are holding make-shift press conferences at training-camp venues , nba arenas and gymnasiums . </s><s> patrick ewing , the union president , and several teammates will speak at suny-purchase in purchase , n.y. , where the knicks train during the season . </s><s> with training camp originally scheduled to open on oct. 6 , the message from the players is clear : if the owners would call an end to the lockout , we would be ready to play today . </s><s> about 100 players are expected to attend , speak and sign autographs for fans afterward . </s><s> `` i wish they would put their energies into trying to negotiate a deal rather than the various other things that they 've been doing , '' granik said . </s><s> the dispute is essentially over how the owners and players will judiciously divvy up $ 2 billion in income . </s><s> it began last year with the contention by the owners that their employees were receiving more than their fair share of the pot . </s><s> the owners were allowed to terminate the current agreement because of a clause that enabled them to do so after player salaries reached 53.8 percent of total basketball-related income . </s><s> the owners say that figure is currently hovering around 57.1 percent . </s><s> though many economic issues need to be resolved , the main point of contention since the labor agreement expired and the owners declared a lockout on july 1 has been a clause which allows teams to pay their own free agents whatever they want , regardless of salary-cap rules governing the nba 's 29 teams . </s><s> called the larry bird exception , it was created to allow the hall of fame boston celtics forward to re-sign with the celtics near the end of his career . </s><s> michael jordan exercised the clause the last two years with the chicago bulls , earning more than $ 30 million per season _ figures more than $ 5 million more what a team is allowed to spend on all its players . </s><s> but with exorbitant salaries paid to several unproven stars over the last few years and $ 100 million deals sprouting up routinely , the owners are determined to swing the income pendulum back toward themselves by enforcing a restricted salary cap _ a hard cap _ and putting a ceiling on how much one player could earn . </s><s> `` last year , the players received about $ 1 billion dollars in salaries and benefits and we have made proposals that are guaranteed to increase that number by 20 percent over the next four years , '' granik said in a prepared statement . </s><s> `` our proposals would result in an average player salary of more than $ 3.1 million and a minimum salary for 10-year veterans of $ 750,000 . </s><s> unfortunately , the union leadership has been unwilling to give any serious consideration to what we have offered . '' </s><s> hunter labeled those claims as optimistic projections , and shot down a number of new proposals presented to the players on sept. 25 . </s><s> `` if they had left the current deal in place , we would have gotten much of that anyway , '' he added . </s><s> `` all we 're saying is , we 're not in position to accept a hard cap . '' </s><s> monday 's decision to cancel the preseason came less than two weeks after the nba indefinitely postponed training camp and canceled the first week of exhibition games . </s><s> through tickets sales alone , granik estimated that losing the exhibition season would cost the league between $ 35 million and $ 40 million . </s><s> decisions about the cancellations of regular season games are expected to be made next week , he added . </s><s> a league official said the games would be canceled in blocks of one or two weeks , depending upon circumstances regarding negotiations . </s><s> thursday 's bargaining session has suddenly become the last hope at starting the season on time . </s><s> `` hurdles could be overcome very quickly , but i have no reason to believe they will on thursday , '' granik said . </s><s> added hunter : `` of course they do n't expect much to get done . </s><s> when russ and david decide the negotiations are going to be real and substantive , then something will happen . </s><s> what they 're banking on now is that the players are going to miss paychecks and cave in november . </s><s> it 's as if they 've ingested something that has to pass . </s><s> and once it passes , then they 'll negotiate . ''	nba cancels preseason games .  date of season opener in doubt	nba preseason games cancelled .  labor dispute over players ' salary cap .	nba cancels all 144 preseason games ; start of regular season also in doubt	nba labor talks collapse .  preseason cancelled .  work stoppage threatened .

lockout	nba owner player negotiate salary dispute  season game doubt	player owner make little progress reach agreement strike	nba player  lead ewing  say   propose salary cap  claim lockout	patrick ewing did not want to sound like a striking longshoreman demanding health benefits . </s><s> `` i 'm not going to try and put it in dollars and cents . '' </s><s> but ewing , president of the national basketball association players association , played the public-relations game tuesday by expounding on the themes of labor unrest : strong-willed unity and short-sighted proposals . </s><s> on the day when training camps were scheduled to begin , players from across the country held news conferences in 14 nba cities to proclaim themselves ready to practice for the regular season . </s><s> `` we want to show the public that we , as players , want to play , '' said ewing , who was flanked by five teammates . </s><s> `` today is supposed to be the start of training camp . </s><s> we want to practice and we want the season to start . </s><s> but unfortunately , the owners have locked us out and the season has been postponed . '' </s><s> the owners and players are scheduled hold their first bargaining session since aug. 6 on thursday in manhattan . </s><s> neither side is predicting progress toward signing a new collective bargaining agreement and beginning the season as scheduled on nov. 3 . </s><s> the league canceled the entire 114-game preseason on monday . </s><s> next week , it will consider canceling the first-ever regular season games in league history . </s><s> with wide philosophical differences on how $ 2 billion annual income should be distributed , both sides have privately said they do n't expect to play a regular season game before december . </s><s> billy hunter , the union 's executive director , offered a glimmer of hope . </s><s> he spoke optimistically about the potential for a quick resolution . </s><s> standing a few feet away from ewing , he said , `` i hope the owners and commissioner have gotten the message : that we 're serious about a deal . </s><s> i 'm prepared to make a quantum leap . </s><s> i do n't think we 're that far off . </s><s> i think there 's a lot jockeying , a lot of rhetoric and a lot of games being played . </s><s> but if and when the owners decide they want a deal , then they 'll get one . '' </s><s> but soon after , he began lambasting the owners ' latest proposal , which includes the eventual phasing out of the larry bird exception _ the clause that enables free agents to earn unlimited salaries from their current teams . </s><s> that clause represents the major rift in negotiations . </s><s> owners would like to implement a restrictive salary cap that would eventually put a ceiling on how much one player can earn . </s><s> `` i do n't know if this is going to come to a speedy resolution , '' ewing said . </s><s> `` they 're entrenched with what they want , which is a hard cap . </s><s> and we feel with a hard cap , we as players , can not survive . </s><s> we would have to be stupid and ignorant to accept that deal . '' </s><s> said hunter , `` if you go for their proposal , it 's just a joke . </s><s> it 's a step backwards . </s><s> i can not understand it . </s><s> if the intent was to reach an agreement at this late stage or to negotiate in earnest , this was the wrong way to go about it . '' </s><s> league officials did not respond to the players ' comments . </s><s> `` all we want is our fair share and we feel like they 're trying to take that away from us , '' ewing said . </s><s> `there 's a perception that we 're on strike . </s><s> it 's the other way around . </s><s> we 've been locked out . '' </s><s> besides ewing , the other knicks included former union president buck williams , former vice president herb williams , allan houston and john starks . </s><s> marcus camby also showed up briefly . </s><s> when the media horde closed in , however , the third-year forward went to look for his late-arriving teammates inside the practice facility . </s><s> he was stopped at the gym door , which was locked . </s><s> `` they locked us out , '' said rockets forward mario elie . </s><s> `` everybody 's got to get that corrected . </s><s> it 's not on us . </s><s> they 're the ones that closed us down . '' </s><s> the stalemate has elicited talks of possibly bringing in a mediator in the coming weeks , as major league baseball did in 1994 to help solve its labor dispute . </s><s> but the players are convinced commissioner david stern and the owners are set on testing their resolve before any genuine headway can be made in negotiations . </s><s> that means missing paychecks in november , something ewing said the players are prepared to do . </s><s> both sides are still awaiting the outcome of an arbitration decision that is due before oct. 18 . </s><s> fordham law school dean john feerick will rule whether or not more than 200 players with $ 800 million in guaranteed contracts should be paid during the lockout . </s><s> feerick 's decision could give new leverage to one side . </s><s> but if the players lose the arbitration , more than 400 athletes _ many with extravagant lifestyles and tremendous financial obligations _ will have their allegiances instantly tested . </s><s> `` it 's like they want to see how strong we are , '' ewing said . </s><s> `` based on the proposals we 've received , we 're very strong . '' </s><s> `` so far , it seems as though the nba is dug in on their position , '' buck williams said . </s><s> `` i do n't think they 're too concerned at this point about making a deal . </s><s> he added , `` we 're about as far apart as the grand canyon right now . ''	nba owners call for salary cap .  players complain of lockout	nba owners and players to negotiate salary dispute ; season games in doubt .	players and owners making little progress reaching agreement in strike	nba players , led by ewing , say `` no '' to proposed salary cap -- claim lockout

jeopardy	substantive talk yet fail break nba deadlock	nba player make proposal  owner decide fri  99 game cancel	nba  labor dispute player  cancel first two week season	though player offer plan  first time history nba game cancel	the national basketball association , embroiled in a labor dispute with its players , tuesday canceled the first two weeks of the 1998-99 season . </s><s> it is the first time in the league 's 51-year history that it will lose regular-season games . </s><s> the nba 's deputy commissioner , russ granik , announced the cancellation after nearly three and a half hours of meetings concluded at a manhattan hotel . </s><s> the decision to cancel 99 games between nov. 3 and nov. 16 came after the players association proposed the implementation of a tax system instead of a hard salary cap , a proposal the owners said they would respond to by friday . </s><s> `` we tried our best today to try to do what was possible to salvage the season , '' said alonzo mourning , the miami heat center . </s><s> `` unfortunately , it did n't work out . '' </s><s> after 35,001 games without a blemish , the nba now joins the national hockey league , the national football league and major league baseball in having lost games to a labor dispute . </s><s> taking into account that a three- to four-week period would be needed for training camp and free-agent signings before the season starts , the league said it would decide in two weeks whether to make further cancellations . </s><s> `` i 'm very sad and disappointed , '' said the nba commissioner , david stern . </s><s> `` i consider it to be a collective failure , but i honestly do n't know what else we could have done . </s><s> i do things that i like to think are in the best interests of the game . </s><s> and i believe this is . '' </s><s> the decision came after what both sides agreed were the most substantive talks since the owners imposed a lockout on the player july 1 . </s><s> seventeen players , including union president patrick ewing and vice presidents mitch richmond , herb williams , dikemebe mutombo and ty corbin , attended the meeting along with stern , granik and five members of the ownership committee _ madison square garden president dave checketts and owners abe pollin of washington , gordon gund of cleveland , les alexander of houston and jerry colangelo of phoenix . </s><s> the talks featured what the players association implied were a bevy concessions made to the owners that they felt would accommodate the league 's desire to swing the revenue pendulum back toward the owners . </s><s> the dispute involves the distribution of approximately $ 2 billion in league-wide income . </s><s> the main sticking point has been the owners ' insistence on a salary cap without exceptions , the implementation of which they believe would bring player salaries ' in line with revenue growth . </s><s> while the players did not discuss the elimination of the larry bird exception _ a clause that allows a player to secure any amount of money he wants in re-signing with his current team _ they did address the exception in their taxation proposal . </s><s> the main points were as follows : _ a 50 percent tax would be imposed on salary earned above $ 18 million , a clause that would affect only a few players who exercised their bird rights . </s><s> for example , if a player made $ 20 million , the team would be forced to put $ 1 million into a fund that would most likely be distributed to low-revenue teams . </s><s> `` there could be provisions made for some players , '' said jeffrey kessler , the chief outside counsel for the union . </s><s> `` we do n't want to do anything that would encourage chicago from getting michael jordan back . </s><s> and i think the league feels the same way . '' </s><s> the proposal is similar to the luxury tax proposed by the union in 1995 during negotiations , but it would not be nearly as liberal . </s><s> _ a salary cap credit would go into effect if the league pays out more than 63 percent of revenues in salary . </s><s> whatever figure over that number reduces the salary cap the next year . </s><s> if the figure was $ 29 million over the salary cap , then the 29 teams would work with a salary cap $ 1 million less than the previous season . </s><s> but the players would have an assurance that the salary cap would go up at least $ 2 million before the credit goes into effect . </s><s> _ also , if the 63-percent threshold is met , a reduction of annual 20 percent raises would take effect for multi-year contracts . </s><s> players would either get raises of 10 percent or the rate of growth in league revenues . </s><s> the union said this clearly addresses the league 's desire to bring salaries in line with revenues . </s><s> since the owners re-opened the current agreement because 57.1 percent of revenue was going toward salaries , the 63-percent figure would probably have to come down substantially for the owners to agree to such a proposal . </s><s> _ teams would get a right of first refusal on free agents after the fourth year for incoming rookies , meaning a player would be contractually obligated to the same team for the first four years of his deal . </s><s> currently , the rookie scale is three years and includes a clause that enables a player to exercise his bird rights after two seasons _ a clause kevin garnett parlayed into an astronomical $ 126 million deal last year with minnesota . </s><s> _ finally , the players agreed to make marijuana a banned substance . </s><s> details of testing have not been negotiated and no specific discussions took place regarding testing for performance-enhancing drugs , a provision the owners included in their last proposal . </s><s> in return for the concessions , the players want an increase in the minimum salary _ currently $ 272,500 _ and creation of an average salary exception . </s><s> this would allow every team above the salary cap being able to sign one free agent per year for the average salary _ currently $ 2.6 million . </s><s> `` we 're buoyed by the fact for the first time they 've decided to submit a counterproposal , '' the union 's executive director , billy hunter , said . </s><s> `` i do n't know if i 'm more optimistic , but i can earnestly say we can look our ballplayers in the eye and say we made a valiant effort . '' </s><s> asked if the players would finally be tested financially with the cancellation of games , hunter added : `` it 's not about us blinking . </s><s> we want to reach an agreement . </s><s> we 're tired of the rhetoric , we 're tired of the game-playing . </s><s> our position all along has been we do n't want to accept a bad deal . '' </s><s> granik said refunds to fans would be made at end of the calendar month and that the first refund would include monies for canceled preseason games . </s><s> he estimated the losses into the `` hundreds of millions of dollars . '' </s><s> `` i think we have serious concern whether a tax system can address the kind of needs we have economically , '' he added . </s><s> `` but there 's some possibility . '' </s><s> added stern , `` we owe it to the fans to go back and look at the notion whether a tax rate might begin to achieve the result we wanted . </s><s> it does n't look promising , but we 're going to spend the next two days to see if we can give a favorable response . '' </s><s> though the decision to cancel games was not surprising , it did represent a major shift in prior labor stalemates . </s><s> both sides reluctantly hammered out a deal in 1995 before the start of training camp with the sole notion of not missing games and preserving the nba 's perfect record . </s><s> tuesday , they could not come to such an accord . </s><s> `` i 'd like to think these our the last games we have to cancel , '' granik said . </s><s> `` but unless this or something else works , or there 's some dramatic breakthrough , i think that is certainly not all of the season that 's in jeopardy . ''	most substantive talks yet fail to break nba deadlock	nba players make proposal ; owners to decide by fri. ; 99 games cancelled .	nba , in labor dispute with players , cancels first two weeks of season	though players offer plan , for first time in history nba games cancelled

lockout	strike player await arbiter s decision pay basketball strike	arbitrator  feerick  nba player  guarantee contract  salary  lockout	more than 220 national basketball association players with guaranteed contracts will find out monday whether they are to be paid during the management lockout , a long-awaited arbitrator 's decision that may affect leverage in the league 's dispute with the players and have major ramifications on american sports-labor law . </s><s> but neither the players nor the owners are counting on the ruling by the arbitrator , john feerick , to speed up negotiations , especially if feerick finds in favor of the players , an award that could approach $ 800 million in salaries . </s><s> nba attorneys have indicated to the union that if the decision goes against management , they will seek to have it vacated by appealing to the u.s. district court in manhattan and then , if necessary , to the 2nd u.s . </s><s> circuit court of appeals , a process that could prevent the players from getting paid for several months . </s><s> the nba has already canceled the first two weeks of the regular season because of the labor dispute . </s><s> the league has other litigation pending in u.s. district court in manhattan . </s><s> if the players win the ruling , the nba intends to renew its motion to disqualify feerick . </s><s> the motion was brought last summer on the grounds that no collective bargaining agreement existed and , therefore , he had no jurisdiction to hear the matter . </s><s> `` if he rules in our favor , i think it emboldens the spirit and the resolve of the players , '' said billy hunter , union executive director . </s><s> `` but we understand that wo n't end the lockout . </s><s> it just means they have to pay 200-some players . </s><s> and there is still other litigation alive that may take a while to resolve . </s><s> at most , it 's a hollow victory . '' </s><s> feerick will have taken the full 30 days to render his decision . </s><s> whatever he decides , his ruling will be watched carefully . </s><s> there is no precedent for locked-out athletes being paid . </s><s> during the nba summer lockout of 1995 , players who missed paychecks did not file a grievance . </s><s> neither did national hockey league players who were locked out for the first three months of the 1994-95 season . </s><s> the union argued that owners should have protected themselves by inserting clauses about non-payment for lockouts and strikes into individual player contracts . </s><s> in support of its arguments , the union pointed to clauses in a few individual player contracts that contained language precluding payment during a lockout . </s><s> the league is relying on the basic tenets of labor law , which hold that employees not be paid during strikes or lockouts . </s><s> a ruling for the union would be significant for all future negotiations between players and owners . </s><s> the deterrent factor of a lockout is that employees subject to a collective bargaining agreement do not get paid once the agreement expires and they are unable to reach a new agreement . </s><s> if feerick finds in favor of the players , there will be no economic incentive for those with guaranteed contracts to reach an agreement quickly . </s><s> they would essentially be paid for not playing basketball . </s><s> if feerick finds in favor of the owners , the reality of not being paid may spur the players to reach an agreement more quickly . </s><s> but hunter disputed this notion , and in a conference call friday talked openly about the entire season 's being canceled before the players would back away from their ultimate goals . </s><s> `` i 'm not at all concerned , '' hunter said . </s><s> `` there 's been no demonstration that there 's going to be a change in our resolve . </s><s> after the players saw these proposals from the league and the recent posturing by nba owners , well , i had two players call me up and tell me , if need be , they 'd be willing to hock everything they 've got . '' </s><s> another significant development may be thedeparture of many players to europe until the dispute is settled , according to at least two player agents . </s><s> `` i think it would be a case-by-case basis , but yes , there 's already some people talking about that , '' said bill strickland , a member of the union 's agents advisory committee . </s><s> steve kauffman , another member of the committee , said he would explore the possibility that one client , nets center rony seikaly , would sign with a professional team in greece . </s><s> `` we would n't look to void his deal with the team , '' kauffman said . </s><s> `` but we would want him to have the right for him to work temporarily until he could come back and honor his contract . ' </s><s> russ granik , nba deputy commissioner , said the league has approved the idea of players ' earning a living elsewhere until the lockout is settled . </s><s> proposals exchanged last week that included the concept of a luxury-tax system on player salaries appeared to reflect the first signs of progress in negotiations since the lockout began july 1 . </s><s> but both sides have termed the figures in each other 's proposal as unacceptable , and it was unclear whether either side was willing compromise . </s><s> `` i do n't think we should get too carried away about the possibilities just yet , '' granik said . </s><s> `` when they explored the idea of a tax system , we were taking the players at their word that they wanted to make some headway . </s><s> but to call their first proposal meaningless is charitable . </s><s> they proposed something that has no impact . </s><s> as it stands , that ca n't be the solution . '' </s><s> the owners ' goal is to slow the growth of player salaries in relation to leaguewide revenue over the next three years , while the players want to keep earning as much as possible .	nba owners and players await arbitrator 's decision on pay during lockout	ruling mon .  if nba guaranteed contract players will be paid during lockout .	striking players await arbiter 's decision on pay during basketball strike	arbitrator , feerick , nba players , guaranteed contracts , salaries , lockout

player dominate nba labor battle	union minimum  jordan  free agent  payroll rise  lockout  union suicide	as labor battles go , the current one between the national basketball association and its players is weird even by sports standards . </s><s> there is a real possibility that most , if not all , of the coming season will be canceled . </s><s> in this union battle it is the interests of the best paid , not those who make union scale , that are dominating the discussion . </s><s> and here it is some of the workers , not the management , who are considering trying to make the union disappear . </s><s> the current arrangement has produced an unbalanced pay scale of immense proportions . </s><s> last year more players than ever before received the union minimum , then $ 242,000 for rookies or $ 272,000 for veterans . </s><s> the number of players making $ 1 million to $ 2 million a year _ the middle class , in nba terms _ fell sharply . </s><s> but michael jordan made $ 33 million . </s><s> this should not be a surprise . </s><s> sports is an entertainment business , not unlike movies . </s><s> big stars get millions , while most get union scale . </s><s> over the years , nba efforts to stem the rise of salaries have failed . </s><s> the most important loophole in its salary cap lets a team sign its own free agent for whatever it is willing to pay . </s><s> when that was adopted , it was assumed that no team would pay a lot more than a rival could pay . </s><s> but it has not worked out that way . </s><s> in the current negotiation , the league has offered to guarantee that its payroll will rise 20 percent over the next four years , from $ 1 billion to $ 1.2 billion , and says it is open to proposals to split that money any way the players want , whether by raising the minimum salary or guaranteeing raises for veterans . </s><s> the union says it is worried about that middle class , but seems determined to preserve the free market . </s><s> the league got its broadcasters , nbc and time warner 's cable channels , to agree to pay this year 's television fees whether or not there are any games to broadcast . </s><s> ( they will be paid back in later years , either through reduced fees or extra games to show . ) </s><s> owners hoped the players would think management was willing to wait them out , and come to terms with only a small part of the season canceled . </s><s> but the union is acting unhurried . </s><s> it turned aside requests for negotiations this week , saying the players had to meet first . </s><s> then there is the issue of union suicide , a tactic that was rejected by the players in 1995 . </s><s> the idea is that if the players had no union , it would be illegal under antitrust laws for the owners to collude . </s><s> the sky would be the limit . </s><s> that tactic might fail . </s><s> the courts could reject a union decertification vote as a sham , and in any case some players may fear that teams would feel free to offer less than the old union minimum . </s><s> but if the players go that route , it could be a long time before real negotiations get going . </s><s> billy hunter , the union 's executive director , warned the owners this week that a prolonged lockout could destroy the league 's popularity . </s><s> that was what all the seers said four years ago , when baseball 's world series was canceled by labor troubles . </s><s> but fan memories are relatively short , and now baseball seems more popular than ever . </s><s> with that in mind , both owners and players may choose to battle on for months .	whole nba season may be cancelled .  talks focus on interests of best paid	nba labor battle goes on ; most or all season games possibly cancelled .	interests of the few best paid players dominating nba labor battle	union minimum , jordan , free agent , payroll rise , lockout , union suicide

face rebel force west  congo  north  sudan	rebel  likely adf  attack chiondo  kill 6  soldier kill 2 rebel	rebel kill 6 civilian congolese village  ugandan troop aid rebel	congolese rebel kill six people ugandan drive across border	rebels attacked a village in western uganda and killed six civilians before soldiers drove them off , a military spokesman said thursday . </s><s> the attack occurred overnight wednesday in the village of chiondo near kasese , 270 kilometers ( 170 miles ) west of the capital kampala , said the spokesman , who identified himself only as lt. majera . </s><s> majera said the attackers were believed to be rebels of the allied democratic forces who operate from bases in the foothills of the rwenzori mountains that straddle the uganda-congolese border . </s><s> he said the rebels likely fled back to their bases after the attack . </s><s> majera said the attackers avoided a nearby army post when they shot up the village . </s><s> it was the gunfire that alerted the soldiers , he said , adding that they killed two of the assailants . </s><s> the various rebel groups operating in the region often attack with knives or machetes , either to save on ammunition or because they do n't have guns . </s><s> he had no further details . </s><s> under an agreement earlier this year with congo , uganda sent troops into the neighboring country to flush out the adf fighters . </s><s> president yoweri museveni insists they will remain there until ugandan security is guaranteed , despite congolese president laurent kabila 's protests that uganda is backing congolese rebels attempting to topple him . </s><s> the anti-kabila rebels claim the ugandan rebel lord 's resistance army , which operates in northern uganda and enjoys support from sudan , is fighting alongside kabila 's forces together with sudanese soldiers . </s><s> the government-owned daily new vision reported thursday that lra leader joseph kony was badly wounded last week and is in hospital in juba , the largest town still under government control in southern sudan . </s><s> the sudan people 's liberation army , which is fighting the government in khartoum for autonomy for southern sudan , has waged pitched battles with government troops in the past week as it moves on juba , spokesmen for both sides say . </s><s> new vision quoted ugandan minister of state for security muruli mukasa as saying kony 's largest camp at al-gabelain , 38 kilometers ( 24 miles ) south of juba , was destroyed last week when the spla took control . </s><s> muruli said the lra had been planning to bomb several sites in the ugandan capital , including the parliament building , state-run radio uganda , unidentified embassies and other public sites , the newspaper said .	uganda faces week envoy region africa howard wolpe congressman wamba	congo rebel use internet rally international support	antikabila rebel website  post mission statement medium campaign	internet use congolese rebel spread message world	congolese rebel use ussupported internet campaign congo leader	congolese rebels have taken their two-month campaign to oust president laurent kabila to the internet . </s><s> `` we have to explain to the world audience who we are and what we 're fighting for , '' rebel leader ernest wamba dia wamba said on friday . </s><s> `` besides , the ( kabila ) government has been using the internet to tell their side of the story . '' </s><s> the 56-year-old history professor at the university of dar es salaam in tanzania said supporters of the congolese rally for democracy in the united states have created a web site for the rebellion . </s><s> the site _ www.prairienet.org/panafrican/cdm _ has been set up on the donor-supported prairenet community network in eastern illinois . </s><s> the rebels are a coalition of ethnic tutsis , disenchanted members of kabila 's army and political opponents who accuse kabila of power-grabbing , mismanagement , corruption and sowing dissent among congo 's 400 tribes . </s><s> after an initial lightning advance in the far west of africa 's third-largest nation , the rebels were stopped at the outskirts of the capital , kinshasa , by troops from angola , zimbabwe and namibia , who are backing kabila . </s><s> since then , the rebels have been confined to a chunk of territory in the extreme eastern part of the country where their rebellion was declared aug. 2 . </s><s> wamba said the rebels control 40 percent of congo , an area of 15 million people . </s><s> so far , kabila has refused to negotiate with the rebels , accusing them of being the puppets of neighboring rwanda and uganda . </s><s> posting the rebel mission statement on the internet is just part of the media campaign . </s><s> last week , wamba dispatched two of his top aides to the united states and europe to lobby for political support and raise public awareness about the conflict in congo . </s><s> `` world leaders , diplomats and are not familiar enough with our cause . </s><s> they still talk about tutsis leading the rebellion . </s><s> well , i 'm not a tutsi , '' wamba said . </s><s> jacques depelchin , the movement 's vice president and a former lecturer at the university of california at berkeley , met in washington earlier this week with the u.s. special envoy in the great lakes region of central africa , howard wolpe and with congressmen , wamba said .	congo rebels use internet to strategic congo town retreat kinshasa	after a day of fighting , congolese rebels said sunday they had entered kindu , the strategic town and airbase in eastern congo used by the government to halt their advances . </s><s> etienne ngangura , a rebel spokesman , said the rebel fighters were inside kindu and had taken the adjacent , large airbase , 380 kilometers ( 235 miles ) west of goma , the rebel stronghold . </s><s> `` we 're in the town and the airport , '' ngangura said . </s><s> he offered no details and the report could not be confirmed independently . </s><s> rebel military sources said the fighting continued inside kindu where the rebels were apparently meeting stiff resistance . </s><s> the rebels _ ethnic tutsis , disenchanted members of president laurent kabila 's army and opposition politicians _ took up arms aug. 2 accusing kabila of mismanagement , corruption and creating division among congo 's 400 tribes . </s><s> the rebels have targeted kindu since late august , when they were forced to retreat from the outskirts of the capital , kinshasa , after troops from angola and zimbabwe came to kabila 's aid . </s><s> troops moving south from kisangani , the largest city under rebel control , and moving west , had made steady gains against kindu , which the government apparently used to build up force for a planned counter-offensive . </s><s> apart from kindu , ngangura said rebel fighters took buta , 120 kilometers ( 75 miles ) north of kisangani and on the main road in northern congo that links sudan and the central african republic . </s><s> also on sunday , ngangura said the rebels took bumba , 400 kilometers ( 250 miles ) northwest of kisangani . </s><s> these reports could not be confirmed independently either . </s><s> rebel leaders said a victory at kindu would confirm rebel strength , boost fighters ' morale and perhaps persuade others to join them . </s><s> the rebels want direct negotiations with kabila . </s><s> but the president has so far refused , accusing the rebels of being puppets of rwanda and uganda , which kabila has accused of orchestrating the rebellion . </s><s> the conflict in central africa has drawn in most of congo 's nine neighbors , and regional diplomatic initiatives have so far failed to stop it .	congo rebels advance in east after retreat from capital kinshasa	congo tutsi rebels enter kindu and adjacent airbase .  met stiff resistance .	tutsis rebels claim advance on strategic airbase in congo village , kindu	congolese rebels take strategic congo town after retreating from kinshasa

kindu	the bloody bandages of injured rebels trucked back to this rear base wednesday offered evidence that the three-day battle for the strategic air base at kindu was not going well for those fighting to oust congolese president laurent kabila . </s><s> it was impossible to say who had the upper hand in the battle for kindu and its air base , which government forces have been using to launch airstrikes on eastern towns and to assemble ground troops . </s><s> rebel commander richard mondo said shelling and ground attacks , which began monday , continued on wednesday . </s><s> mondo said he was expecting air shipments of munitions to bolster the rebel offensive . </s><s> on wednesday , a truck unloaded a dozen wounded rebel fighters at kalima , a small town 80 kilometers ( 50 miles ) northeast of kindu , serving as a rear base for the attack . </s><s> sweaty and weary , some limping and others bandaged , they waited to be airlifted to a hospital in goma , the rebel stronghold 380 kilometers ( 235 miles ) east , on the rwandan border . </s><s> the rebels _ a coalition of ethnic tutsis , disenchanted soldiers in kabila 's army and opposition politicians _ faced stiff resistance . </s><s> in kinshasa , the ministry of defense said tuesday that the congolese armed forces , known as the fac , had killed 18 rebels in warding off the attacks . </s><s> `` kindu is effectively in the hands of the fac , which has now launched an offensive after defending its positions , '' said a ministry statement broadcast on state-run television . </s><s> `` the civilians there are cooperating fully with the fac as their counterparts did previously in kinshasa , '' the capital . </s><s> rebel leaders hope the capture of kindu will boost morale and demonstrate can carry their two-month rebellion into the rest of congo , africa 's third-largest nation . </s><s> the rebel victory would also open routes to katanga and eastern kasai provinces , rich in copper and diamonds . </s><s> the rebels targeted kindu since late august , when they were forced to retreat their march from extreme western congo to the outskirts of kinshasa after angola and zimbabwe sent troops to bail out kabila . </s><s> rebel commanders say their 2,000 fighters face an estimated 5,000 government troops , apparently reinforced by sudanese soldiers . </s><s> sudan denies involvement in congo . </s><s> the rebels accuse kabila of betraying the eight-month rebellion that brought him to power in may 1997 through mismanagement and creating divisions among congo 's 400 tribes .	outnumbered congo rebels challenge government control of kindu	3-day battle for kindu and airbase not going well for anti-kabila rebels .	rebels sustain casualties in battle for kindu airbase ; rebel destroy jetliner deny government	rebels in eastern congo on saturday said they shot down a passenger jet ferrying 40 government soldiers into a strategic airport facing a rebel assault . </s><s> a congo airlines executive said the victims were civilians being evacuated from kindu , about 1,000 kilometers ( 620 miles ) east of the capital , kinshasa . </s><s> neither claim could be confirmed independently . </s><s> stavros papaioannou , the president of the airline 's management committee , said a missile hit the rear engine of the boeing jet after the aircraft took off from kindu airport . </s><s> a rebel military commander , who requested anonymity , said the plane was carrying troops , although he did not explain how he knew this . </s><s> he said the plane was shot down while approaching kindu air base , where the rebels had deployed at least two surface-to-air missiles and more than 3,500 troops in preparation for a final assault on the government-held town . </s><s> alexis tambwe mwamba , one of rebel leaders , said from the rebel stronghold at goma , 380 kilometers ( 235 miles ) northeast of kalima , that fighters had intercepted government radio messages in kindu and knew in advance of the arrival of the aircraft . </s><s> he said the government had been using the boeing 727 to fly in troops and ammunition in kindu for several days . </s><s> papaioannou government defense kindu	rebel surround airfield  shoot passenger jet  situation uncertain	congolese rebel rwandan ally may poise overrun kindu	a day after shooting down a jetliner , congolese rebels and their rwandan allies pushed sunday through government defense lines , showing the confidence of a victor in a week-old battle for a strategic air base . </s><s> fighting in kindu , 32 kilometers ( 20 miles ) northeast of the elila river bridge , died down after the rebels fired a barrage of artillery into the government-held quarters and the air base , four kilometers ( two miles ) away . </s><s> rebel commander fino kabangu kalunga said the government forces , surrounded by 3,500 rebel troops from three directions , failed to respond to sunday 's attacks . </s><s> some troops reportedly retreated through a single road corridor leading out of the town . </s><s> on saturday , the rebels said they shot down a congolese boeing 727 which was attempting to land at kindu air base with 40 troops and ammunition . </s><s> in kinshasa , the private congolese airlines , which owned the aircraft , said the victims were civilians fleeing fighting in kindu . </s><s> it was not possible to confirm independently either claim . </s><s> kalunga said the airport , although still under government control , was in effect unoperational because of the rebel surface-to-air-missiles deployed nearby . </s><s> war-weary , physically exhausted and sweaty , hundreds of rebel troops and rwandan soldiers marched through dense tropical forest went to reinforce their comrades at kindu . </s><s> after a week of battling for kindu , rebel fighters had made little progress and failed to capture the town outright . </s><s> the rebels see kindu as a major prize in their two-month revolt against president laurent kabila , whom they accuse of mismanagement , corruption and warmongering among congo 's 400 tribes . </s><s> kabila has turned kindu into a launching pad for a counteroffensive against rebel positions in eastern congo . </s><s> the conflict has drawn in many of congo 's neighbors . </s><s> there are unconfirmed reports that troops from chad and the sudan are involved in defending kindu . </s><s> kabila accuses rwanda and uganda _ former allies who installed him in power in may 1997 after an eight-month rebellion _ of sponsoring the new fighting . </s><s> both countries say they have legitimate security interests in eastern congo and accuse kabila of failing to rid the common border area of rwandan and ugandan rebels . </s><s> tanks , aircraft and troops from angola , zimbabwe and namibia are supporting kabila . </s><s> the assistance was essential in routing an early rebel offensive in the west that had reached the outskirts of kinshasa in mid-august . </s><s> the rebels say they now control one-third of kindu and are poised to overrun the rest of the town . </s><s> under a scorching sun , the column of rebel reinforcements heading to kindu sneaked through abandoned roadside hamlets . </s><s> the silence of their march was interrupted only by the singing of crickets and the clanging of the bullet belts hanging around the soldiers ' necks . </s><s> soldiers walked by empty huts made of mud and palm leaves . </s><s> some rested in the shade of the umbrella-shaped acacia trees . </s><s> the soldiers stopped for the night at the bridge over the chocolate-colored elila river , which guards the path to kindu . </s><s> there was no immediate comment on the latest developments from the government in kinshasa , which claimed earlier in the week it was in control of the tarmac bridge .	capture of kindu eludes rebels as chad , sudan support congo government	congo rebels and rwandan allies push through government defenses at suffer  economy ruin congo rebellion tribal strife	tribal group fight congolese president kabila s government	civil strife  tribal rivalry  rebellion give rebel control east congo	back in the golden years , kasuku wa ngeyo had a farm and was the head of a 25,000-strong farmers organization in the northeastern breadbasket of this central african nation . </s><s> a quarter of a century later , the 56-year-old businessman who also ran hotels and a tourist camp is broke ; the farmers group is a memory . </s><s> inter-tribal rivalry , looting soldiers , rwandan refugees and two rebellions in as many years have wiped out half a million head of cattle here , slashed coffee and tea exports in half and turned congo 's bucolic eastern region of green pastures , sparkling volcanic lakes and snow-capped mountains into a war zone . </s><s> `` nobody is making money any more . </s><s> people are surviving on a sack of beans . </s><s> they are tired of insecurity and have little hope things will get better , '' said kasuku , the son of an italian settler and a rwandan tutsi refugee mother . </s><s> on aug. 2 , tutsis , political opponents , and disenchanted members of president laurent kabila 's army took up arms , accusing kabila of corruption , nepotism and fostering tribal strife . </s><s> the war has split africa 's third-largest nation between the government-held west and south and rebel-controlled east , and no political settlement is in sight . </s><s> goma , a small trading post at the head of lake kivu in eastern congo , is no longer the starting point for tourists trekking to see mountain gorillas . </s><s> today , its decaying buildings , empty shops and crumbling guest houses are home to rebel leaders , soldiers and people displaced by violence . </s><s> the rebels have promised to revitalize the economy by reducing taxes to boost investment . </s><s> they also say they will pay civil servants _ who have n't seen a paycheck in months or years _ and invite investors to buy tea and coffee farms and gold and diamond-mining concessions . </s><s> but the war has also increased tribal animosity _ especially toward ethnic tutsis , a tiny but highly successful minority in the eastern region . </s><s> in 1990 , the liberating effect of early political freedoms revived unresolved land disputes and led to clashes between the rwandan tutsis and hutus _ who had settled in eastern congo since the 1930s . </s><s> mai-mai warriors _ armed youths from the hunde and nande tribes who accuse tutsis of stealing their land , also joined the fighting . </s><s> in 1994 , nearly 1 million rwandan refugees engulfed goma , a town of 30,000 . </s><s> among them were former hutu soldiers and militiamen who took part in a 1994 genocide in neighboring rwanda in which more than half a million tutsis were killed . </s><s> they brought anti-tutsi ideology with them and sold weapons to congolese tribes , who then joined in the persecution of tutsi landowners and ranchers . </s><s> `` people misunderstood political freedoms for anarchy , '' said safari ngezayo , a farmer and hotel owner . </s><s> `` we tried to mediate between tutsis and hutus and other tribes , but how can you talk to people who have blood on their hands and genocide in their heads ? '' </s><s> in late 1996 , congolese tutsis backed by rwanda attacked the refugee camps , dislodged the hutu fighters and forced most of the refugees back home across the border . </s><s> after an eight-month rebellion backed by rwanda and uganda , dictator mobutu sese seko fled in may 1997 , and kabila took power . </s><s> he quickly changed the name of the country to congo , from zaire . </s><s> few people in northeastern congo expected another rebellion so soon . </s><s> `` i blame our politicians . </s><s> then i blame the foreign powers who kept meddling in our affairs . </s><s> it is they who supported mobutu and kabila , and we are paying the interest , '' kasuku said .	tribal warfare , foreign intrigue at basis of congo dispute	civilians suffer , economy in ruins from congo rebellions and tribal strife .	tribal groups fight congolese president kabila 's government and each other	civil strife , tribal rivalry , rebellion gives rebels control of east congo

difficult '' because of his concerns about the arrest of malaysia 's former deputy prime minister , a thai newspaper reported sunday . </s><s> asia-pacific leaders are scheduled to meet next month in
