warn russia avoid rumor sovietstyle economic measure	the united states is disappointed by the economic confusion within the new russian government of prime minister yevgeny primakov , said secretary of state madeleine albright on friday , and she warned russia about the dangers of an anti-western policy . </s><s> in her first comprehensive review of u.s.-russian relations since primakov was confirmed as prime minister last month , albright said washington was `` deeply concerned '' about russia 's direction and did not think the crisis there would soon abate . </s><s> `` we have heard a lot of talk in recent days about printing new money , indexing wages , imposing price and capital controls and restoring state management of parts of the economy , '' she told the u.s.-russia business council in chicago . </s><s> `` we can only wonder if some members of primakov 's team understand the basic arithmetic of the global economy . '' </s><s> while praising primakov , once her counterpart when he was foreign minister , as a pragmatist able to cooperate on key issues with washington , she had harsh words of warning for him . </s><s> `` our initial reaction to some of the direction he 's going in has not been particularly positive , '' she said , adding , `` the question now is whether that cooperation can continue . '' </s><s> the united states must keep up its aid to russia but is adjusting it to promote the building of democracy and student exchanges as well as arms control , albright said . </s><s> washington does not favor more direct aid . </s><s> `` more big bailouts are not by themselves going to restore investor confidence in russia , '' she said . </s><s> `` in the long run , the gap between russia 's needs and its resources must be met not by foreign bailouts but by foreign investment . '' </s><s> albright sharply criticized as self-defeating the `` many voices in russia who want to shift the emphasis in russia 's interaction with america and our allies from one of partnership to one of assertiveness , opposition and defiance for its own stake . '' </s><s> russia could not stand alone in the world , she said , and the united states ' ability `` to help russians help themselves will go from being merely very , very difficult to being absolutely impossible . '' </s><s> at the same time , she said , washington would not `` assume the worst , for there are still plenty of people in russia who will fight against turning back the clock . '' </s><s> and she urged the world _ and american critics _ to `` be patient with the workings of the democratic process in russia '' and `` not start each day by taking a census of reformers in the kremlin , '' a census that american officials themselves promoted before president boris yeltsin dismissed the previous government . </s><s> while moscow may continue to oppose any nato use of force against serbian forces in the southern province of kosovo , albright said , nato must be prepared to act regardless .	secretary albright expresses concern over russian economic confusion	economic confusion in russia causes disappointment in washington	u.s. voices disappointment about russia 's economic confusion	us warns russia to avoid rumored soviet-style economic measures .

demonstration	russian communist hope make yeltsin s economy target demonstration	russia  communistcreated demonstration yeltsin  economy  expect	if the communist party has its way _ and it has been planning for months _ millions of russians will take to the streets on wednesday for some of the biggest demonstrations in years . </s><s> but now that communists or politicians with the communist stamp of approval are running the country and its economy the question is what the marchers will be demonstrating against . </s><s> president boris yeltsin and his economic advisers were easy targets two months ago . </s><s> but yeltsin seems but a shadow of himself today , and his advisers are gone . </s><s> the communists , who have undergone a sort of resurgence by playing on the discontent , are working hard to cast themselves as outsiders in the government that they help run _ and to keep the focus of the protests on wednesday on yeltsin and his policies . </s><s> even that strategy may backfire , however , because discontent over yeltsin does not necessarily translate into support for his predecessors . </s><s> an adviser to the communist party leader , gennadi zyuganov , made headlines not long ago when he called the new government bourgeois . </s><s> the characterization was striking , because the new prime minister , yevgeny primakov , was one of zyuganov 's top choices for the post . </s><s> the deputy prime minister in charge of the economy , yuri maslyukov , is a communist party figure who once headed gosplan , the infamous central-planning program that helped bring the soviet union to ruin . </s><s> `` we do n't have slogans that are aimed against the government , '' the first secretary of the moscow communist party committee , alexander kuvayev , said in a recent interview . </s><s> `` all the slogans are aimed against the president and the economic course of the country . </s><s> only the president can fully be blamed for the course that has brought the country to this situation . '' </s><s> anger over russia 's fate , and their own , is drawing some russians back to soviet-style slogans and old-style hostility toward capitalism . </s><s> the ardently pro-communist newspaper sovietskaya rossiya devoted most of its front page on thursday to what it said were the results of a contest among readers for protest slogans . </s><s> the entries ranged from catchy to kitschy , from , `` legislator , official , banker _ study the constitution ; the exam is oct. 7 , '' to , `` imperialist ! </s><s> help russia return the exported capital , and we will pay the debts at once . '' </s><s> russia has seen nothing approaching this sort of economic chaos and despair since 1993 , when hyperinflation swept the economy . </s><s> there is no real way of knowing whether the latest travails will produce huge and ugly crowds or small , peaceful ones . </s><s> a deputy editor and political analyst at a newsweekly , itogi , masha lipman , said the situation was not unlike that of 1993 , when yeltsin sought , and won , a popular mandate in a referendum . </s><s> he used it to dissolve the communist-dominated parliament and increase his own power . </s><s> that led to an autumn showdown , the shelling of parliament by tanks and the total defeat , for the time being , of yeltsin 's legislative opponents . </s><s> `` you can interpret this demonstration as a communist mandate , but i do n't think they will act like yeltsin , '' ms. lipman said . </s><s> `` support for the communists is at its smallest level , maybe 20 percent . '' </s><s> in a survey of 1,714 people that was released last week the all-russian public opinion center said that nearly half the population supported the idea of demonstrations against yeltsin , but that barely one-tenth were likely to participate in any way . </s><s> `` nobody is interested in any sort of struggle , '' yuri levada , who heads the center , said in an interview . </s><s> `` this is mainly a general expression of a great wave of distrust of authorities , mainly the president . </s><s> he 's the great scapegoat for all our sins . '' </s><s> there seems to be little enthusiasm for demonstrations of any sort . </s><s> only a few thousand people turned out sunday for the fifth anniversary of the shelling of parliament and yeltsin 's subsequent triumph over the communists . </s><s> the communist party and the federation of independent russian unions , a leftist organization that says it is the main sponsor of the protests , predict that 9 million russians will participate on wednesday . </s><s> the government has vowed to keep order without resorting to force . </s><s> but it is concerned enough that it has summoned 11,000 police officers to patrol moscow and 6,000 military troops to intervene if violence erupts . </s><s> protests since 1993 have generally been tepid , a deep-seated feeling here . </s><s> some demonstrations last week , more or less practice runs , hinted at similarly dampened marches this year .	communists to demonstrate vs. president of government they control	communists target yeltsin economic policy with planned demonstration	russian communists hope to make yeltsin 's economy target of demonstrations	russia : communist-created demonstration against yeltsin , economy , expected .

defuse tension	egypt try mediate syrianturkish dispute  issue  kurd  water  israel	egyptian president hosni mubarak met here sunday with syrian president hafez assad to try to defuse growing tension between syria and turkey . </s><s> mubarak left after the two-hour meeting without speaking to reporters . </s><s> but egyptian foreign minister amr moussa , who accompanied him on the trip , said before their departure that mubarak `` backs dialogue for solving disputes and not military power and threats . '' </s><s> egypt 's middle east news agency quoted moussa as saying that arab support for syria should not be read in ankara as animosity toward turkey . </s><s> the agency also quoted syrian foreign minister farouq al-sharaa as saying that egypt and syria `` agreed on the graveness of the situation and that it should be dealt with diplomatically and not through confrontation or threats . '' </s><s> al-sharaa said he hoped mubarak 's trip to turkey would achieve results . </s><s> turkey 's foreign ministry said mubarak was expected in ankara , possibly on monday . </s><s> the talks in damascus came as turkey has massed forces near the border with syria after threatening to eradicate kurdish rebel bases in the neighboring country . </s><s> in a show of force on friday , turkish jets buzzed the syrian frontier , a turkish daily reported . </s><s> mubarak had made an unannounced trip to riyadh on saturday to get backing from king fahd of saudi arabia for his mediation efforts . </s><s> egypt , the arab world 's largest country with 60 million people , frequently tries to mediate arab and muslim disputes . </s><s> `` we have to stop the tension and contain it , and military threats should stop , '' mubarak told egyptian reporters on saturday . </s><s> `` i am ready to exert every effort in this direction in damascus and ankara . '' </s><s> moussa said mubarak had consulted by phone on saturday with assad and also conveyed a message to turkish president suleyman demirel through turkey 's ambassador to egypt , yasser yakis . </s><s> turkey long has accused syria of sheltering kurdish rebels , who have been fighting since 1984 for more autonomy for the kurdish population in southeastern turkey . </s><s> syria denies sheltering kurdish fighters . </s><s> late last week , turkey sent 10,000 troops into northern iraq to hit bases that turkish kurds use for their uprising . </s><s> for its part , syria has accused turkey of forming military alliances with israel that threaten arab security and undermine syria 's bargaining position in peace talks with the jewish state . </s><s> damascus also accuses turkey of building a series of dams on the euphrates river that threaten to reduce syria 's water supply . </s><s> editorials in the arab world called on both sides to show restraint . </s><s> in baghdad , the newspaper babil , published by iraqi leader saddam hussein 's son odai , reported the turkish incursion into iraq . </s><s> `` the region can not bear another conflict nor an increase in the present tensions , '' babil said in an editorial . </s><s> `` the turkish buildup does not serve anybody as much as it will harm turkey and syria and other parties in the region . '' </s><s> the english-language egyptian gazette said in an editorial on sunday that `` the syrians , understandably , harbor the belief that turkey is being manipulated by its new-found ally , israel , to pounce , '' with the dispute over kurdish rebels being a pretext . </s><s> israel , for its part , said it does not want to become involved in any military confrontation between syria and turkey . </s><s> `` we have no part in this tension , '' israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu told reporters in jerusalem on sunday . </s><s> `` we have taken steps to reassure syria . ''	egypt 's mubarak attempts mediation of turkey-syria dispute	egyptian president meets with syrian president in effort to defuse tensions	egypt 's president mubarak visits syria , turkey ; mediates to defuse tension	egypt tries to mediate syrian-turkish dispute ; issues , kurds , water , israel

diplomacy  jordan pleads higher interest region	turkey could attack kurd syria  egypt  mideast nation want resolution	as turkey kept up warlike rhetoric against damascus , egypt on sunday began shuttle democracy between the two neighbors to avoid a military confrontation over turkish kurdish bases in syria . </s><s> turkish president suleyman demirel said that turkey was in a position of self-defense and had suffered for many years from damascus ' sheltering of the autonomy-seeking rebels . </s><s> some 10,000 turkish troops were deployed this week on the turkish-syrian border , news reports said . </s><s> damascus denies that it is supporting the rebels , who wage cross-border raids from camps in iraq , iran and syria . </s><s> `` this situation is serious , '' demirel said . </s><s> `` i am not only warning syria , i am warning the world . </s><s> this can not continue . '' </s><s> he did not elaborate and it was unclear whether demirel was warning of a possible military confrontation . </s><s> but several military and civilian leaders here have said that if diplomacy fails , the military would be charged with solving the issue . </s><s> `` our patience has run out . </s><s> we are determined to take all necessary measures if we do n't see any response to our goodwill , '' the commander of turkish land forces , gen. atilla ates , said last week . </s><s> milliyet daily speculated sunday that turkey could stage pinpoint attacks in the syrian-controlled bekaa valley of lebanon , where turkey says the rebels have bases . </s><s> another report claimed the turkish army had been put on alert . </s><s> but defense minister ismet sezgin insisted sunday that war was the last resort . </s><s> `` i do n't believe it will come to that , '' he said . </s><s> the war in turkey 's southeast waged by rebels seeking autonomy for the country 's large kurdish minority , has killed some 37,000 people since 1984 . </s><s> in an attempt to the ease tension that many fear may spill over into the entire middle east , egyptian president hosni mubarak met with his syrian counterpart hafez assad in damascus . </s><s> egypt 's middle east news agency quoted syrian foreign minister farouq al-sharaa as saying that egypt and syria `` agreed on the graveness of the situation and that it should be dealt with diplomatically and not through confrontation or threats . '' </s><s> al-sharaa said he hoped mubarak 's trip to turkey this week would be fruitful . </s><s> jordan , which cautioned syria and turkey to take into consideration the higher interests of the region , offered to mediate . </s><s> fueling tension between the two countries are turkey and israel 's expanding military and diplomatic ties . </s><s> syria claims the ties are a threat to the arab world , and on saturday , damascus again accused turkey of plotting with israel to undermine syria . </s><s> `` we have no part in this tension , '' israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu said sunday . </s><s> `` we have taken steps to reassure syria . '' </s><s> israel has also instructed its army to limit military maneuvers along its border with syria to avoid giving any impression that israel is poised to act . </s><s> on sunday , the arab league called on turkey to end its military cooperation with israel . </s><s> syria and turkey have a long history of disagreements . </s><s> damascus is concerned by ankara 's plans to build dams on the euphrates river , a key source of water for syria , while turkey accuses syria of having aspirations over a turkish border province , hatay , which has a sizable arab population .	turkey renews threats against syria as egypt 's mubarak intercedes	iran offers to mediate growing dispute between syrian and turkey	sy/tu : egypts 's shuttle diplomacy , jordan pleads higher interests of region	turkey could attack kurds in syria ; egypt , mid-east nations want resolution

syria	lebanon denies harbor kurd  blame israel tension  urge peace	lebanon denies harbor kurd  side syria  blame turk  israeli	lebanon on monday denied it is harboring kurdish rebels and blamed israel for the rising tension between syria and turkey . </s><s> president elias hrawi traveled to damascus monday for a summit meeting with president hafez assad to show lebanon 's support for syria . </s><s> prime minister rafik hariri said his country backs syria in the dispute which was triggered sunday when turkish president suleyman demirel warned damascus that his country would not allow its neighbor to continue sheltering kurdish rebels . </s><s> syria denied the allegation . </s><s> ankara has sent troops to its border with syria , prompting fears of an attack . </s><s> the turkish daily milliyet speculated sunday that turkey could stage pinpoint attacks in the syrian-controlled bekaa valley of eastern lebanon , where turkey says rebels of abdullah ocalan 's kurdish workers party , or pkk , maintain camps . </s><s> lebanese foreign minister faris bweiz said monday there were no kurdish rebels based in his country . </s><s> `` the turkish authorities fully know that measures had been taken in syria and lebanon more than a 1 { ago to stop the activities of any pkk member , '' bweiz told a news conference . </s><s> `` we stand by syria 's side , especially in its call for resolving disputes with turkey in the framework of a peaceful dialogue , '' he said . </s><s> ocalan in recent years was believed to shuttle between the bekaa valley and neighboring syria . </s><s> hariri said in an interview with an-nahar daily that turkey 's military moves were the product of its newly forged military alliance with israel . </s><s> `` the turkish threats are the first outcome of the turkish-israeli strategic alliance , '' hariri was quoted as saying . </s><s> the lebanese press also accused israel of inflaming the tensions . </s><s> `` it is brilliant israeli sydneyhobart yacht race	sayonar  sydneytohobart race  ellison  morning glory  brindabella  snow	united states maxi sayonara looks set to continue the foreign domination of line honors in australia 's famous sydney to hobart yacht race , which starts saturday . </s><s> sayonara , raced by american computer billionaire larry ellison , has only been beaten once since it was launched in 1995 and is aiming for its second win in the 630 nautical mile bluewater classic . </s><s> if the 80-footer beats the local boats home into hobart , it will be third time in four years a foreign yacht has finished first . </s><s> new zealand endeavour trumped the locals in 1992 , sayonara won in 1995 and german 's morning glory set a race record of two days , 14 hours , seven minutes and 10 seconds the following year . </s><s> sayonara 's rivals are expected to be last year 's line honors winner brindabella of sydney and new australian maxi wild thing . </s><s> the contest for handicap honors appears more open , but there are many who believe sayonara could become the sixth yacht to do the line honors and handicap double . </s><s> ellison believes unforeseen damage is the only major barrier to victory . </s><s> `` she is a much more modern boat than brindabella , if we do n't break , we should beat brindabella , we should beat anybody , '' ellison said . </s><s> `` if we hold together we should win the race , the question is if this boat comes through and pays us a favor we would just love to knock off the record . '' </s><s> ellison says sayonara can knock half a day off morning glory 's record given the right conditions . </s><s> brindabella 's captain and owner george snow believes a new record is possible . </s><s> `` i think the front boats will be very close all the way down , which will be a great challenge , '' said snow . </s><s> `` we are well set up , we 've got the best crew we 've ever had and i think the boat is in great shape , '' snow added . </s><s> the race is tipped to start saturday under freshening north easters with the prospect of showers and a thunder storm before a southerly change of around 25-30 knots later in the day . </s><s> the southerly is expected to ease to 15-20 knots over sunday before swinging back to the north on monday with a west to south westerly change expected to move through tasmania and bass strait on tuesday when the first yacht is anticipated to finish .	u.s. maxi yacht sayonara favored in sydney-to-hobart race	u.s. yacht bermuda the favorite to win sydney to hobart yacht race .	us owned sayonara favorite in sydney-hobart yacht race	sayonar , sydney-to-hobart race , ellison , morning glory , brindabella , snow

lead	weather force 37 115 yacht retire  sword orion sailor miss	a major search was under way in bass strait off australia 's southeast coast on sunday night for an injured crewman swept overboard during the sydney-to-hobart yacht race . </s><s> the australian maritime safety authority ( amsa ) said it had alerted all shipping in the strait as high winds and huge seas smash into the remnants of the 115-boat fleet . </s><s> the australian navy has sent a sea king helicopter with night-vision and heat-seeking equipment to search the area and may send the frigate hmas newcastle into the area monday morning morning from sydney . </s><s> an amsa spokesman said they were alerted that the 13-meter sydney yacht sword of orion had been rolled in the heavy seas , with several crewmen being injured , including the unidentified man lost overboard . </s><s> another crewman has a broken leg . </s><s> the yacht , which has a crew of 11 , was halfway across bass strait heading towards hobart , capital of the island state of tasmania and the finish line in the annual race . </s><s> the ansa spokesman said search conditions were `` atrocious . '' </s><s> earlier , as winds gusting to 80 knots and seas of 35 feet caused havoc to the fleet , several rescues took place . </s><s> a police helicopter rescued a yachtsman swept overboard when the victorian yacht kingurra was rolled over in huge seas 19 nautical miles south of gabo island . </s><s> john campbell , an american , was in the water for about 40 minutes and was suffering from hypothermia when he was winched to safety by senior constable barry barclay , who dropped into 20-foot seas to secure campbell . </s><s> the victorian state police air wing used an infra-red night vision system to find campbell and the navy sea king is using the same equipment to try to find the man lost from sword of orion . </s><s> another helicopter lifted the entire crew of 12 from the dismasted vc offshore stand aside . </s><s> several crew members were injured in the dismasting , with one losing several fingers and another suffering head injuries . </s><s> a total of 37 yachts have been forced to retire from the 630-nautical-mile race , many having been dismasted or suffering injuries to crew . </s><s> meanwhile , american maxi sayonara is narrowly ahead of last year 's line winner brindabella . </s><s> although the two were forced to reduce sail and cut speed , they were still well inside the race record for the 630-nautical-mile race of 2 days , 14 hours , seven minutes and 10 seconds set by german maxi morning glory in 1996 . </s><s> ( djp )	crewman lost in bass strait as 80-knot winds smash into race contestants	search underway for crewman swept overboard in sydney to hobart yacht race	sword of orion crewman missing .  37 yachts out of race .  sayonara leading .	weather forces 37 of 115 yachts to retire ; sword of orion sailor missing

still miss  two yacht miss  race continue	gale-force winds and high seas battered yachts in the sydney-to-hobart race monday , killing at least two crew members and leaving two yachts missing . </s><s> the two dead were found on the 40-foot vessel business post naiad , about 100 kilometers ( 60 miles ) off the new south wales state town of merimbula , according to the australian search and rescue coordination center ( aussar ) in canberra . </s><s> one of the missing yachts _ b-52 _ was found mid-morning monday and was making its way towards eden on the new south wales coast , an aussar spokesman said . </s><s> the nine crew on board were thought to be safe and the vessel was sailing unassisted . </s><s> the spokesman said no word had been received on the fate of the winston churchill or the sailor swept from the deck of sword of orion on sunday night . </s><s> as of mid-morning monday , he had been in the water for 15 hours . </s><s> the yacht , which has a crew of 11 , was halfway across bass strait when it overturned . </s><s> the navy sent a sea king helicopter with night-vision and heat-seeking equipment to search the area and the frigate hmas newcastle was on its way to the area . </s><s> rescuers in more than 30 search aircraft were similarly unsure of the whereabouts and condition of solo globe and its crew . </s><s> seven others on board the business post naiad were put aboard a helicopter and flown to merimbula hospital , the center said . </s><s> the center was unable to identify the sailors , say how they died or give details on the injuries sustained by surviving crewmen . </s><s> there were unconfirmed reports that one of the dead sailors was british . </s><s> with winds gusting to 80 knots and seas swelling to 10 meters ( 35 feet ) , the race continued even as rescue teams searched for the three missing yachts . </s><s> race spokesman peter campbell said it was not known how long the sailor washed overboard could survive in the water . </s><s> `` it 's supposition , '' campbell said . </s><s> `` we had john quinn survive for 5 1-2 hours in 1993 and that was in the middle of the night in very severe conditions . '' </s><s> a police helicopter rescued a yachtsman swept overboard when kingurra rolled over 35 kilometers ( 22 miles ) south of gabo island . </s><s> john campbell , an american , was in the water for about 40 minutes and had hypothermia when he was taken to safety by senior constable barry barclay , who dropped into large swells to secure campbell . </s><s> despite the conditions , peter campbell said it was unlikely the race would be called off . </s><s> `` it does say in the instructions that it is the sole responsibility of the skipper of each yacht to decide whether he continues in the race or retires , '' he said . </s><s> the australian maritime safety authority ( amsa ) alerted all shipping in bass strait as high winds and huge seas smash into the remnants of the 115-boat fleet . </s><s> a total of 37 yachts have been forced out of the 1,160-kilometer ( 725-mile ) race . </s><s> many lost their masts or have injured crew . </s><s> the american maxi sayonara was narrowly ahead of last year 's winner , brindabella . </s><s> although the two were forced to reduce sail and cut speed , they were still well inside the race record of 2 days , 14 hours , 7 minutes , 10 seconds , set by german maxi morning glory in 1996 .	37 of 115 yachts forced out of sydney-to-hobart race	one yacht located but two remaining missing as storm batters participants	yacht b-52 found .  solo globe and winston churchill still missing .	sword of orion sailor still missing ; two yachts missing ; race continues

post naiad  bruce guy  phil skeggs  winston churchill  solo globe	two sailors died and 15 others were missing after gale-force winds and high seas battered yachts in the sydney-to-hobart yacht race monday . </s><s> `` there are two that have been confirmed deceased which is tragedy because in the 54-year history of the race i think there 's only two people who have died in it before , '' said australian maritime safety authority spokesman david gray . </s><s> the two dead were found on the 40-foot vessel business post naiad , about 100 kilometers ( 60 miles ) off the new south wales state town of merimbula . </s><s> gray said business post naiad owner-skipper bruce guy and first-time race participant phil skeggs were killed . </s><s> both men were from launceston in northern tasmania . </s><s> guy suffered a heart attack during one of the two occasions the yacht rolled , gray said , while skeggs drowned when he was unable to free himself from a safety harness . </s><s> their bodies were left on board the boat but attempts were being made to recover them as soon as possible . </s><s> race officials said guy sailed in two previous sydney to hobart yacht races . </s><s> grave fears were held for the safety of the nine crew on missing cutter winston churchill , while contact has been lost with the five crew aboard solo globe . </s><s> british sailor glyn charles was swept off the sword of orion on sunday night when the boat rolled in wild seas . </s><s> at 12:30 p.m. local time ( 0130 gmt ) monday charles had been missing for about 17 hours . </s><s> race officials said charles had sailed in four admiral 's cups and represented britain in the star class at the 1996 atlanta olympics where he finished 11th . </s><s> race spokesman peter campbell said it was not known how long gray could survive in the water . </s><s> `` it 's supposition , '' campbell said . </s><s> `` we had john quinn survive for 5 1-2 hours in 1993 and that was in the middle of the night in very severe conditions . '' </s><s> gray said about 56 sailors had been winched to safety . </s><s> `` there 's just many many injuries on those yachts that got knocked down . </s><s> a lot of them rolled over _ one rolled over twice , '' gray said . </s><s> `` they 've got hand , leg , facial injuries , they really got pounded yesterday . '' </s><s> one of the missing yachts _ b-52 _ was found mid-morning monday and was making its way towards eden on the new south wales coast . </s><s> the nine crew on board were thought to be safe and the vessel was sailing unassisted . </s><s> american john campbell was rescued by a police helicopter after being swerpt overboard when kingurra rolled over 35 kilometers ( 22 miles ) south of gabo island . </s><s> campbell was in the water for about 40 minutes and had hypothermia when he was taken to safety by senior constable barry barclay , who dropped into large swells to secure campbell . </s><s> `` i was definitely worried , '' campbell told united states television in seattle . </s><s> `` there was a point i did n't think i was going to survive . '' </s><s> `` ( barclay ) came down into the water only about 5 , 10 feet away from me and i swam to him pretty quicky . </s><s> i just threw my arms into the harness and they hoisted me up . '' </s><s> at least 37 yachts have been forced out of the 1,160-kilometer ( 725-mile ) race . </s><s> the australian maritime safety authority alerted all shipping in bass strait as high winds and huge seas smash into the remnants of the 115-boat fleet . </s><s> the american maxi sayonara was narrowly ahead of last year 's winner , brindabella . </s><s> although the two were forced to reduce sail and cut speed , they were still well inside the race record of 2 days , 14 hours , 7 minutes , 10 seconds , set by german maxi morning glory in 1996 .	two dead , 15 missing in sydney-to-hobart race .  maxi sayonara leads	two dead and fifteen missing during gale-force winds which struck yachts	15 missing , many injuries .  2 business post naiad sailors dead .	business post naiad , bruce guy , phil skeggs , winston churchill , solo globe

drown 24 hour  3 missing	glyn charles  sword orion  presume drown  three others miss	british sailor glyn charles was missing and presumed drowned _ becoming the third fatality in the sydney-to-hobart yacht race _ while three others remained missing in rough seas after nightfall monday . </s><s> robin poke , a spokesman for the australian maritime safety authority ( amsa ) , admitted it was unlikely the 33-year-old charles could survive more than 24 hours at sea after being washed off sword of orion on sunday night . </s><s> `` he has been out there in 10-meter ( 30-feet ) waves and 80-kilometer ( 50-mile ) winds , '' poke said monday . </s><s> `` he will be a superman if he makes it . '' </s><s> charles sailed in four admiral 's cups and represented britain in the star class at the 1996 atlanta olympics where he finished 11th . </s><s> two sailors died after gale-force winds and high seas battered the entrants . </s><s> four members from the veteran cutter winston churchill were winched to safety from a liferaft before dark monday . </s><s> two more crew from the winston churchill were plucked from a second liferaft late monday night , but three others who had been aboard the liferaft were still missing . </s><s> `` we are unsure about what has happened to the other three , it appears they were washed out of the liferaft , '' a spokesman for the authority said . </s><s> the two dead , both australians , were found on the 40-foot vessel business post naiad , about 100 kilometers ( 60 miles ) off the new south wales state town of merimbula . </s><s> the yacht 's owner-skipper bruce guy and first-time race participant phil skeggs were killed . </s><s> guy suffered a heart attack during one of the two occasions the yacht rolled while skeggs drowned when he was unable to free himself from a safety harness . </s><s> their bodies were left on board the boat but attempts were being made to recover them as soon as possible , rescue officials said . </s><s> `` dad loved sailing , '' said bruce guy 's son mark guy . </s><s> `` he loved the competition . </s><s> he also loved a beer and a talk after the race . </s><s> dad simply loved life . '' </s><s> winston churchill skipper richard winning was one of the four rescued . </s><s> `` the worst thing of the whole affair was that after we got into the life raft and became separated from the others , the damned thing capsized twice on these great seas at night which is bloody frightening , let me tell you , '' winning said . </s><s> `` you have got four of us underneath this little canopy and the next thing is you are upside down . </s><s> i would n't want to have spent another night out there . '' </s><s> the first recorded death in the race , which started in 1945 , was in 1984 when a 72-year-old yachtsman was washed overboard from yahoo 2 and presumed drowned . </s><s> in 1989 , a 58-year-old man died from head injuries on the yacht flying colours after a 45-knot gale off the southern nsw coast snapped the boat 's mast . </s><s> amsa spokesman david gray said about 50 sailors had been winched to safety in this year 's race . </s><s> `` there 's just many , many injuries on those yachts that got knocked down . </s><s> a lot of them rolled over _ one rolled over twice , '' gray said . </s><s> `` they 've got hand , leg , facial injuries , they really got pounded yesterday . '' </s><s> american john campbell was rescued by a police helicopter after being swerpt overboard when kingurra rolled over 35 kilometers ( 22 miles ) south of gabo island . </s><s> campbell was in the water for about 40 minutes and had hypothermia when he was taken to safety by senior constable barry barclay , who dropped into large swells to secure campbell . </s><s> `` i was definitely worried , '' campbell told united states television in seattle . </s><s> `` there was a point i did n't think i was going to survive . '' </s><s> `` ( barclay ) came down into the water only about 5 , 10 feet away from me and i swam to him pretty quickly . </s><s> i just threw my arms into the harness and they hoisted me up . '' </s><s> about half of the 115-yacht fleet have been forced out of the 1,160-kilometer ( 725-mile ) race . </s><s> the american maxi sayonara was narrowly ahead of last year 's winner , brindabella , and expected to cross the line tuesday .	three dead , three missing , many injured in sydney-to-hobart race	missing sailor presumed drowned after being washed off yacht during race	brit sailor glyn charles presumed drowned after 24 hours .  3 more missing .	glyn charles , from sword of orion , presumed drowned , three others missing .

rule ok	astronaut aboard liftoff space construction flight	2nd launch successful pressure problem  16 country cooperate	for the second day in a row , astronauts boarded space shuttle endeavour on friday for liftoff on nasa 's first space station construction flight . </s><s> `` let 's go do this , '' said commander robert cabana . </s><s> `` amen , '' replied a launch controller . </s><s> rain and cloudy skies were once again a threat . </s><s> but nasa was confident the master alarm in endeavour 's cockpit would behave ; it went off with just 4 { minutes to go in the countdown thursday , forcing a delay . </s><s> nasa has only five minutes or less each day to launch endeavour in order to meet up with the first space station part , which was put in orbit two weeks ago by the russians . </s><s> the shuttle contains the second station component . </s><s> the master alarm blared and red lights flashed just before the shuttle was to lift off early thursday . </s><s> by the time controllers traced the problem to a momentary drop in hydraulic pressure and decided to press ahead , it was too late _ they had missed the cutoff by a second or two . </s><s> `` sure , it 's frustrating , '' said bill readdy , shuttle program director and a veteran shuttle commander . </s><s> `` but we do things right . </s><s> we do things by the book , and we 're not going to cut any corners even if it means just shaving a second or two . '' </s><s> the six astronauts crawled out of the shuttle , and two threw up their hands . </s><s> cabana held up his thumb and index finger a half-inch apart : `` we were that close . '' </s><s> the problem was confined to one of endeavour 's three hydraulic pressure units . </s><s> the pressure dropped just long enough to trigger the alarm , evidently because of a sensitive switch , then returned to normal . </s><s> nasa engineers spent the day examining the problem , but found nothing wrong with any of the systems and were confident it would not reoccur . </s><s> endeavour 's flight is already a year late because of a cash crunch in russia , one of nasa 's partners in building the international space station . </s><s> the one-day delay cost nasa about $ 600,000 , mostly in fuel and overtime pay . </s><s> aboard endeavour is an american-made connecting passageway named unity . </s><s> the astronauts will use the shuttle robot arm to capture the russian space station piece and attach it to unity . </s><s> then , two spacewalkers will hook up all the electrical connections and cables between the two cylinders , and attach handrails and tools for future crews . </s><s> until the alarm sounded , it looked as though the weather would be the only problem . </s><s> rain and clouds moved in from the atlantic 1 { hours before liftoff , but drifted away with minutes to spare . </s><s> secretary of state madeleine albright and other dignitaries from around the world had gathered in the drizzle to see endeavour and its crew off . </s><s> `` here we have 16 countries cooperating on a venture to the future , '' said albright , who was expected back for friday 's attempt . </s><s> `` this is a good investment . ''	endeavour astronauts ready for second try at launch for space station	second attempt to launch endeavour after hydraulic pressure unit ruled ok	astronauts all aboard for liftoff on space construction flight .	2nd launch successful after pressure problem .  16 countries cooperating .

chamber	endeavor close connection space station cylinder	shuttle blinddock zarya  unity serve future passageway	endeavour and its astronauts closed in sunday to capture the first piece of the international space station , the russian-made zarya control module that had to be connected to the unity chamber aboard the shuttle . </s><s> stacking the two giant cylinders 240 miles above the earth was considered the most difficult part of the mission . </s><s> the job fell to nancy currie , the shuttle crane operator who had deftly hoisted and repositioned unity in the cargo bay on saturday . </s><s> the two station pieces are so big _ 77 feet from the tip of one to the tip of the other with a combined mass of 70,000 pounds _ that currie and her crewmates were going to have to rely on a computerized vision system and camera views , rather than direct line of sight . </s><s> such a `` blind '' docking had never been attempted before . </s><s> mission control gave the astronauts plenty of time for the tasks . </s><s> `` the main thing i 've tried to do for the last two years working on this flight is make sure we have time . </s><s> we have margin on everything , '' said flight director bob castle . </s><s> before beginning their final approach to zarya _ russian for sunrise _ the shuttle 's six astronauts had to steer clear of a chunk of a rocket launched last month from california . </s><s> mission control ordered the pilots to fire the shuttle thrusters to put an extra three miles between endeavour and the space junk , putting endeavour a total of five miles from the orbiting debris . </s><s> the smaller gap would have been `` probably a little too close for comfort , '' mission control said . </s><s> the bigger worry , by far , was over endeavour 's pursuit and capture of zarya , and its coupling with unity . </s><s> the shuttle 's 50-foot robot arm had never before been assigned to handle an object as massive as the 44,000-pound zarya , a power and propulsion module that was launched from kazakhstan on nov. 20 . </s><s> it will provide all the necessary electricity and steering for the fledgling space station until a permanent control module can be launched next summer . </s><s> the 36-foot , 25,000-pound unity will serve as a connecting passageway , or vestibule , for future modules . </s><s> in case zarya and unity could not be connected with the robot arm , two spacewalking astronauts would have to manually fit them together . </s><s> the astronauts would be going out anyway monday to attach electrical connectors and cables between the two components . </s><s> in all , three spacewalks were planned for endeavour 's 12-day flight . </s><s> nasa estimates 43 more launches and 159 more spacewalks will be needed after this mission to assemble the entire orbiting complex . </s><s> once completed , the 16-nation space station will have a mass of 1 million pounds , be longer than a football field , and house up to seven astronauts and cosmonauts .	endeavour astronauts set to join first two components of space station	astronauts prepare to capture zarya and connect it to the unity chamber	endeavor closes in for connection of space station cylinders .	shuttle to blind-dock with zarya .  unity to serve as future passageway .

house astronaut cosmonaut	endeavour astronaut connect russian us component space station	international space station construction underway  us  russian part mat	astronaut connect space station russian module us cylindrical module	zarya  unity join  electrical cable connection plan monday	endeavour 's astronauts connected the first two building blocks of the international space station on sunday , creating a seven-story tower in the shuttle cargo bay . </s><s> it was the first time that the russian-built zarya control module and the made-in-america unity chamber had ever touched . </s><s> it looked to be a perfect and , hopefully , long-lasting fit . </s><s> `` we have capture of zarya , '' commander robert cabana announced the two pieces came together . </s><s> `` congratulations to the crew of the good ship endeavour , '' replied mission control . </s><s> `` that 's terrific . '' </s><s> the 240-mile-high construction job began two hours earlier with nancy currie 's capture of zarya ( russian for sunrise ) using the shuttle robot arm . </s><s> `` we 're halfway home , '' cabana said . </s><s> then came the hard part : stacking the two giant cylinders in the cargo bay . </s><s> the two station pieces are so big _ 77 feet from the tip of one to the tip of the other with a combined mass of 70,000 pounds _ that currie and her crewmates had to rely on a computerized vision system and camera views , rather than direct line of sight . </s><s> this was the first time such a `` blind '' docking had ever been attempted . </s><s> currie positioned the solar-winged zarya , still on the end of the shuttle robot arm , several inches directly above unity . </s><s> it was slow going ; she wanted and needed perfect alignment . </s><s> once she was sure she had it , cabana fired endeavour 's thrusters , and the brief burst raised the shuttle and thereby unity enough for the docking mechanisms on the two station components to snap together . </s><s> the historical moment occurred above the south pacific . </s><s> the union _ intended to last the station 's 15-year or more lifetime _ set the stage for a spacewalk by two astronauts on monday to attach electrical connectors and cables between the two components . </s><s> mission control thought sunday 's work might take hours longer than planned and gave the six astronauts plenty of time for the tasks . </s><s> but everything occurred more or less when and how it was supposed to , aside from a piece of space junk that strayed too close . </s><s> before beginning their final approach to zarya , the six astronauts had to steer clear of a chunk of a rocket launched last month from california . </s><s> mission control ordered the pilots to fire the shuttle thrusters to put an extra three miles between endeavour and the space junk , putting endeavour a total of five miles from the orbiting debris . </s><s> the smaller gap would have been `` probably a little too close for comfort , '' mission control said . </s><s> the bigger worry , by far , was over endeavour 's pursuit and capture of zarya , and its coupling with unity . </s><s> the shuttle 's 50-foot robot arm had never before handled an object as massive as the 41-foot , 44,000-pound zarya , a power and propulsion module that was launched from kazakstan on nov. 20 . </s><s> it will provide all of the necessary electricity and steering for the fledgling space station until a permanent control module can be launched next summer . </s><s> minutes after zarya 's capture , cabana called down that two antennas on the module were still undeployed as russian flight controllers had feared . </s><s> the antennas must be fully deployed in order for zarya 's manual docking system to work ; that system wo n't be needed before next summer , officials said . </s><s> the only other problem was with a zarya battery ; the astronauts took up a replacement part . </s><s> the 36-foot , 25,000-pound unity , the first american-made component , will serve as a connecting passageway , or vestibule , for future modules . </s><s> it was crucial that zarya and unity be joined ; if they could not be connected with the robot arm , nasa would have sent out two spacewalking astronauts to manually fit them together . </s><s> in all , three spacewalks are planned for endeavour 's 12-day flight , not only to hook up electrical connections between the two modules but to install handrails and other tools for future crews . </s><s> the joined modules will be released from endeavour once all of the work is completed . </s><s> nasa estimates 43 more launches and 159 more spacewalks will be needed after this mission to assemble the entire orbiting complex . </s><s> once completed , the 16-nation space station will have a mass of 1 million pounds , be longer than a football field , and house up to seven astronauts and cosmonauts .	endeavour astronauts connect russian and u.s. components of space station	international space station construction underway ; us , russian parts mated	astronauts connect space station russian module russian agree	us russia agree space station launch mir untimely	nasa  russian decide position 2nd station nearer mir	washington _ nasa and the russian space agency have agreed to set aside a last-minute russian request to launch an international space station into an orbit closer to mir , officials announced friday . </s><s> while putting the new station closer to russia 's 12-year-old mir station would make it easier to transfer equipment and supplies from the old outpost to the new one , the request came too late to be acted on , said randy brinkley , nasa 's space station program manager . </s><s> nasa was surprised last week when russia 's prime station contractor proposed the orbital position change just two-and-a-half weeks before launch of the first part of the new station . </s><s> delaying the nov. 20 flight by 10 hours to match the orbits would have forced similar shifts in the subsequent assembly flights , and resulted in potentially unfavorable sun angles on the solar-powered station , engineers said . </s><s> `` we have mutually concluded that it would not be prudent to make these changes , '' brinkley said during a news conference held at the johnson space center in houston . </s><s> `` it added technical complexity and risks to the mission that were not justified . '' </s><s> the decision , which followed `` frank and candid '' discussions between the two partners , was not imposed by the united states , he said . </s><s> `` the conclusions were mutual , '' brinkley said . </s><s> `` both sides concluded that it did not make sense . '' </s><s> the russians , struggling to find money for their space program with their nation in economic collapse , had said they wanted to transfer thousands of pounds of newer equipment and scientific instruments from mir as an economy move . </s><s> however , some critics questioned the russians ' motives , wondering if the requested orbital change was part of plan to delay the decommissioning and destruction of mir , which the russians have agreed to do next summer . </s><s> the russians have so little money that the united states and other partners in the international station fear that money spent on mir will prevent russia from meeting its obligations with the new project . </s><s> `` the mir competes with the international space station for very critical resources and for funding , '' brinkley said . </s><s> nasa will consider ideas for salvaging mir 's research equipment to use on the international space station , he said , but only if it does not interfere with assembling the new station . </s><s> the united states and 15 other nations plan to begin building the new station in orbit next week when the russians launch a module that will supply power and propulsion during the early stages of the five-year construction period . </s><s> the space shuttle endeavor is to follow on dec. 3 with the second station part , a u.s.-built connecting passageway that attaches to the first module .	russian economic collapse affects plans for international space station	request to position space station near mir too late ; nasa , russians agree	u.s. and russia agree a space station launch to mir is untimely .	nasa , russians decide against positioning 2nd station nearer mir

assembly	a last-minute alarm forced nasa to halt thursday 's launching of the space shuttle endeavour , on a mission to start assembling the international space station . </s><s> another attempt for endeavour and its crew of six astronauts is scheduled for friday at 3:36 a.m . </s><s> this was the first time in three years , and 19 flights , that a shuttle countdown had been stopped after the spaceship was fueled and the crew aboard the craft and ready to go . </s><s> the uncommon delay prompted frowns and furrowed brows here , although officials stressed that it was entirely warranted . </s><s> `` we want to err on the conservative side , '' ralph roe , launch director at the kennedy space center , said at a news conference after the sudden halt of the countdown just 19 seconds before liftoff . </s><s> everything had been going smoothly for a rare nighttime launching , set for 3:58 on thursday morning . </s><s> the weather , forecast to be iffy , turned out to be fine , and the sky was alight with a nearly full moon . </s><s> but the length of the so-called launching window was , as planned , unusually short _ only 10 minutes . </s><s> that brevity was a result of endeavour 's having to rendezvous with a space-station part that russia put into orbit last month . </s><s> the show-stopper arose about four minutes before liftoff when the computer in the space shuttle set off a master alarm . </s><s> controllers studied the data and discovered a momentary pressure drop on one of the hydraulic systems that control the movements of the shuttle 's engines and its rudder and other flight surfaces . </s><s> officials eventually decided that the pressure drop was insignificant , and they resolved to press ahead . </s><s> but by then it was too late : time had run out for one of the procedures needed to keep the shuttle 's fuel supercold . </s><s> so the countdown was aborted just 19 seconds from blastoff . </s><s> the six astronauts began to emerge from the shuttle an hour later and ultimately headed for bed to rest up for another attempt early friday .	endeavour 's space station mission delayed for a day	last minute alarm forces halt and one day delay of endeavour launch	last-minute alarm forces delay of space shuttle endeavor .	last minute delay to shuttle launch .  mission is new space station assembly .

flight	endeavour astronaut launch space station construction mission	endeavour launch  crew begin assemble international space station	shuttle endeavor launch space station construction job	friday shuttle launch flawless  mission  attach us russian module	the planet 's most daring construction job began friday as the shuttle endeavour carried into orbit six astronauts and the first u.s.-built part of an international space station that is expected to cost more than $ 100 billion . </s><s> after a last-minute alarm on the shuttle forced a postponement early thursday , the launch went off flawlessly at 3:36 friday morning , right on schedule . </s><s> the night sky was clear , and the moon full . </s><s> with a roar , endeavour made its fiery ascent and briefly turned the florida coastline from night to day . </s><s> more than five minutes and 500 miles later , the spaceship 's main engines could still be seen in the distance , twinkling like a new star . </s><s> on their 12-day flight , endeavour 's astronauts are to locate a russian part already in orbit , grasp it with the shuttle 's robot arm and attach the new u.s. module . </s><s> wielding tools hundreds of miles above earth , working methodically in the cold void , the astronauts will be starting a five-year assembly that is likely to make the construction of the pyramids and the great cathedrals look like child 's play . </s><s> construction of the station , which will be a research facility , will require an estimated 160 space walks , which , for safety reasons , will always be done by two people . </s><s> when complete , the international space station , dominated by solar power arrays , will cover an area equal to that of two football fields . </s><s> modules of interconnected laboratories and living quarters for up to seven astronauts are to form a habitat equal to that of two 747 jetliners . </s><s> the station 's batteries alone , if lined up , would extend a half-mile . </s><s> the project entails high risk , because of the technical difficulty of putting all this together in the unforgiving environment of space , along with the dangers inherent in flying the space shuttle to the construction site . </s><s> the work is further complicated by international politics and worries about money . </s><s> the russians , whose participation in the partnership clinched the post-cold war deal five years ago , are now a wild card . </s><s> moscow 's economic and political woes have left western officials unsure of its ability and willingness to come up with its share of money and technology . </s><s> at the same time , the station 's costs are rising , and its critics among scientists worry that its appetite for money will consume their own federal financing . </s><s> the project 's total cost is a subject of debate , but the most credible estimates now put the price of assembly and of operation for a decade , the station 's estimated lifetime , at $ 110 billion . </s><s> of that , american taxpayers are to spend roughly $ 96 billion , and the project 's 15 foreign partners about $ 14 billion . </s><s> the station is intended to be a grand laboratory where , in the environment of weightlessness , investigators can develop new materials and new drugs and explore physiology 's remaining mysteries , in part so that humans may someday know how to adapt for long space flight to other worlds . </s><s> friday , in any case , little was heard about the project but praise . </s><s> `` great show , endeavour , '' mission control in houston radioed to the six astronauts as the shuttle went into orbit . </s><s> at the florida spaceport , secretary of state madeleine albright lauded the launching team and the new venture . </s><s> `` that was truly , truly fantastic , '' she told the team after the liftoff . </s><s> and it was important , she added , to have so many nations `` working together on the kinds of issues that the 21st century is going to be concerned with . '' </s><s> `` so my congratulations to all of you , '' the secretary said . </s><s> `` stupendous work . '' </s><s> the main cargo thursday was the unity module , the first u.s.-built station part . </s><s> small compared with the giants to come in three dozen shuttle flights during assembly , the unit is 18 feet long , weighs 13 tons and is to serve as a connecting hub for other modules . </s><s> saturday , one of the astronauts , lt. col. nancy currie of the army , is to have the shuttle 's robot arm hoist unity from the payload bay and secure it to endeavour 's docking system , moving the unit from a horizontal to a vertical position . </s><s> then , sunday , the astronauts are to rendezvous with the module known as zarya , or sunrise , which russia launched into orbit from kazakhstan on nov. 20 . </s><s> financed by the united states but built in russia , zarya , 41 feet long , is be a kind of tugboat for the embryonic station , furnishing power and propulsion as well as communication and rendezvous abilities . </s><s> when endeavour 's payload bay is within 10 feet of zarya , colonel currie is to reach out with the robot arm and pull the russian module into position over unity . </s><s> the mechanical arm has never before moved anything so big . </s><s> zarya , while completely weightless in space , has 21 tons of mass . </s><s> if mishandled , it can crush and kill . </s><s> as col. currie holds zarya steady , endeavour 's commander , col. robert cabana of the marine corps , a veteran of three space flights , is to nudge the shuttle forward to join the two station pieces together . </s><s> when mated with special attachments , zarya and unity will form the station 's first element , 63 feet long and 78 feet wide out to the tips of the solar arrays . </s><s> starting monday , a pair of space-walking astronauts are to hook up electrical connections and data cables between the units , attach antennas and install tools and handrails for future visitors . </s><s> the builders will be col. jerry ross of the air force , 50 , and dr. james newman , 42 , a physicist . </s><s> their series of three space walks will continue wednesday and end saturday , dec. 12 . </s><s> as construction goes on outside , the astronauts inside endeavour will be busy making preparations to enter the new station through a connecting tunnel and docking system . </s><s> next thursday , the crew will enter the embryonic station for the first time , installing portable fans and lights . </s><s> friday they will again enter , to prepare for the arrival in 1999 of the next major element , the first one both built and financed by russia . </s><s> the other astronauts on endeavour are its pilot , maj. frederick sturckow of the marine corps , and a mission specialist , sergei krikalev of the russian space agency . </s><s> after separating from the new outpost , the crew is to bring endeavour back to the kennedy space center on dec. 15 , with the mission length just shy of 12 days . </s><s> gretchen mcclain , nasa 's director in washington for the international space station , said in an interview here that its overall costs were actually small for individual americans . </s><s> over its lifetime , she said , the annual cost will equal that of a pizza and a soft drink for each of the nation 's 96 million taxpayers . </s><s> u.s. costs for construction , she added , were $ 24 billion , and for operations through the year 2012 were $ 10.4 billion , for a total of $ 34.4 billion . </s><s> most experts outside the agency consider this figure ridiculously low because it ignores many billions of dollars spent in early development work as well as the cost of numerous shuttle flights , which run about $ 800 million apiece .	endeavour astronauts launched on space station construction mission	endeavour launched .  crew to begin assembling international space station	shuttle endeavor launched for space station construction job .	friday shuttle launch flawless .  mission : attach us and russian modules .

space station	delicate space maneuver endeavour crew grab zarya attache unity	astronaut connect two segment international space station	shuttle crew join russian zarya  us unity segment space station	following a series of intricate maneuvers and the skillful use of the space shuttle endeavour 's robot arm , astronauts on sunday joined the first two of many segments that will form the international space station . </s><s> the shuttle and its crew of six snared the russian-made zarya control module after chasing it around the earth in ever-closing orbits throughout the day . </s><s> less than an hour after a rendezvous 240 miles above the earth shortly before 6 p.m. , lt. col. nancy currie of the army deftly used the 50-foot arm to grab the 40,000-pound cylinder as the craft passed above russia and to slowly pull it toward the shuttle . </s><s> seeing zarya up close , col. robert cabana of the marines , the shuttle commander , confirmed that two antennas had failed to deploy from the module following its launch from kazakhstan on nov. 20 . </s><s> there were earlier indications that the antennas , which will be used later by the station to manually assist spacecraft dockings , had not extended . </s><s> currie took almost two hours to painstakingly move zarya above the american-made unity docking port positioned in endeavour 's cargo bay . </s><s> when the two pieces were aligned within inches of one another , cabana fired small thruster rockets that raised the shuttle , allowing the modules to clamp together . </s><s> the two station pieces , together measuring about 77 feet from end to end and having a combined mass of 70,000 pounds , are the first of 100 major components to be united in space over the next five years to form an orbiting outpost that would weigh almost a million pounds and span an area the size of two football fields . </s><s> more than 40 additional missions by u.s. shuttles and russian rockets will be used to haul all of the components and other supplies into orbit , and astronauts from both nations are to spend almost 1,800 hours doing spacewalks to assemble the entire structure . </s><s> the spece station is expected to cost its partnership of 16 nations more than $ 40 billion just to construct . </s><s> bringing the pieces together is only the first step in mating them . </s><s> a pair of astronauts are to make three spacewalks this week , the first on monday , during which they will hook up electrical and communications cables , remove covers , attach handrails and perform other tasks to get the modules to work as one unit . </s><s> the most difficult part of sunday 's mating of the $ 240 million zarya to the $ 300 million unity was bringing them together after the shuttle caught up with the russian unit . </s><s> currie had to use the canadian-built robot arm to place zarya on top of unity without being able to see where the pieces joined . </s><s> unity , raised in endeavour 's cargo bay on saturday , is so large that it blocked currie 's view of the mating fixtures from the shuttle 's windows . </s><s> she used views from remote cameras and a computerized vision system built on the arm to estimate the relative positions of the two large segments . </s><s> the computerized system examined markings on both modules , computed their relationship to one another using the marks and displayed the results on a laptop computer . </s><s> `` we 've never done anything like this before , '' currie said before the flight , adding that she had practiced the difficult maneuver more than 100 times over the last two years . </s><s> the flight of endeavour , which took off from cape canaveral , fla. , last friday , had gone according to plan until early sunday , when mission control ordered the shuttle to change its orbit slightly to avoid a piece of space debris . </s><s> air force space debris trackers noted that the shuttle was to pass within 1.6 miles of a spent stage of an american booster rocket launched last month . </s><s> although this was considered a safe distance , shuttle controllers decided to widen the separation to five miles as an extra precaution .	endeavour astronauts join two segments of international space station	delicate space maneuver by endeavour crew grabs zarya attaches it to unity	astronauts connect two segments for international country adopt eu common currency  euro	head european central bank say growth euronations slow  job need	in his most candid remarks yet on the economy , european central bank president wim duisenberg said friday that growth appears to be slowing in the 11 countries adopting the eu common currency _ or euro _ on jan. 1 . </s><s> despite an area-wide survey that suggested `` a moderation in the pace of growth , '' duisenberg said domestic demand will continue to boost the economy . </s><s> he pointed also to a gradual improvement in labor market conditions as supporting growth , as well as interest-rate cuts toward the 3.3 percent level of the euro-zone 's lowest rate countries . </s><s> duisenberg , who spoke at an event in london , said the dec. 1 and dec. 22 meetings of the central bank 's policy-making body will gauge the outlook for inflation and the eu economy . </s><s> the bank , which will set monetary policy for the currency bloc , has been under pressure from politicians to keep interest rates low to help boost growth and create jobs . </s><s> while inflation is at its lowest levels in decades _ just 1 percent in the euro-zone _ unemployment in the 11 nations remains percent	ten eleven country adopt euro drop interest rate	nation adopt new european currency drop key interest rate	ten country prepare economic union drop key interest rate	surprise  coordinate  drop interest rate 11 euronations  3	in a surprise move , nations adopting the new european currency , the euro , dropped key interest rates thursday , effectively setting the rate that will be adopted throughout the euro zone on jan. 1 . </s><s> ten of the 11 countries adopting the euro dropped their interest rate to 3 percent . </s><s> italy dropped to 3.5 percent from 4 percent . </s><s> the coordinated move was a key step in preparing for economic union . </s><s> setting a common interest rates had been a particularly contentious issue as center-left governments in germany and france pressed for lower rates to help boost growth and cut unemployment , a stubborn 10.9 percent in the euro zone . </s><s> european central bank chief , wim duisenberg , gave no hint of the rate cuts during a speech in brussels earlier thursday , instead suggesting that governments should reform rigid labor markets to create jobs . </s><s> in germany , the biggest economy in the future euro-zone , central bankers cut the key interest rate to 3 percent from 3.3 percent . </s><s> rates before the cuts had varied throughout the future currency zone , from 3.69 percent in ireland to 3.2 percent in austria . </s><s> the european central bank said in a statement from its frankfurt headquarters that the move was decided during a meeting tuesday of its the policy-making governing council . </s><s> the governing council comprises the 11 heads of national central banks plus a six-member directorate , including the bank president duisenberg . </s><s> `` the joint reduction in interest rates has to be seen as a de facto decision on the level of interest rates with which the ( bank ) will start ... monetary union , '' the statement said , adding the 3-percent rate would be maintained `` for the foreseeable future . '' </s><s> in germany , central bank president hans tietmeyer said the move reflected the worsening outlook for european economies , and was n't a capitulation to political pressure finance minister oskar lafontaine . </s><s> `` it 's not a dramatic step . </s><s> it was n't in response to political pressure , '' tietmeyer said , referring to germany 's cut . </s><s> `` the coordinated rate cut could lead to a reduction in the current pessimism and a reduction in financial market turbulence , '' he said . </s><s> but tietmeyer , head of the bank on which the ecb is modeled , promised that the rate cut does not signal the start of a volatile monetary policy . </s><s> `` it 's not a shift from the bundesbank 's steady-hand policy , '' he said . </s><s> growth in europe has been hit by the asian and russian economic crises and turbulence on international financial markets . </s><s> duisenberg has said growth in the euro area countries next year will be about 2.5 percent , lower than the 3 percent predicted earlier .	ten of eleven countries adopting euro drop interest rates	nations adopting the new european currency drop key interest rates	ten countries prepare for economic union by dropping key interest rates	surprise , coordinated , drop in interest rates by 11 euro-nations ; now 3 % .

currency goes into effect for 11 european union members , a growing number of danes believe their country should take part , according to a poll published tuesday . </s><s> the survey by the megaphone polling institute said 54 percent of the 1,009 people surveyed favor denmark 's participation , while 36 percent oppose that . </s><s> the remaining 10 percent were undecided . </s><s> the poll , conducted dec. 18-22 , was broadcast by tv2 channel . </s><s> denmark is one of four eu countries staying out of the monetary union for the time being . </s><s> after voters in 1992 rejected the </s><s> although many politicians support the unified currency , they have been wary about bringing the issue to voters again . </s><s> a poll published last october showed 46 percent of danes favored 09	european economic inflation decline may overheat fastgrowth nation	annual inflation rate fall eurozone  portugal s rise	the annual inflation rate in the 11 nations that adopt the euro as their shared currency on jan. 1 fell to 0.9 percent in november , the european union 's statistics agency reported wednesday . </s><s> the fall continued the steady decline of inflation in the euro-zone over the past year . </s><s> annual inflation stood at 1 percent in october and 1.6 percent in november 1997 , according to eurostat 's monthly report . </s><s> in the 15 nation eu as a whole , inflation fell to 1 percent in november compared to 1.5 percent in the united states and 0.8 percent in japan . </s><s> germany , france , italy , spain , the netherlands , belgium , austria , portugal , finland , ireland and luxembourg are set to adopt the euro as a common currency at midnight on new year 's eve . </s><s> the latest figures may hint at trouble ahead for the euro-zone with significant increases over the year in portugal and ireland . </s><s> with the european central bank setting a common interest rate for the whole bloc , some economists fear the low rate designed to boost core eu economies like france and germany may bring overheating in smaller nations with faster growth . </s><s> there was good news for greece which was kept out of the euro-zone for failing to meet economic conditions for joining , including low inflation . </s><s> it 's rate was 3.9 percent in november down from 5 percent a year before . </s><s> greece hops to join the euro-zone in 2001 . </s><s> denmark , sweden and britain decided to stay out of the euro for political reasons . </s><s> eurostat gave the following rates for november 1998 , with november 1997 in brackets : sweden , 0.1 european central bank say wo nt step half term	head european central bank serve full term  seek integration	wim duisenberg , the head of the new european central bank , said in an interview published wednesday that he wo n't step down after completing half his term as earlier agreed . </s><s> `` i had hoped you would n't ask me that question . </s><s> the answer is no , '' duisenberg told the le monde daily , which had asked him if he would step down after four years on the job . </s><s> duisenberg was named this spring as head of the new european central bank , which will govern the policies of the euro , the new single currency which goes into effect jan. 1 . </s><s> france surprised its euro partners by proposing its central banker , jean-claude trichet , at the last minute for the job duisenberg was expected to secure easily . </s><s> although he was elected easily , duisenberg agreed to step down after four years of his eight year term although he has since said no such `` create paneuropean equity market	nation work toward paneuropean equity market euro intro near	struggling to avoid being sidelined in the continent-wide equities market promised by europe 's soon-to-be-introduced single currency , french authorities said thursday that the paris stock exchange would join an alliance between london and frankfurt that is seen as the precursor of a pan-european market . </s><s> the bourse in paris also announced that it would play host to a meeting nov. 27 of nine other european exchanges to discuss `` the steps and conditions needed to create a unifying and competitive pan-european equity market . '' </s><s> the two announcements show how the introduction of the currency , the euro , is reshaping europe 's financial landscape , requiring europeans to think in continental rather than national terms in finance and business . </s><s> and it suggested that exchange authorities in paris , ruffled by the announcement in july of a `` strategic alliance '' between the london stock exchange and the deutsche borse in frankfurt , had not only abandoned an effort to set up a rival market but were also seeking to gain the initiative by organizing the nov. 27 gathering . </s><s> some doubt remained , however , about the timing and technicalities of the french entry into the alliance . </s><s> foreign minister dominique strauss-kahn said , `` paris is joining this alliance with the creation from january 1999 of a joint company . '' </s><s> however , officials in london and frankfurt _ who welcomed the idea in principle _ declined to say whether the timing and the arrangements were as far advanced as strauss-kahn implied . </s><s> `` i 'm afraid i ca n't confirm anything like that , '' a spokeswoman at the london stock exchange said . </s><s> `` the appearances are well ahead of the reality at this point , '' said an american banker , who spoke on the condition of anonymity . </s><s> not only that , the notion of a europe-wide exchange raises technical questions about the compatibility not just of trading systems but also of the regulations governing stock market operations in the countries that will use the euro beginning in january . </s><s> that has led some analysts to forecast that a pan-european exchange could not be up and running before 2000 . </s><s> `` there are an awful lot of issues to be resolved , '' the american banker said . </s><s> the euro is to be introduced for electronic trading of equities , bonds and futures and for intergovernmental transfers . </s><s> notes and coins _ the pocket money that shoppers and travelers will carry _ will be introduced only in 2002 . </s><s> initially , the currency will group 11 european nations in a euro zone , leaving britain , denmark , sweden and greece on the outside . </s><s> with its concentration of banking and trading , however , london is expected to continue as the main market center . </s><s> the prospect has heightened pressure for consolidation among exchanges . </s><s> stock market officials in milan , madrid , amsterdam and brussels have indicated they would be interested in joining the london-frankfurt alliance , which will initially create a single point of liquidity for trading in british and german blue-chip issues . </s><s> the london exchange estimates that a pan-european stock exchange would group together companies with a market capitalization of $ 5.5 trillion , compared with $ 8.7 trillion on the new york stock exchange . </s><s> the paris bourse , the third largest of the european exchanges and the last major holdout toward a pan-european market , said that it had also invited officials from exchanges in zurich and stockholm to attend the nov. 27 meeting . </s><s> a spokeswoman said officials from the london stock exchange would be at the meeting . </s><s> also thursday , the new york mercantile exchange and the international petroleum exchange here acknowledged that they were considering a merger that would bring together the two biggest energy futures markets . </s><s> discussions began in july , and the exchanges have formed a working group to study a merger . </s><s> they already cooperate in the development of a system intended to coordinate after-hours electronic trading .	french move towards pan-european equity market called premature by some	major european stock exchanges seek alliance as euro introduction nears	france takes initiative in effort
