germany bow leftist	facing his first real foreign policy test , prime minister massimo d'alema must decide what to do with a prominent kurdish rebel leader who was arrested at the rome airport on thursday . </s><s> turkey wants italy to extradite the rebel , abdullah ocalan , leader of the kurdistan workers ' party , which is seeking kurdish autonomy in southeastern turkey . </s><s> he is viewed in turkey as a terrorist . </s><s> germany also has a warrant out for his arrest on homicide charges . </s><s> but d'alema , a former communist who was appointed prime minister last month , is under pressure from leftists in his coalition to offer ocalan political asylum . </s><s> in a news conference monday , d'alema recognized the extent of the problem . </s><s> `` the last thing we wanted was an awkward and complicated situation like this one , '' he said . </s><s> he noted that italian law prohibits extradition of suspects to countries that have the death penalty . </s><s> turkey has capital punishment , though it says it will soon abolish it . </s><s> ocalan is being tried in absentia there on charges that could bring the death penalty . </s><s> d'alema said a committee in the interior ministry would determine whether ocalan would qualify for political asylum , which would be possible if ocalan 's promise to renounce terrorism , issued monday , holds up . </s><s> `` we do not want someone who organizes terrorism in italy , '' d'alema said . </s><s> `` this is an opportunity to find an exit from a bloody conflict . '' </s><s> earlier monday , while members of d'alema 's government met with turkish officials who were in rome for a european ministerial meeting , thousands of kurds flooded into rome to hold a demonstration and hunger strike in support of ocalan . </s><s> d'alema 's decision was further complicated on sunday when turkish inmates in a prison in istanbul took an italian prisoner hostage , saying they would release him only after italy extradited ocalan . </s><s> monday , d'alema said he would not bow to pressure .	ocalan case first foreign policy test for new prime minister d'alema .	italian prime minister pressured by leftists to offer ocalan asylum	italian pm faces foreign policy test over fate of kurdish rebel leader	italian govt test : extradite kurd to turkey or germany or bow to leftists ?

exxon	exxon mobil discus combine business operation  possible merger	possible merger exxon mobile would create large us company	exxon corp mobil corp may combine business operation	exxon  mobil consider merge  create large us company  cite bpamoco	exxon corp. and mobil corp. have held discussions about combining their business operations , a person involved in the talks said wednesday . </s><s> it was unclear wednesday whether talks were continuing . </s><s> if the companies were to merge , it would create the largest u.s. company in terms of revenue . </s><s> a possible merger was reported separately by both the financial times of london and bloomberg news . </s><s> the reported talks between exxon , whose annual revenue exceeds that of wal-mart and general electric , and mobil , the no . </s><s> 2 u.s. oil company , come as oil prices have sunk to their lowest in almost 12 years . </s><s> a combined company would be bigger than royal dutch/shell group , the world 's largest oil company by revenue . </s><s> financial terms of the discussions could not be determined wednesday . </s><s> neither exxon or mobil would comment . </s><s> any union would reunite two parts of john d. rockefeller 's standard oil trust , which was broken up by the supreme court in 1911 . </s><s> exxon was then known as standard oil of new jersey , and mobil consisted of two companies : standard oil of new york and vacuum oil . </s><s> both exxon , which has a market value of $ 176.7 billion , and mobil , which has a market value of $ 61.1 billion , have a history of being fiercely independence . </s><s> both have already cut back on staff and made themselves lean in order to survive long periods when oil prices are low . </s><s> but this has been a particularly unsettling year for the oil industry , and there is little prospect that crude oil prices will recover soon . </s><s> consequently , chief executives of most oil companies have had to swallow their pride and look for suitable partners . </s><s> this summer , british petroleum announced a $ 48.2 billion agreement to buy amoco corp. , creating the world 's third-largest oil company and prompting analysts to predict even more widespread consolidation . </s><s> `` it showed that megamergers are doable , '' said adam sieminski , an analyst for bt alex . </s><s> brown . </s><s> he added , however , that a combination between exxon and mobil would not be an easy match because mobil has been known for being a proud company that has said in the past that it would not want to merge . </s><s> exxon , he added , is a `` well run company that likes to grow its own businesses . '' </s><s> he added that the heads of both companies , lee raymond , the chairman of exxon , which is based in irving , texas , and lucio noto , the chairman , president and chief executive of mobil , which is based in fairfax , va. , are different personalities . </s><s> `` it will not be easy , '' he said of combining the two far-flung companies , which have vast networks of refineries and gas stations that overlap in the united states and europe . </s><s> `` if you offer enough money you can make anything happen , '' he added . </s><s> both companies are under pressure to find new fields of oil to help them survive in the long term . </s><s> like other oil companies , they had hoped to quickly tap into the vast reserves of russia . </s><s> even though they were prepared to spend billions , they have held back because of the political and economic crisis in russia and great reluctance by russian officials and oil companies to give up control of vast fields . </s><s> thus they have had to fall back on their own exploration areas such as the deep waters in the gulf of mexico and west africa . </s><s> such exploration is very expensive , and even when large fields are found it often takes platforms costing $ 1 billion to bring the oil into production . </s><s> oil prices have been under pressure for more than a year , falling more than 40 percent from the $ 20-a-barrel level because of growing inventories of petroleum and declining asian demand caused by the economic crisis there . </s><s> on wednesday , crude oil for january delivery fell 29 cents , or 2.6 percent , to $ 11.86 a barrel on the new york mercantile exchange , close to the 12-year low of $ 11.42 reached on june 15 . </s><s> members of the organization of petroleum exporting countries and some other oil-producing nations , notably mexico , have tried to stem the price drops with pledges to cut back on production . </s><s> but those pledges have not always been honored , and rallies in the oil market this year have proven short-lived . </s><s> opec members on wednesday continued their discussion on extending their production cutbacks , and an agreement is expected as early as thursday . </s><s> in the spring , opec agreed to reduce production by 2.6 million barrels a day , about 3 percent of the daily world supply of 74 million barrels . </s><s> the main result of that agreement appears to have been to keep oil prices from falling below $ 10 a barrel . </s><s> washington regulators said wednesday that they had not been notified about the exxon-mobil discussions . </s><s> the federal trade commission is still reviewing british petroleum 's pending purchase of amoco . </s><s> an exxon-mobil deal would be certain to receive several months ' worth of scrutiny by the commission , which would review how much of the industry such a merger would control . </s><s> analysts and investment bankers were split about the logic of the possible merger . </s><s> some pointed to difficulties that the companies could face if they were combined . </s><s> `` if you asked me if exxon needed to be bigger , the answer is probably no , '' said garfield miller , president of aegis energy advisors corp. , a small independent investment bank based in new york . </s><s> `` it is hard to say that there is anything in particular to gain . '' </s><s> in particular , miller said , the two companies have enormous similarities in their domestic refining and marketing businesses . </s><s> `` they really do overlap quite a bit , '' he said . </s><s> `` you really do wonder what is the benefit of all that redundancy . '' </s><s> another investment banker in the energy business , speaking on the condition of anonymity , also questioned the rationale for the discussed merger . </s><s> `` when you look at the bp-amoco deal , you can rationalize it , '' the banker said . </s><s> `` but none of those reasons apply to an exxon-mobil deal . '' </s><s> but amy jaffe , an energy research analyst with the james a. baker iii institute for public policy , said the combination of the two companies would be logical , in part because it would give them greater influence in bidding for projects in middle eastern countries . </s><s> `` this is a deal that makes sense , '' ms. jaffe said . </s><s> `` with this combined company , there is no project that would be too big . '' </s><s> in addition , ms. jaffe said , the merger would provide each company with new oil and gas assets in areas of the world where they had little influence . </s><s> `` there are a lot of complimentary assets where they are not redundant , '' she said . </s><s> she said that exxon , for example , has a strong presence in angola , while mobil does not . </s><s> and mobil has significant assets in the caspian sea and nigeria , where exxon is weak .	exxon and mobil discuss combining business operations ; possible merger .	possible merger of exxon and mobile would create largest u.s. company	exxon corp. and mobil corp may combine business operations	exxon , mobil consider merge , creating largest us company .  cite bp-amoco .

balance sheet debt dividend yield percent</s><s>month acquisition rubbermaid newell co. think presto acquirer cross-hairs	exxonmobil merger talk show corporate merger back vogue	grow stock market  need increase revenue  drive merger talk	exxonmobil merger talk sign corporate marriage back vogue	exxonmobil talk sign merger increase  internal revenue increase tough	news that exxon and mobil , two giants in the energy patch , were in merger talks last week is the biggest sign yet that corporate marriages are back in vogue . </s><s> even before that combination came to light , deal-making was fast and furious . </s><s> on monday alone , $ 40.4 billion in corporate acquisitions were either announced or declared imminent . </s><s> driving the resurgence in mergers is a roaring stock market , the recognition by major corporations that it is getting harder to increase revenues internally and growing confidence among market players that the economy will not plunge into a recession next year . </s><s> there are also industry-specific issues , like low crude-oil prices that are driving oil giants into one another 's arms . </s><s> but for investors , mega-marriages are not where the real money is to be made . </s><s> rather , it is among smaller companies , whose still-depressed stock prices are luring bigger acquirers with stocks that again are near their peaks . </s><s> if exxon buys mobil at close to current prices , deals this month will have a total value of more than $ 140 billion _ off from april 's peak of $ 244 billion but three times the volume in september , when the stock market was falling . </s><s> which industries are likely to witness the most mergers ? </s><s> tom burnett , director of merger insight , an institutional investment advisory firm in new york , says more deals are a certainty in energy , which is suffering from low crude-oil prices . </s><s> burnett also says health care executives are finding it tougher than ever to lift earnings . </s><s> but smaller companies may be a better way to play the takeover game . </s><s> charles laloggia , editor of the special situation investor newsletter in potomac , md. , said : `` some of the premiums in high-profile mergers are n't so great anymore . </s><s> the values are in small-cap stocks . '' </s><s> another reason is that deals involving smaller-cap candidates are less likely to incur the wrath of antitrust regulators . </s><s> laloggia reckons that the odds of picking takeover winners increase if an investor focuses on companies already partially owned by another . </s><s> in the energy sector , houston exploration qualifies , he says ; the oil and gas driller is 66 percent owned by keyspan energy . </s><s> he also believes more deals are imminent among drug chains and supermarkets . </s><s> longs drug stores and drug emporium , he says , remain acquisition candidates , though neither is controlled by another concern . </s><s> in supermarkets , laloggia likes the great atlantic & amp ; pacific tea co. , 55 percent owned by tengelmann group of germany . </s><s> another pick is smart and final , an operator of warehouse-style stores that is 55 percent owned by the u.s. subsidiary of groupe casino , france 's largest supermarket chain . </s><s> `` both a & amp ; p and smart and final are trading at just about book value , '' laloggia said . </s><s> takeovers typically occur above book value . </s><s> finally , he recommends national presto industries , a maker of housewares and electrical appliances , which is trading near $ 39 , close to its low for the year . </s><s> the company has $ 30 a share in cash on its balance sheet , no debt and a dividend yield of 5 percent . </s><s> after last month 's announced acquisition of rubbermaid by the newell co. , laloggia thinks national presto could find itself in an acquirer 's cross-hairs .	exxon-mobil merger talks show that corporate mergers are back in vogue .	growing stock market , need to increase revenue , driving merger talks	exxon-mobil merger talks are sign corporate marriages are back in vogue	exxon-mobil talks sign of merger increase .  internal revenue increases tough

price high exploration cost cause oil company merger	low oil price  high exploration cost demand deeppocket company	times are tough in the oil patch . </s><s> still , it boggles the mind to accept the notion that hardship is driving profitable big oil to either merge , as british petroleum and amoco have already agreed to do , or at least to consider the prospect , as exxon and mobil are doing . </s><s> still , big oil and small oil are getting squeezed by low petroleum prices and the high capital costs of exploration . </s><s> given the exotic locales of the most promising , untapped fields , it seems unlikely that exploration will get cheaper . </s><s> and with west texas crude trading at around $ 12 a barrel , it seems a safe bet oil that wo n't be selling for $ 100 a barrel by the turn of the century _ a price some analysts in the early 1980s were predicting it would reach . </s><s> philip k. verleger jr. , publisher of petroleum economics monthly and a senior adviser to the brattle group , a cambridge , mass. , consulting firm , spent some time late last week talking about mobil , exxon and the changing dynamics of the oil business . </s><s> following are excerpts from the conversation : q . </s><s> ( italics ) there is a lot of focus on the antitrust aspects of an exxon-mobil deal . </s><s> do you see any problems ? </s><s> ( end italics ) a . </s><s> let me say right off that i do n't think this is a done deal . </s><s> i think it is far from that . </s><s> but if it were to happen , i do n't see many problems . </s><s> bp amoco is the perfect end-to-end merger , one in which there is little or no overlap with the company you are merging with . </s><s> exxon-mobil comes close . </s><s> the first issue is competition in local markets . </s><s> the only possible problem area there is on the west coast , but both companies are pretty small players there . </s><s> if there is a reason this merger might get extra attention , it will be because exxon and mobil have not been terribly friendly toward either the clinton administration 's or the european union 's positions on global warming . </s><s> q . </s><s> ( italics ) why are you skeptical about the deal ? </s><s> ( end italics ) a . </s><s> well , mobil has been trying to get bigger . </s><s> they had talks with amoco . </s><s> they wanted to buy conoco . </s><s> but i do n't understand where lucio noto , mobil 's chief executive , fits into this . </s><s> that could be an impediment to an agreement , because in a merger i do n't think he has a place , and he has been a very strong leader . </s><s> q . </s><s> ( italics ) mobil is the country 's second-biggest oil company , behind exxon . </s><s> why do they need to get bigger ? </s><s> ( end italics ) a . </s><s> in the first decade of the next century , the really big exploration opportunities will be very capital intensive , and only companies with the deepest pockets will be able to stay in the game : royal dutch , exxon and bp amoco . </s><s> companies of mobil 's size are probably marginal players . </s><s> q . </s><s> ( italics ) that suggests mobil has been harder hit than exxon by the downturn in prices . </s><s> ( end italics ) a . </s><s> from 1988 to 1996 , exxon 's exploration and production expenditures rose 8 percent . </s><s> mobil 's rose 14 percent . </s><s> but mobil 's expenditures were much more sensitive to price elasticities of oil than exxon 's . </s><s> they were pushing the envelope , and when prices fell they had to cut back . </s><s> exxon has tried to build a very large presence systematically , without paying much attention to month-to-month or even year-to-year fluctuations in oil prices . </s><s> they are brutally efficient . </s><s> q . </s><s> ( italics ) earlier this month the energy department said oil prices would stay soft for nearly a decade . </s><s> do you agree ? </s><s> ( end italics ) a . </s><s> you know , every time i see forecasts that go out that far i want to go out and buy stock in oil companies . </s><s> i think we are going to see low oil prices for six months to a year . </s><s> it is conceivable we could go into the next century with oil at $ 5 a barrel , depending on what happens to the world economy . </s><s> during that period , we are going to see a substantial reduction in investment in exploration and production , leading to a reduction in supply coming out of non-opec countries . </s><s> that will strengthen the hands of the opec countries . </s><s> and when the asian economies start growing again that will lead to a good deal higher oil prices , say $ 20 a barrel , in the next 18 months . </s><s> q . </s><s> ( italics ) the number of oil companies is going to shrink in coming years , regardless , is n't it ? </s><s> ( end italics ) a . </s><s> we are probably heading toward a world in which there are no more than five or six big oil companies , possibly eight . </s><s> there is really no precedent for having as many big players as we have in the oil business in this modern society . </s><s> q . </s><s> ( italics ) do you think oil stocks are a good investment ? </s><s> ( end italics ) a. i think oil companies are still a worthwhile investment , but it is not a place where an investor should plan on making money over the next 9 to 12 months . </s><s> and it is an area where investors need to be careful , because in that period there will be a good deal of consolidation among smaller companies .	low petroleum prices , high cost of exploration motives for possible merger .	low petroleum prices , high costs , drive companies to consider mergers	low petroleum prices and high exploration costs causing oil company mergers	low oil prices , high exploration costs demand deep-pocket companies

mobile would create world s large oil company	exxon mobil expect meet tuesday consider possible merger	exxon  mobil board discuss merger  mobil head noto intelligent	the boards of exxon corp. and mobil corp. are expected to meet tuesday to consider a possible merger agreement that would form the world 's largest oil company , a source close to the negotiations said friday . </s><s> the source , who spoke on condition of anonymity , said `` the prospects were good '' for completing an agreement . </s><s> exxon and mobil confirmed friday that they were discussing ways to combine . </s><s> they cautioned , however , that no agreement had been reached and there was no assurance they would reach one . </s><s> the statement sent the stock of both companies surging , suggesting investors believe the companies will combine . </s><s> shares of exxon , the biggest u.s. oil company , rose $ 1.6875 , or 2.3 percent , to $ 74.375 . </s><s> shares of mobil , the no . </s><s> 2 u.s. oil company , rose $ 7.625 , or 9.7 percent , to $ 86 . </s><s> some analysts said that if the two giants reached an agreement , it was likely to be in the form of a takeover by exxon of mobil . </s><s> exxon is far larger and financially stronger . </s><s> analysts predicted that there would be huge cuts in duplicate staff from both companies , which employ 122,700 people . </s><s> adam sieminski , an oil analyst for bt alex . </s><s> brown , said that the companies would probably make cuts to save about $ 3 billion to $ 5 billion a year . </s><s> sieminski and other analysts said exxon would have to offer a premium of about 15 to 20 percent over its price prior to monday , when serious speculation of an exxon takeover of mobil first circulated and sent mobil shares up sharply . </s><s> they said the transaction would probably be an exchange of mobil shares for exxon shares . </s><s> based on mobil 's $ 75.25 share price a week ago , a takeover of the company would be worth about $ 70 billion . </s><s> the merger discussions come against a backdrop of particularly severe pressure on lucio noto , the chairman , president and chief executive of mobil , to find new reserves of oil and natural gas and to keep big projects profitable at a time of a deep decline in crude oil prices . </s><s> `` this is one of the most intelligent chief executives in the business and a man of considerable ability but he inherited some serious structural problems in his company , '' said j. robin west , the chairman of petroleum finance co. , a consulting group to the energy industry based in washington . </s><s> he said that mobil 's prime assets include the arun natural gas field in indonesia , one of the largest in the world , which has contributed up to one-third of mobil 's profits for years but is beginning to run down . </s><s> the field , in production since 1977 , supplies liquefied natural gas to japan and korea . </s><s> although mobil under noto has moved quickly to cut costs and muscle its way into promising new areas such as kazakhstan , where it is a partner in a joint venture to develop the huge tengiz oil field , the payoff from such ventures is many years away . </s><s> other companies face similar strains . </s><s> `` the challenge is to replace their crown jewels and grow in an increasingly competitive environment , '' west said . </s><s> noto has not been shy about sitting down with other companies such as british petroleum and amoco this year to see if a combination made sense . </s><s> although exxon chairman lee raymond heads a much stronger and bigger company than mobil , he has not been immune to the strains on the global petroleum business . </s><s> those strains intensified this year when russia 's economic collapse raised the risks of exxon 's extensive exploration venture in that country . </s><s> exxon has also been more of a follower than a leader in huge projects in the deep offshore fields , where major finds have been made near west africa and in the gulf of mexico .	exxon , mobil to consider merger tuesday ; news sent stock of both surging .	merger of exxon and mobile would create world 's largest oil company	exxon and could spark antitrust scrutiny	possible exxonmobil merger would require sale large corporate piece	exxon  mobil confirm talk  antitrust case  sale large unit see	exxon and mobil , the nation 's two largest oil companies , confirmed friday that they were discussing a possible merger , and antitrust lawyers , industry analysts and government officials predicted that any deal would require the sale of important large pieces of such a new corporate behemoth . </s><s> those divestitures would further reshape an industry already undergoing a broad transformation because of the low price of oil . </s><s> but the mergers and other corporate combinations are also beginning to create a new regulatory climate among antitrust officials , one that may prove particularly challenging to exxon and mobil . </s><s> although the companies only confirmed that they were discussing the possibility of a merger , a person close to the discussions said the boards of both exxon and mobil were expected to meet tuesday to consider an agreement . </s><s> shares of both surged on the new york stock exchange . </s><s> oil exploration and drilling interests would not necessarily present antitrust problems in an exxon-mobil merger because competition in those areas is brisk . </s><s> but in retailing and marketing operations , an exxon-mobil combination would be `` like ford merging with general motors , macy 's with gimbels , '' said stephen axinn , an antitrust lawyer in new york who represented texaco in its acquisition of getty more than a decade ago . </s><s> in the united states , the deal would come under the purview of the federal trade commission , which under the clinton administration has examined large corporate mergers with a vigor not seen since the 1970s . </s><s> the agency has blocked a number of proposed mergers , such as the $ 4 billion combination of staples and office depot , the two largest office supply discounters , and two deals involving the four largest drug wholesalers . </s><s> on the other hand it has approved other big mergers , such as boeing 's $ 14 billion acquisition of mcdonnell douglas . </s><s> the agency 's analysis of an exxon-mobil combination , a senior official said friday , will turn on how it might resemble john d. rockefeller 's standard oil trust before it was dismantled by the supreme court in 1911 . </s><s> `` the big antitrust issue is whether , by a merger or alliance , they will be able to get the competition of one another off their backs , particularly against the background of bp-amoco and shell-texaco , '' said eleanor m. fox , a professor at the new york university school of law and an antitrust expert . </s><s> `` it may be that we are looking at a consolidation on the world level that looked like the consolidation on the national level 100 years ago . '' </s><s> the federal trade commission recently approved a significant joint venture between shell and texaco after the venture agreed to sell a refinery and divest some retailing operations in hawaii and california . </s><s> it is also considering the proposed $ 54 billion merger of british petroleum and amoco and will now have to re-examine that combination in light of the new talks between exxon and mobil . </s><s> `` in the past , when there have been two mergers involving the same industry , the government has considered them together in deciding how to deal with them , '' said terry calvani , a former commissioner at the federal trade commission whose clients now include chevron . </s><s> but coming in the aftermath of the shell-texaco and bp-amoco deals , a combination of exxon and mobil , which have significantly overlapping retail and refinery businesses in the united states and europe , poses questions that antitrust officials have not confronted since the 1980s . </s><s> `` it 's a real test case , '' said frederick leuffer , a senior energy analyst at bear stearns . </s><s> `` if the ftc let this one go through without major divesting , then everything would be fair game . </s><s> why could n't gm merge with ford ? '' </s><s> while the 1911 breakup of standard oil is viewed by washington officials and industry executives as ancient history , exxon and mobil have become the dominant rivals in some retailing and refining markets , and in the production of lubricants and petrochemicals . </s><s> leuffer said he believed divestitures necessary in this case `` could be so large that they are deal-breakers . '' </s><s> other analysts and lawyers , while disagreeing that the required divestitures could kill the deal , said the companies would nonetheless have to shed significant operations and that they expected challenges to be raised by a broad spectrum of constituents , including competitors , customers and state officials . </s><s> `` these are not absolute obstacles , '' said john hervey , an analyst at donaldson lufkin & amp ; jenrette . </s><s> in the past , when two big oil companies have merged , aggressive attorneys general from the states have almost always become involved in raising questions because of the high visibility of the local gas station . </s><s> `` when a state attorney general drives by and sees four stations on a corner and two of them are mobil and exxon , they are certain to raise questions , '' axinn said . </s><s> exxon and mobil have significant concentrations of retailing and marketing concerns in the northeast , the southwest and the west coast , where they also have big refining operations . </s><s> because the two companies are involved in everything from exploration and shipping to refining and retailing , the meaning of the deal for consumers will take months for the regulators to sort out . </s><s> the regulators examining such a transaction would dissect each business , determine whether its market is global , national or more local , and determine whether the combined entity has too high a concentration of the business in those areas . </s><s> experts agreed that the regulators are most likely to permit exxon and mobil to keep their exploratory and oil production businesses because those areas are already highly competitive and a merger would not result in higher prices . </s><s> hervey said those markets are already so fragmented that the combined market share of major american and european oil companies is only 17 percent .	experts say a possible exxon-mobil merger would entail divestitures .	a merger of exxon and mobile could spark anti-trust scrutiny	possible exxon-mobil merger would require sale of large corporate pieces	exxon , mobil confirm talks .  anti-trust case , sale of large units seen .

thousand work	refinery worker nt like merger idea  expect job cut	they have been downsized , cut back and re-engineered . </s><s> so when the 900 or so remaining blue-collar workers here at mobil 's largest domestic refinery , out of about 1,500 a decade ago , heard last week that their company was discussing a possible merger with exxon , it was like a siren warning them that an already suspect valve might be about to blow . </s><s> `` i think it 's a terrible thing , '' said dick mabry , a refinery operator , as he emerged in the plant 's artificial twilight from the main gate after his 12-hour shift ended at 4:30 on sunday morning . </s><s> he stopped to rub eyes rimmed with red , but on this topic his bedtime could be delayed . </s><s> `` it 's a revival of the standard oil company . </s><s> it 's going to put 20 or 30 thousand people out of work . </s><s> i think the justice department should step in and stop it . '' </s><s> ernest lewis , whose overalls bore a `` big e '' patch appropriate to his scale , added his uh-huh 's . </s><s> the latest evidence of where things were heading hulked right nearby , he said , glancing over at a new power plant likely to be operated by an outside company without the unions that now man the refinery 's generators . </s><s> but if the mobil corp. has to be sold , lewis said , noting the gains in his company stock holdings , a buyer as solid and large as the exxon corp. might be the least of all evils . </s><s> `` if we merged with chevron , we 'd be moron , '' he added . </s><s> a growing american economy that can make a billionaire out of someone with an unproven idea for internet marketing is still sloughing off workers in older industries , in petroleum as much as any . </s><s> those here point to the tote board by the beaumont plant 's brick headquarters , that they say shows they have already handled 171 million barrels out of 130 million planned for the full year . </s><s> but the numbers that matter even more are the ones like 89.9 , 88.9 , even 81.9 , on nearby gas stations _ the lowest prices , after inflation , since the depression . </s><s> which is why mobil and exxon are considering combining into the world 's largest oil company . </s><s> some people close to the talks cautioned that no deal would be considered by their boards until at least tuesday , maybe wednesday . </s><s> and that is why , beginning last wednesday evening , the phone at the home of jimmy herrington , the president of the oil , chemical and atomic workers local 4-243 rang without stop . </s><s> no , he did n't know about that merger talk on television , said herrington , who also works full-time producing lubricants . </s><s> he had asked some mobil managers , in a meeting earlier this month , about all the rumors , but they said they had heard nothing . </s><s> oil industry analysts say that the first targets of a combined company 's efforts to cut billions of dollars in annual costs would be the office staff and the professionals , like geologists and engineers , in the field . </s><s> one company 's accountants could almost do the work for two . </s><s> but the crews here fully expect that an exxon or any other buyer would ask yet again whether the refinery could turn more crude oil into gasoline , motor oil and other products with even fewer people . </s><s> union leaders raise the prospect that exxon would have to sell the refinery . </s><s> antitrust regulators , they say , are bound to notice that exxon has refineries an hour 's drive in one direction and three hours in the other , along a gulf of mexico crescent that forms the petrochemical industry 's home . </s><s> the beaumont plant , a steaming , humming chemistry set lining the neches river off the gulf , has become the prime provider of livelihoods here since it was built almost under the spray of the nearby spindletop gusher . </s><s> with mounting overtime that can stretch a shift to 16 hours or more , workers regularly make $ 55,000 or $ 65,000 a year . </s><s> `` people go there to retire there , '' herrington said , as he drove around the plant 's fenced periphery . </s><s> lewis , in his 17th year , is a third-generation employee . </s><s> but his nephew laboring here too is the exception . </s><s> the workers streaming to and from the plant before dawn are mostly balding or going gray , a sign that for a full generation the refinery has been more concerned about how to get rid of workers than how to attract them . </s><s> the cutbacks have , so far , come through attrition , with retirements often encouraged by incentives . </s><s> but the plywood sheets covering the windows of most of the fast food places and gas stations around herrington 's union hall advertise that the best times are long gone . </s><s> his members chafe at the experts who come in from wall street to question the justification for every person 's job . </s><s> in tiring and dangerous tasks , they question the elimination of most relief laborers in favor of covering vacations and sickness with overtime ( although some like the extra pay , and they say the plant has become safer over the years ) . </s><s> they complain about the growing numbers of outside contractors taking over formerly unionized tasks . </s><s> but with many workers choosing to invest at least some retirement savings in mobil stock , a 1990s ethos is gaining . </s><s> some share credit with the plant 's management for the efficiency measures they agree are necessary for true job security . </s><s> some take the attitude that every company is always for sale . </s><s> `` they will not be too concerned about what we feel about it , '' said sam salim , one of the electrical plant workers whose future is uncertain . </s><s> `` but if they fork out $ 60 billion ? </s><s> i 'd look it over . '' </s><s> with most mobil executives saying as little as possible for now , calls on sunday to the local plant manager and a company spokesman did not elicit a peep . </s><s> union leaders , however , are already squawking . </s><s> ''i do n't believe creating new monopolies is the way to prop up the industry , '' said robert wages , a former refinery operator himself and now the union 's president , by telephone saturday . </s><s> nevertheless , with admirable foresight the union negotiated a clause in last november 's three-year contract extension guaranteeing that any company buyer would have to keep to its terms . </s><s> many members , who typically came to work after high school , are already molding the oil companies ' latest exploits into case studies fit for rapacious mba 's . </s><s> `` they 're the biggest , '' said bobby whisneant , an assistant operator in the gasoline and lubrication oil units , referring to exxon . </s><s> he was coming , early on sunday morning , through a plant gate whose white canopy seems borrowed from a self-service station . </s><s> `` so they go buy the second biggest . </s><s> that 's one way to get rid of the competition . </s><s> i just hope it 's not something like the 80s _ buying companies and scrapping them . '' </s><s> or something like the robber baron era a century before , said mabry , another operator . </s><s> `` did n't the teachers teach us all through school that the standard oil company would never come back ? </s><s> remember that ? '' </s><s> he said , looking to his friend , lewis , the big e , for agreement . </s><s> `` but i better shut up . </s><s> i still work for mobil . '' </s><s> `` used to , '' lewis said .	mobil employee worries exxon-mobil merger would put thousands out of work .	mobile workers fear a merger with exxon could cost jobs	mobil workers believe merger with exxon will put thousands out of work	refinery workers do n't like merger idea , expect job cuts

livingston s disclosure	bob livingston , the incoming speaker of the house , took no public role friday as the debate unfolded on whether to impeach president clinton . </s><s> his previous 24 hours had been his most visible in the month since his party nominated him as speaker and perhaps the most excruciating in his public career : he spent most of the day in a chaotic procedural wrangle over the terms of friday 's debate ; he ended it by telling his republican colleagues that he had had extramarital affairs during his 20-year tenure in congress . </s><s> his disclosure followed an investigation by larry flynt , publisher of hustler , the sex magazine , who said friday at a news conference in beverly hills , calif. , that his publication had learned that livingston had had adulterous affairs during the last 10 years . </s><s> flynt said earlier this year that he wanted to expose the `` hypocrisy '' of those in washington who are investigating clinton and in october offered $ 1 million to anyone who could prove they had had affairs with members of congress . </s><s> he said friday that this larger investigation , to be published perhaps as soon as january , would reveal what he described as indiscretions of several other republicans . </s><s> he said he had no connection with the white house but that he had hired an investigative firm based in washington and made up of former employees of the fbi and the cia . </s><s> he would not confirm whether the firm is terry lenzner 's investigative group inc. , which has done work for the president 's private lawyers . </s><s> livingston was unavailable to reporters friday . </s><s> he spent some time friday morning sprawled in a chair in the back of the house chamber , listening to the debate over whether to impeach clinton for lying about his own sexual indiscretions . </s><s> several colleagues knelt at livingston 's knee , whispered to him and patted him on the back . </s><s> he spent most of the day in a private office off the chamber , avoiding the gauntlet of reporters who lay in wait for him between the house and his regular office across the street . </s><s> the only word out of his aides was that the navy had awarded contracts worth millions of dollars for ships to be built in his louisiana district at the avondale shipyards . </s><s> during friday 's debate , a handful of democrats made only oblique allusions to human failures . </s><s> for example , rep. john lewis , d-ga. , said : `` let he that has no sin cast the first stone . </s><s> who , who among us has not sinned ? '' </s><s> but no one said that livingston 's disclosure or the mild democratic attempts to exploit it would influence their votes on impeachment . </s><s> rather , on the house floor and in hallway chitchat , livingston 's conduct seemed to be the last thing that either republicans or democrats wanted to talk about . </s><s> `` bob livingston is a first-rate human being , '' said rep. david obey , d-wis. , who has worked closely and sparred with livingston on the appropriations committee , in an interview . </s><s> `` i will repeat what the nuns taught me at st. james a long time ago : we would all be a hell of a lot better off looking after our own souls rather than trying to evaluate somebody else 's . </s><s> none of us have any business even having an opinion on it . '' </s><s> even conservative republicans seemed ready to overlook the disclosure . </s><s> `` we 're not going to say , `bob , you ca n't be speaker because you violated your vows with your wife , ' '' said rep. lindsey graham , r-s.c. like many , including livingston , graham distinguished livingston 's conduct from clinton 's by saying that the president had `` trampled '' on the legal system whereas livingston 's behavior was strictly private . </s><s> despite flynt 's claims , many republicans blamed the clinton administration for smearing livingston , although they offered no evidence . </s><s> `` this is n't just happening on its own , '' said rep. dana rohrabacher , r calif .	larry flynt investigation forces livingston to admit adultery to colleagues	livingston 's admission of adultery draws mild reaction from colleagues	house speaker reveals he had extramarital affairs in his 20-year tenure	neither democrats nor republicans want to discuss livingston 's disclosure

resign midst clinton impeachment debate	speakerelect livingston s resignation clinton debate stuns house	the raw passions were such that the house democrats did not to hesitate to bellow `` you resign ! </s><s> you resign ! '' </s><s> at speaker-elect robert livingston when he called from the house floor for president clinton to quit the white house in the face of certain impeachment . </s><s> shockingly , stunningly , livingston did just that . </s><s> he quit in one breathtaking utterance , as if flicking a trump card onto the heap of impeachment angst festering before his eyes in the debating chamber . </s><s> in his one and only strategem in leading his fellow house republicans , livingston 's decision struck congress like a verbal bomb . </s><s> stunned democrats saw their fury vaporized upon the instant . </s><s> they had to stand , almost staggering to their feet , to join the republicans in a prolonged , emotional ovation for livingston and his undeniable self-sacrifice . </s><s> as they stood , the democrats sensed livingston had most suddenly closed a trap on the president and his defenders . </s><s> for , with the impeachment issue set to move to the senate , livingston , whose own marital indiscretions were now before the public to his obvious misery , chose to show how the question of a political leader 's resignation was very much in play in this tumult-tossed city . </s><s> `` i must set the example that i hope president clinton will follow , '' livingston declared , flabbergasting all attending the impeachment debate and the nation watching beyond . </s><s> livingston walked off the floor like the sheriff in some bullet-pocked political `` high noon , '' discarding the leadership badge he had wrested from the earlier speaker-casualty , newt gingrich . </s><s> in the corridor just beyond , a doorman shouted to a police officer : `` livingston just resigned ! '' </s><s> came the reply from the officer , who obviously thought the momentous announcement would be about clinton 's impeachment , not livingston 's political self-immolation . </s><s> just so , the democrats , already deep into bone-raw exhaustion after their long fight to save the president , grasped for bearings . </s><s> `` it is a surrender to a developing sexual mccarthyism ! '' </s><s> declared rep. jerrold nadler , d-n.y. , a leading presidential defender trying to rally democrats around the argument that livingston should not resign any more than president clinton should quit under fire . </s><s> but the republicans were surging to the fore on the strength of livingston 's announcement , fighting tears as they rose to salute him as the ultimate political role model in the grueling impeachment process as it roared into the final minutes of debate . </s><s> `` for some it is no longer good enough to make a mistake , to confirm that mistake and take the consequences of that mistake , '' said tom delay , the republican whip , his hands shaking , his eyes tearing as he addressed the house and sought to drive the example of livingston all the way down pennsylvania avenue . </s><s> `` he understood what this debate was all about _ honor , duty , integrity and the truth , '' said delay arguing that in one swift blow , livingston had demonstrated himself to have been a far better speaker than clinton has been a president . </s><s> with something of the political elan the president showed in initiating the iraq attack as his own impeachment loomed , house republicans , battered in public opinion polls , had found a rocket 's red glare of their own . </s><s> `` i have hurt you all deeply and beg your forgiveness , '' livingston told the house , the nation and his family as he announced retreat . </s><s> only moments before , democrats openly hissed the man as livingston firmly read his own judgment upon the president : `` sir , you have done great damage to this nation over the past year . '' </s><s> presidential resignation was in order , he continued , and then came the shouts of `` you resign ! </s><s> you resign ! '' </s><s> and as livingston closed the circle on his career , he stunned the place into a collective breath of disbelief and somehow almost threatened to reduce the dark historic issue before the house _ the impeachment of the president _ into a matter of anticlimax . </s><s> `` they must not succeed , '' david bonior , the democratic whip said of the republicans as he was given the task of refocusing the day on the misdeeds of the president , not the departure of the speaker . </s><s> `` we are here to debate impeachment and should not be distracted from that , '' he declared . </s><s> `` the only way we can stop this vicious cycle , '' bonior cried out from the floor , `` is if we refuse to give into it , whether it is bill clinton or bob livingston . '' </s><s> but the house was still reeling through the frenzied day as the fateful vote on the presidency approached and the notion of resignation licked about the capital city like a flame in a forest .	livingston calls on clinton to quit ; democrats yell `` you resign ! self-righteousness	livingston resignation shock house  say clinton follow example	livingston  announce resignation  urge like action clinton	house speaker admit adultery  resigns  urge clinton follow suit	president clinton disappoint livingston s resignation  resign	rep. bob livingston , who confessed to his colleagues thursday night that he had had adulterous affairs , stunned the house chamber saturday morning by saying in the impeachment debate on president clinton that he would not serve as speaker and would quit congress in six months . </s><s> he urged the president to follow his example and quit , too . </s><s> but at the white house , where calls for clinton 's resignation are derided as a republican strategy , the president sent a spokesman into the driveway to urge livingston to reconsider his resignation . </s><s> livingston stood in the well of the house he has served for two decades and called on clinton to resign his office rather than force a trial in the senate , drawing boos from his colleagues and cat-calls that he should quit instead . </s><s> `` i must set the example that i hope president clinton will follow , '' livingston announced to a shocked and silent chamber in an act that left the republican party in total chaos just hours before the vote to impeach clinton . </s><s> the decision also left the party leaderless on the eve of the opening of the 106th congress , when republicans must govern with one of the narrowest majorities in history . </s><s> several republicans , including rep. tom delay of texas , the majority whip , somberly welcomed the news , suggesting it relieved them of an excruciating embarrassment . </s><s> in lauding livingston 's move , delay said , `` he understood what this debate was all about _ it 's about honor and decency and integrity and the truth , everything we honor in this country . '' </s><s> but democrats said they were aghast , and many _ including clinton _ called on livingston to reconsider his decision . </s><s> `` mr. livingston 's resignation was wrong , '' declared rep. jerrold nadler , d-n.y. `` it is a surrender to a developing sexual mccarthyism . </s><s> are we going to have a new test if someone wants to run for public office _ are you now or have you ever been an adulterer ? '' </s><s> he called on the country to distinguish between sins and crimes . </s><s> white house press secretary joe lockhart said clinton was `` disappointed '' at the news of livingston 's plans and wished that he would reconsider . </s><s> lockhart said the president `` firmly believes that the politics of personal destruction in this town and this country has to come to an end . '' </s><s> he reaffirmed that clinton would not resign , saying : `` the president is going to do what 's in the best interest of the country . </s><s> it would be wrong to give in to this insidious politics of personal destruction . '' </s><s> livingston 's announced resignation was all the more stunning for its disclosure in a process that could result in the president 's removal from office . </s><s> the speaker is second in line to the presidency , after the vice president . </s><s> newt gingrich , the outgoing speaker , who was driven from the post after republicans lost five seats in the november election , technically remains speaker until jan. 6 , when livingston 's election was to be ratified by the new congress . </s><s> but gingrich has removed himself from the daily operations of the house at this extraordinary session and has begun to dismantle his office . </s><s> livingston 's decision was said to be driven in part by the anger of a group of about a dozen conservatives in his party who were disillusioned that he had withheld news of his affairs from them . </s><s> they had threatened to withhold their votes for him in the election in january that would formally make him speaker . </s><s> he was also concerned about the pain caused to his family by further disclosures , some members said . </s><s> they added that , not lost on many in his party , was the example he would set for the president by offering to resign his post now . </s><s> delay , no . </s><s> 3 in the house republican leadership , is expected to fill the power vacuum at least temporarily , in deed if not in title , while the party regroups to find a new speaker . </s><s> many members quickly rallied around rep. dennis hastert of illinois . </s><s> hastert , one of delay 's deputy whips who is well respected among his colleagues , had been promoted as a candidate for majority leader last month , but never mounted a campaign . </s><s> rep. dick armey of texas only precariously held on to his majority-leader post last month and was not considered a likely candidate for speaker . </s><s> he is expected to manage the reorganization , which republican leaders have set for jan. 4 . </s><s> livingston met privately with his closest advisers friday as the impeachment debate unfolded . </s><s> some of his colleagues believed he had made a mistake in disclosing thursday night _ just as the house was moving into the divisive debate over impeachment _ that he had `` on occasion strayed from my marriage . '' </s><s> he told republican leaders late thursday afternoon that hustler magazine was going to expose his affairs early next year . </s><s> some leaders urged him to keep quiet , but his wife , bonnie , encouraged him to tell his colleagues immediately , despite the momentous vote that was nearing on the floor . </s><s> at that point thursday night , roll call , a newspaper on capitol hill , reported on its web site that livingston was going to admit to the affairs and was going to offer to resign . </s><s> in a closed-door meeting with his fellow republicans , he did admit to the affairs but made no offer to step down , receiving three standing ovations instead . </s><s> thursday night , livingston stated that he would `` not be intimidated by these efforts '' to exploit his past . </s><s> but friday he removed himself from public action and that night drew his closest advisers into his confidence . </s><s> his aides said saturday that they had no clue what was he was contemplating , and few other members were aware of his plans . </s><s> asked if he had any advance word , rep. j.c. watts of oklahoma , a newly elected member of the republican leadership , said : `` i had no idea . '' </s><s> asked if there had been internal party pressure on livingston to resign , rep. harold rogers , r-ky. , said : `` i did n't know about it if there was , '' but added , `` there were some members who were critical of it . '' </s><s> as the leaders tried saturday to hold the party together on and off the house floor , most republicans stuck to their prepared scripts on the floor in favor of impeaching the president . </s><s> but some began expressing their anguish . </s><s> rep. henry hyde , r-ill. , who admitted to his own adulterous affair earlier this year , said after livingston 's resignation : `` those of us who are sinners must feel wretched today . </s><s> something is going on repeatedly that has to be stopped , and that is a confusion between private acts of infidelity and public acts . '' </s><s> to much applause , hyde declared : `` congress has no business intruding into private acts . '' </s><s> republicans , indeed livingston himself , had made this same distinction between clinton 's sexual indiscretions and livingston 's , saying that clinton lied about his private acts and therefore abused the legal system and his powers . </s><s> as livingston said in his statement thursday : `` these indiscretions were not with employees on my staff and i have never been asked to testify under oath about them . '' </s><s> democrats hoped that livingston 's seemingly drastic action would wake up the house to how poisoned the atmosphere had become and might prompt republicans to reconsider the impeachment of clinton . </s><s> rep. paul kanjorski , d-pa. , said , `` we are now starting to offer up sacrificial lambs to whatever terrible disease this is . '' </s><s> in a stirring speech applauded even by some republicans , rep. dick gephardt of missouri , the democratic leader , praised livingston as a `` worthy , good and honorable man '' and said his resignation was a grave mistake . </s><s> `` it 's a terrible capitulation to the negative political forces that are consuming our political system and our country , '' gephardt said , adding that the events of the last few days showed `` life imitates farce . '' </s><s> `` we need to stop destroying imperfect people at an unattainable altar of public morality , '' he said , urging his colleagues to `` step back from the abyss '' and reject resignation , impeachment and `` vicious self-righteousness . ''	livingston resignation shocks house ; says clinton should follow his example	livingston , in announcing resignation , urges like action from clinton	house speaker admits adultery , resigns , and urges clinton to follow suit	president clinton disappointed at livingston 's resignation ; will not resign

</s><s> the smart money shouts that president clinton will never resign , and he concurs . </s><s> the smart money argues that the senate could not muster the 67 votes that would be needed to remove the wounded president from office , which would require the defection of 12 democrats if all the republicans stand against him . </s><s> the smart money insists that someone will cut a deal to end all this . </s><s> maybe so . </s><s> but the smarter money whispers , `` remember . '' </s><s> remember that everyone in washington , including rep. henry hyde , r-ill. , chairman of the judiciary committee , said the house would never , ever , treat impeachment as a partisan issue . </s><s> wrong . </s><s> remember that all the pundits predicted democratic losses in the midterm elections , and when the opposite happened , they said impeachment was dead . </s><s> twice wrong . </s><s> and remember that in the new year the nation may travel down a road it has never traveled before . </s><s> one other president , andrew johnson of tennessee , has been tried by the senate , of course . </s><s> but that happened in a different country _one with only 37 states , with primitive communications , with a simple economy based largely on agriculture , with only minimal commitments abroad . </s><s> in the toxic politics of century 's end in washington , the inconceivable has become the commonplace . </s><s> the wholly unanticipated announcement saturday morning by rep. robert livingston , r-la. , that he would not serve as speaker and would resign from congress , following his equally unanticipated disclosure on thursday night of several extramarital affairs , only deepened the capital 's profound sense of insecurity . </s><s> the deadly sweep of the scythe of neo-puritanism appears unstoppable , at least for the moment , and livingston 's forthcoming resignation will increase the pressure on the president to do likewise . </s><s> `` you 've set before us an example , '' the leader of house republican majority , rep. dick armey of texas , told livingston saturday . </s><s> `` the example is that principle comes before power . '' </s><s> the democrats made the opposite point , arguing that the livingston case showed how very wrong it was to savage people for personal pecaddillos . </s><s> one transcendently important thing remains the same : although surrounded by judicial trappings and presided over by the chief justice , trials of presidents are political processes , with power residing in the hands of elective politicians . </s><s> in addition to narrow legal issues of guilt or innocence , they can weigh considerations of party , the nation 's future , their own individual political well-being and almost anything else they care to weigh in reaching a verdict . </s><s> the longer they took , the more numerous the call for resignation would probably be . </s><s> even before saturday 's epochal roll-calls , four of ten americans interviewed in the latest new york times/cbs news poll said they thought the president should step down if he were to be indicted , despite the fact that a large majority voiced disapproval of the impeachment proceedings . </s><s> what lies behind that seeming contradiction , of course , is the fear that clinton , and the country with him , would be incapacitated . </s><s> no one took andrew johnson very seriously after he escaped conviction by a single vote . </s><s> but clinton , a man of powerful will whose whole life has been a series of comebacks , has already embarked on an effort to show that he can do the nation 's business . </s><s> richard nixon clawed his way back to respectability after leaving the white house when no one thought he could ; clinton intends to re-establish his authority while still in office . </s><s> he has one great advantage : two-thirds of the american public continues to voice its approval of his political stewardship , whatever it thinks of him as a man . </s><s> the president will press hard , despite his much-reduced leverage , for a deal on censure . </s><s> indeed , in as fine a piece of political irony as one could ask for , he has already sought to enlist former sen. bob dole , the republican he defeated in 1996 , as an emissary to the senate majority . </s><s> the numbers are not unpromising : with the help of six republicans , the 45 democrats could end the trial at any time and pass a censure resolution that the house would surely take up . </s><s> there are enough republican moderates and sometime party-buckers to make that a plausible target . </s><s> but the republican leader in the senate , trent lott of mississippi , who has made his unwillingness to take the president 's word plainly evident in recent days , is determined to fight such a trial-aborting arrangement . </s><s> it is clear that clinton 's reputation has been stained forever , no matter what the senate does . </s><s> the spot will not out . </s><s> history will remember this man who so coveted a glowing legacy not as an impresario of economic growth , not as the moses who pointed the way to the 21st century , but as the second president ever to be impeached , if not as the first to be ousted . </s><s> that harsh word , `` impeachment , '' will cling to his name as surely as `` teapot dome '' clings to harding 's and `` depression '' to hoover 's . </s><s> but he is not alone in having suffered grievous injury in the political avalanche that was shaken loose by the disclosure of clinton 's sexual relationship with a former white house intern , monica lewinsky . </s><s> the republicans ' public support has shriveled to 40 percent in the new times/cbs news poll , its lowest level in 14 years , and it could go lower once the fact of impeachment sinks in . </s><s> journalists are seen by many as jackals , indifferent to whatever personal suffering or national angst they may cause as long as they get the story , and none too concerned about accuracy . </s><s> in fact , the whole political culture of the 1990s , with its criminalization of political conduct and its seeming indifference to important national and international issues , has fallen into disrepute with ordinary americans . </s><s> the last week seemed to crystallize the long-term decline in political civility . </s><s> republicans called clinton a liar , even as he was committing american pilots to the skies over iraq , and democrats accused their rivals of conducting a political lynching or a political coup d'etat . </s><s> bipartisanship may have been the biggest victim of all . </s><s> party lines on saturday 's rolls calls held as firm as leg irons . </s><s> almost all of the republicans who opposed impeachment did so not exclusively on legal principle but at least partly because of special political circumstances _ the democratic majority in rep. constance morella 's district in the maryland suburbs of washington , for example , and the gratitude of rep. peter king , r-n.y. , for clinton 's peacemaking in ireland . </s><s> it is hard to see who has emerged from it with reputation enhanced , except perhaps hillary rodham clinton , staunch in the face of deception . </s><s> if some of the threats and dire predictions uttered by house democrats in recent days are to be taken at face value , the nation is entering upon an era of bad feelings , the polar opposite of a second era of good feelings , similar to that of the 1820s , that clinton had hoped to preside over . </s><s> rep. tom sawyer , d-ohio , compared clinton on friday to sir thomas more , executed for treason in 1535 because of his religious beliefs . </s><s> he quoted more 's words as an admonition for today : `` what you have hunted me for is not my actions but for the thoughts of my heart . </s><s> it is a long road you have opened . </s><s> god help the statesmen who walk your road . '' </s><s> but amidst all the loose talk about permanent damage to this institution or that , remember : things change with startling speed in modern american politics , and the institutions of american government have proved extraordinarily resilient . </s><s> president nixon , it was almost universally agreed in 1974 , had weakened the american presidency for many decades to come . </s><s> nobody said that after eight years under ronald reagan , and that was only 15 years later .	livingston 's surprise resignation puts pressure on clinton to do likewise .	clinton impeachment uncertain as partisan politics prevail	clinton impeachment issue deepens capital 's profound sense of uncertainty	crisis extends beyond clinton , but political institutions will survive

impeach clinton perjury demand resignation	clinton  impeachment  perjury  politics personal destruction  nixon	rejecting a last-minute democratic attempt to soften its action to censure , the house of representatives moved to impeach president william jefferson clinton for perjury on saturday and to call on the senate to try him , convict him and remove him from office . </s><s> but even before the vote , republicans pressed another line of attack , demanding clinton 's resignation . </s><s> rep. robert livingston , nominated for speaker last month by his party , startled the house when he announced he would not run for speaker and would resign from the house after 21 years of service . </s><s> he urged the president to `` heal the wounds that you have created . </s><s> you , sir , may resign your post . '' </s><s> angry democrats booed and shouted , `` you resign ! '' </s><s> livingston continued , `` i can only challenge you in such fashion if i am willing to heed my own words . '' </s><s> apologizing again for extramarital affairs revealed two days ago , he said , `` i believe i had it in me to do a fine job . </s><s> but i can not do that job or be the kind of leader that i would like to be under current circumstances . '' </s><s> then he bolted from the house chamber , nearly knocking reporters and members down . </s><s> ( the house voted 228-206 to approve the first article of impeachment , accusing clinton of committing perjury before a federal grand jury . </s><s> the vote was announced at 1:24 p.m. est , leaving the 42nd president to face trial in the senate on whether he should be removed from office . ) </s><s> clinton rejected the advice immediately . </s><s> his spokesman , joe lockhart , said , `` the president has no intention of resigning . '' </s><s> by calling on livingston to reconsider , the president argued more broadly against resignation under fire . </s><s> perhaps speaking to both cases , lockhart said , `` it would be wrong to give in to this insidious politics of personal destruction . '' </s><s> unless clinton changes course , this would be only the second impeachment of a president in the 209-year history of the republic , and the first since andrew johnson was acquitted in 1868 . </s><s> sen. trent lott of mississippi , the majority leader , has insisted that no bargaining over censure can prevent it from starting . </s><s> but the senate could halt a trial later as part of a deal . </s><s> considering the degree of partisanship displayed saturday , assembling the two-thirds majority required under the constitution for conviction is most unlikely . </s><s> sixty-seven votes would be required , and there are only 55 republicans in the senate , along with 45 democrats . </s><s> four articles of impeachment before the house charged clinton with perjury in lying about his affair with monica lewinsky to a federal grand jury here on aug. 17 . </s><s> he was also charged with perjury in the paula jones sexual harassment suit , obstruction of justice and abuse of power . </s><s> the republican argument , over and over , was that clinton had lied in denying having sexual relations with ms. lewinsky . </s><s> rep. dick armey of texas , the majority leader , said , `` a nation of laws can not be ruled by a person who breaks the law . '' </s><s> rep. nancy johnson of connecticut said : `` there can be no justice without the truth . </s><s> that is just profoundly so , and that is why perjury matters . '' </s><s> rep. gerald kleczka of wisconsin began the democrats ' arguments by saying , `` what the president did was wrong , both personally and morally , but his acts did not threaten our democracy and thus do not rise to the level of impeachable offenses as defined by our founding fathers in our constitution . '' </s><s> rep. charles schumer , new york 's senator-elect , said : `` the rule of law requires that the punishment fit the crime . </s><s> allow us to vote for censure . '' </s><s> saturday 's votes were the penultimate step in the most serious conflict between congress and a president since richard m. nixon resigned in the face of impeachment and certain conviction on aug. 9 , 1974 . </s><s> but while that case spun out from a 1972 break-in at democratic headquarters in the watergate complex , this one began with a murky land deal in arkansas in 1978 . </s><s> through the efforts of kenneth starr , the independent counsel under the law enacted in the wake of watergate , the investigation spread to examine clinton 's affair with a white house intern . </s><s> all year it has preoccupied the capital despite an immense disconnect with public opinion ; since the scandal became public in january , polls have shown that the public opposed impeachment and wanted the inquiry brought to an end . </s><s> even on friday night , after a 13-hour debate , a cbs news poll of 548 people showed that only 38 percent wanted their representative to vote for impeachment ; 58 percent wanted a no vote . </s><s> the conflict now enters uncharted seas , since the nixon resignation cut the matter short and the johnson trial occurred in a different america , with no nuclear weapons or cable television or public opinion polls . </s><s> but the capital was still rife with confident speculation . </s><s> some guessed , or hoped , that the results of the recent poll , which showed increases in support for resignation as a way to spare the nation a trial in which ms. lewinsky and linda tripp would be star witnesses , would weaken clinton 's resolve . </s><s> others thought the republicans , seeing dismal numbers in polls about their party 's standing in the united states , would be the first to blink . </s><s> with a majority in the senate , they have the power to end a trial at any time after the senate receives notice of impeachment on the day it convenes , jan. 6 , or the next day . </s><s> but while clinton has focused on the polls , and the cbs news survey showed that 64 percent still approve of his handling of his job as president , resignation could almost immediately subject him to criminal prosecution . </s><s> and republicans have steadfastly ignored the polls all year , and confronted them directly on saturday . </s><s> representative j.c. watts of oklahoma , newly elected as chairman of the republican caucus , said : `` what 's popular is n't always right . </s><s> you say polls are against this . </s><s> polls measure changing feelings , not steadfast principle . </s><s> polls would have rejected the ten commandments . </s><s> polls would have embraced slavery and ridiculed women 's rights . </s><s> `` you say we must draw this to a close . </s><s> i say we must draw a line between right and wrong , not with a tiny fine line of an executive fountain pen , but with the big fat lead of a no . </s><s> 2 pencil . </s><s> and we must do it so every kid in america can see it . </s><s> the point is not whether the president can prevail , but whether truth can prevail . '' </s><s> last weekend , when the judiciary committee recommended the four articles of impeachment , clinton 's side still hoped to prevail with the help of 20 to 30 republican moderates who were uncommitted . </s><s> as the week wore on , almost all of them broke against the president . </s><s> one who did not , rep. christopher shays of connecticut , said saturday : `` after judge starr 's report to congress in september , and his presentation to the judiciary committee in november , i concluded that impeachable offenses were not proven , and that the proven offenses were not impeachable . </s><s> `` but the president 's continued failure to come to grips with his actions , the sincerity and arguments of members of the judiciary committee from both sides of the aisle , the change of heart and conviction by members on my side of the aisle who originally opposed impeachment and who now support it , and the strong and powerful opinion of so many of my constituents who oppose my position and who wanted the president impeached caused me to rethink my position . '' </s><s> he added : `` yesterday morning , before i visited with the president , i concluded that my original position was the correct one , for me . </s><s> i believe that the impeachable offenses have not been proven , and that the proven offenses are not impeachable . '' </s><s> but rep. tom delay of texas , who has led the republican effort to force clinton from office , dismissed his and other arguments as moral relativism . </s><s> he began by praising livingston : `` there is no greater american in my mind , at least today , than bob livingston , because he understood what this debate was all about . </s><s> it was about honor and decency and integrity and the truth ; everything that we honor in this country . </s><s> it was also a debate about relativism vs. absolute truth . '' </s><s> he continued , `` the president 's defenders have said that the president is morally reprehensible , that he is reckless , that he has violated the trust of the american people , lessened their esteem for the office of president and dishonored the office which they have entrusted him , and that _ but that does n't rise to the level of impeachment . '' </s><s> rep. jose serrano of new york said , `` my constituents do n't hate bill clinton ; they love him and they 're praying for him right at this very moment . </s><s> you may have the votes today to impeach him , but you do n't have the american people . </s><s> and let me tell you something , i grew up in the public housing projects of the south bronx . </s><s> i can see a bunch of bullies when i see them . </s><s> the bullies get theirs , and you 're going to get yours , too . </s><s> rep. henry hyde of illinois , the judiciary committee chairman who brought the charges to the house floor , said the congress and the american people needed to distinguish between private acts of infidelity and public acts by public officials . </s><s> in clinton 's case , he said , the house was dealing with `` a serial violator of the oath who is the chief law-enforcement officer . '' </s><s> he said that the senate could be `` innovative and creative '' in deciding how best to punish clinton , but that the house was bound by the constitution to move ahead with articles of impeachment . </s><s> `` justice is so important to the most humble among us , '' hyde said . </s><s> `` equal justice under the law _ that 's what we 're fighting for . '' </s><s> democrats , reading from the same constitution , voiced diametrically opposite conclusions , and attacked the fairness of the proceedings that culminated saturday . </s><s> `` we 're losing track of distinction between sins and crimes , '' said rep. jerrold nadler , d-n.y. `` we 're lowering the standards of impeachment . </s><s> what the president has done is not a great and dangerous offense to the republic . '' </s><s> democrats also criticized republicans for impeaching clinton at the very moment that u.s. troops waged war against iraq . </s><s> `` six days before christmas our troops are in battle , and a lame-duck congress is rushing to overthrow the commander in chief , '' said rep. david bonior of michigan , the second-ranking house democrat . </s><s> the ghosts of watergate hung over the house chamber . </s><s> one republican cited the parallels between the charges the house judiciary committee brought against nixon 25 years ago , and the counts that the same committee brought to the house floor for affirmation on saturday . </s><s> `` nixon cheated . </s><s> he cheated the electoral system , '' said rep. lindsey graham , a south carolina republican on the judiciary committee . </s><s> and now , graham said , the full house is voting to impeach clinton `` because we believe he committed crimes that result in cheating our judicial system . '' </s><s> but most of the day 's debate was firmly rooted in clinton 's effort to conceal his sexual affair with monica lewinsky . </s><s> rep. bob barr , a georgia republican on the judiciary committee who is one of clinton 's fiercest critics , held up copies of the u.s. criminal code , the judiciary committee 's report on the impeachment inquiry and , finally , the constitution , in defending his decision to impeach the president . </s><s> `` today , we rely on the three pillars of our society : the law itself , evidence and the constitution , '' said barr . </s><s> `` there is no joy in upholding the law , '' watts said . </s><s> `` if we can not see lawlessness , our children can not recognize it . </s><s> how can we tell our children honesty is the best policy when we do n't demand it as a policy ? '' </s><s> but democrats assailed the very premise on which the republican majority built its impeachment case against clinton . </s><s> rep. john conyers jr. of michigan , the ranking democrat on the judiciary committee , assailed the four articles of impeachment , count by count , as unfounded by evidence and failing to rise to impeachment . </s><s> he saved his most savage scorn for the final count , abuse of power . </s><s> `` the majority has simply tried to dress up the perjury counts in the watergate abuse-of-power language , '' conyers said .	house moves to impeach clinton for perjury ; calls on senate to try him .	livingston calls on clinton to follow his example and resign	house moves to impeach clinton for perjury and demands his resignation	clinton , impeachment , perjury , politics of personal destruction , nixon
