annuls destruction israel clause	israel wo nt withdraw west bank troop without vote revoke 1964 clause	day clinton  two side read different thing wye peace accord	israel affirmed friday that it will not withdraw troops in the west bank unless the top palestinian decision-making body holds a vote to annul clauses of the plo charter calling for israel 's destruction . </s><s> just a day before u.s. president bill clinton 's arrival , israel also rejected a u.s. compromise on the release of palestinian prisoners , an issue that has sparked riots in the west bank . </s><s> the palestinians have said they would revoke the clauses only by acclamation , not by a vote , when the palestine national council meets on monday in clinton 's presence . </s><s> with its demand , israel may be setting itself up for a showdown with clinton whose visit to israel and the palestinian is ushering in the next stage of the wye river land-for-security agreement he helped negotiate . </s><s> under the accord , the annulment of the offending provisions by the pnc is to clear the way for an israeli troop pullback . </s><s> clinton is unlikely to declare the pnc has not completed its task because that would mean his high-profile visit has been a failure . </s><s> however , israeli officials said they would not drop their demand for a vote . </s><s> `` they have to vote in the pnc , '' said israeli government spokesman moshe fogel . </s><s> otherwise , he said , israel will not turn over additional west bank territory to the palestinians because `` transfer of territory is irreversible . '' </s><s> in washington , deputy u.s. state department spokesman james foley was evasive on whether the united states expected a vote from the pnc . </s><s> `` the procedures need to be clear enough that nullification has taken place , '' he said . </s><s> a senior palestinian official , speaking on condition of anonymity , said the united states has not asked palestinian leader yasser arafat to consider holding a vote . </s><s> on thursday , the palestinians took an interim step when a smaller leadership body , the 124-member palestinian central council , declared the charter clauses revoked . </s><s> the 95 members present were asked whether they approved a letter in which arafat informed clinton that the charter clauses calling for israel 's destruction were null and void . </s><s> in all , 81 voted in favor , seven against and seven abstained . </s><s> asked about the decision , arafat would only say that `` it was a very important and constructive meeting . '' </s><s> the palestinian leader also said he hoped clinton would exert pressure on israel to keep its obligations under the wye agreement . </s><s> the palestine liberation organization charter was drawn up three decades ago , long before israel and the palestinians started their peace process in 1993 . </s><s> the palestinians say they took all the required steps to revoke the pertinent clauses at a pnc session in gaza in 1996 . </s><s> however , netanyahu has said the pnc never completed the job . </s><s> during the wye river talks , the palestinians agreed in a compromise to invite pnc members and delegates from other groups to gaza to hear clinton and arafat speak . </s><s> the wye accord says delegates should `` reaffirm '' the arafat letter to clinton , but does not specifically refer to a vote . </s><s> former israeli prime minister shimon peres sided with the palestinians on friday . </s><s> `` they did it once , they did it twice , they do n't have to do it again , '' said peres , who was prime minister during the pnc vote in 1996 . </s><s> israel and the palestinians have also accused each other of violating other elements of the wye agreement . </s><s> a key point of contention has been israel 's pledge to release 750 palestinian prisoners in three stages by the end of january . </s><s> the palestinians have said israel broke a promise to release prisoners held for anti-israeli activities . </s><s> israel said it never made such a pledge , and accused the palestinian authority of incitement over the prisoner issue . </s><s> palestinian negotiator saeb erekat said the united states offered a compromise , a trilateral committee to go over the list of prisoners one by one and determine who will be released . </s><s> but israeli cabinet secretary danny naveh said friday such a proposal was unacceptable . </s><s> `` israel has not been offered such a compromise and there will not be such a compromise , '' naveh said . </s><s> on friday , about 2,000 supporters of the islamic militant hamas movement marched through the west bank town of nablus to press for the release or prisoners . </s><s> `` we want prisoners , not clinton , '' the crowd chanted . </s><s> at jerusalem 's al aqsa mosque , islam 's third holiest site , the prayer leader , yousef abu sneineh , spoke out sharply against the u.s.-brokered peace agreement . </s><s> `` america supports a peace agreement that further reinforces the israeli occupation of the palestinian lands , '' he said .	israel , palestinians disagree over wye accord terms before clinton 's trip .	israel leaving west bank if palestine annuls destruction of israel clause	israel wo n't withdraw west bank troops without vote on revoking 1964 clause	day before clinton , two sides read different things into wye peace accord .

blood feud personal crusade clinton	clinton s visit ease ignite historic  rabid  arabjewish feuding	on a street newly littered with the debris of battle _ stones , spent tear gas canisters , charred remnants of half-burned tires _ a sodden palestinian flag flaps in a fitful rain-laden wind outside a house in mourning . </s><s> inside , to the tinny recorded wail of koranic verses , neighbors and relatives of the dead man _ a 21-year-old university student felled on the roof of his own home by an israeli soldier 's rubber-coated bullet _ sipped tiny cups of coffee left unsweetened to symbolize the bitter occasion . </s><s> some smoked , a few spoke quietly among themselves , but most simply sat in reflective silence . </s><s> among those in attendance on this day , the first of the traditional three days of family mourning , was saeb erekat , the chief peace negotiator for yasser arafat 's palestinian authority . </s><s> the dead youth , nasr erekat , was a cousin of his . </s><s> erekat stayed for a time , sitting amid clan elders in arab headdresses and teen-age nephews in american-style athletic shoes , then slipped away for a meeting in connection with president clinton 's visit beginning this weekend . </s><s> `` it 's been very difficult , '' he said later , asked about carrying on his negotiating duties at such a time . </s><s> `` i have a great sense of sorrow and sadness , a feeling of such loss . </s><s> i hope god will enable me to use my grief to strengthen my determination for peace . '' </s><s> the scene at the erekat home , in the arab village of abu dis on jerusalem 's eastern outskirts , drives home a central truth about the israeli-palestinian conflict : on both sides of the divide , the political is also deeply personal . </s><s> and that inescapability goes to the heart of the quarrel 's intractability . </s><s> in the glare of world attention , it is easy to forget that there are fewer people living in israel and the palestinian lands combined than there are in new york city . </s><s> in the small and jostling confines of what few here choose to call the holy land , the conflict touches all . </s><s> everyone has a stake in it . </s><s> israelis fret daily over soldier sons on dangerous patrol in the west bank and gaza strip , or shudder when they pass a sidewalk cafe once ripped by an islamic militant 's suicide bomb . </s><s> palestinian families struggle to keep alive the memories of fathers and brothers languishing in israeli prisons , and chafe under the checkpoints and gunsights of israeli troops . </s><s> on both sides , the youngest soak up fear and anger along with their abcs . </s><s> and elders ' memories of half a century past still rise to trouble the collective sleep : the shadow of the holocaust for israelis , the trauma of exile and dispossession for the palestinians . </s><s> against this backdrop , amid a landscape little changed since biblical times , terrible old testament themes _ lamentation and retribution , the smiting of enemies and the sharpening of swords _ spring to life once again in any day 's headlines . </s><s> now comes clinton , this most american of presidents , one who has made middle east peacemaking a kind of personal crusade , in hopes of halting what has become one of the century 's most protracted blood feuds . </s><s> clinton is no stranger to these particular hatreds . </s><s> three years ago , in another winter season , he came here to bury prime minister yitzhak rabin , gunned down by a nationalist jew who could not abide the terms of a mideast agreement that called _ just as this latest accord does _ for israel to cede west bank land in exchange for peace with the palestinians . </s><s> on the occasion of this visit _ first intended to celebrate the wye river accords signed seven weeks ago in washington , now meant to salvage them _ all three of the principals are embattled . </s><s> clinton is under an impeachment cloud ; arafat is buffeted by furious palestinian street protests and his own failing health , and prime minister benjamin netanyahu 's coalition government is hanging by a thread . </s><s> the days leading up to clinton 's visit have been divisive ones , contriving somehow to simultaneously tap into both sides ' greatest fears . </s><s> in the west bank 's worst spasm of violence in months , israelis watched windows of israeli-plated cars shatter from stones thrown by angry youths , saw tv footage of a cringing israeli soldier _ now facing court martial _ being beaten bloody by a palestinian mob , heard palestinian officials ' exhortations for a new intefadeh , or uprising . </s><s> palestinians , for their part , listened in anger as netanyahu announced the suspension of an upcoming israeli troop pullback in the west bank and tried vainly to halt israeli bulldozers expanding jewish settlements on land they claim as their own . </s><s> both sides _ to palestinians ' satisfaction , and israel 's dismay _ came to see the visit as an implicit acknowledgement of palestinian statehood aspirations , despite increasingly desperate american efforts to avoid casting it in that light . </s><s> clinton 's foray to the gaza strip , which is already under palestinian rule , will be the first by a sitting american president . </s><s> palestinians intend to play on that symbolism for all it is worth , greeting him with the strains of their once-banned national anthem . </s><s> in the mourning house in abu dis , though , the friends and relatives of nasr erekat had little to say about politics and statehood . </s><s> they talked about nasr instead . </s><s> amr erekat , 27 , recalled his disbelief as he cradled his dying cousin in his arms . </s><s> his 14-year-old brother taher spoke haltingly of the big brother he had looked up to . </s><s> his childhood friend , samir abdel salam , remembered wishing he had stuck to his studies as diligently as nasr had . </s><s> saeb erekat , the peace negotiator , could find neither lesson nor logic to his young cousin 's death . </s><s> `` it 's senseless , this rhythm of bloodshed , '' he said . </s><s> `` at these difficult times , you pray for one thing , for both sides : no more of it . ''	violence , loss , fear for israelis , palestinians ; clinton -- impeachment woes	israeli-palestinian clash is intractable because political is also personal	ending long israeli-palestinian blood feud personal crusade for clinton	will clinton 's visit ease or ignite historic , rabid , arab-jewish feuding ?

peace choice  office shaky	mideast wye accord offtrack clinton visit  action stall  violence	in an atmosphere of political tension , u.s. president clinton met sunday with israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu in a bid to put the troubled wye river peace accord back on track . </s><s> after getting together for breakfast in clinton 's hotel suite , the two leaders met at netanyahu 's office and planned to talk to reporters later . </s><s> the president was sure to be asked about the impeachment drama unfolding in washington . </s><s> at a late-night arrival ceremony for clinton saturday , netanyahu said he hoped the president 's visit would `` contribute to true peace . '' </s><s> again , the israeli leader accused the palestinians of ignoring commitments in peace accords . </s><s> clinton is to meet with palestinian leader yasser arafat on monday in the gaza strip . </s><s> thousands of police were deployed throughout israel during the clinton visit . </s><s> at the hotel where clinton is staying , 500 policemen were posted to guard the president and his 600-member delegation . </s><s> clinton 's wife , hillary , and their daughter , chelsea , set out on their own schedule . </s><s> mrs. clinton toured a school in a cooperative village of jews and palestinians , while chelsea visited jerusalem 's western wall , judaism 's holiest site . </s><s> israeli foreign minister ariel sharon told reporters during a picture-taking session with secretary of state madeleine albright that israel `` has not left '' the wye river agreement . </s><s> `` we will not give up '' on the land-for-security accord , sharon said . </s><s> but , he added , `` it should be based on mutual reciprocity . '' </s><s> about two hours before air force one landed saturday night , the house judiciary committee approved a fourth article of impeachment against clinton . </s><s> the full house will vote on the impeachment articles next week . </s><s> israeli government spokesman moshe fogel was asked sunday if the success of clinton 's visit would turn on the question of revoking the palestinian liberation organization 's founding charter . </s><s> `` president clinton played a very important role in the wye memorandum and its success , and i think that it 's going to be very , very important that this visit show us at least a readiness on the part of the palestinian authority to move forward in peace , '' fogel said . </s><s> there was no letup in violence sunday . </s><s> palestinian stone throwers clashed with israeli troops and an israeli high school student was stabbed and wounded by a palestinian teen-ager . </s><s> in his remarks at clinton 's airport arrival saturday night , netanyahu said the peace process is in danger . </s><s> `` mr. president , '' netanyahu said , speaking in hebrew , `` the truth has to be told . </s><s> in recent weeks the palestinians again constantly , systematically and intentionally violated all their commitments . </s><s> we are not entitled , not able and not prepared to forgo fulfillment of those commitments . '' </s><s> netanyahu , who is facing political turmoil in his hard-line coalition government , said he could not accept `` a phony peace on paper '' which is `` not honored in practice . '' </s><s> since clinton presided over its signing in washington in october , the land-for-security agreement has hit one snag after another . </s><s> israel froze implementation of the accord altogether , accusing arafat of violating the deal and inciting violent street protests . </s><s> clinton said the united states shares israel 's concerns about security . </s><s> `` peace is not simply an option among many but the only choice that can avert still more years of bloodshed , apprehension and sorrow , '' he said . </s><s> `` that is why i 'm here . '' </s><s> he said `` both sides now must face the challenge of implementing wye . '' </s><s> both clinton and netanyahu have a shaky political future . </s><s> the israeli leader is fighting for his political survival as parliament prepares for a no-confidence vote within two weeks . </s><s> his coalition began to weaken after he and arafat signed the wye river memorandum oct. 23 agreeing to turn over 13 percent of west bank territory to be met by palestinian security measures . </s><s> netanyahu has said there would be no further troop withdrawals until west bank rioting and violence ends . </s><s> israel and the palestinians are also in bitter disagreement over procedures for revoking passages in the palestinian charter calling for israel 's destruction and the release of palestinian prisoners held in israeli jails for militant or political acts against the jewish state . </s><s> on monday , the president is to fly to the palestinian-run gaza strip to be welcomed by arafat with the trappings of a state visit . </s><s> clinton 's visit to gaza and his address to the palestinian national council is seen by some as a boost for dreams of palestinian statehood . </s><s> `` it implies de facto recognition of a palestinian state , '' ziyad abu ziyad , a member of the palestinian legislative council , said in an interview sunday .	clinton arrives in israel , to go to gaza , attempts to salvage wye accord .	president clinton met sunday with prime minister netanyahu in israel	clinton meets netanyahu , says peace only choice .  office of both shaky	mid-east wye accord off-track as clintons visit ; actions stalled , violence .

attend gaza meeting negotiate wye agreement term	clinton address palestinian gaza  part wye agreement	clinton gaza  west bank  israel dec 12  bolster wye peace accord	president clinton will travel to gaza next month to address palestinian leaders , the white house said friday . </s><s> he is to speak at what the palestinians are describing as a historic meeting to formally revoke anti-israel clauses in the 1964 palestinian charter . </s><s> israel demanded revocation of the clauses at u.s.-brokered negotiations last month that led to the latest land-for-peace deal between israel and the palestinians . </s><s> as part of that settlement , reached at wye , md. , clinton agreed to travel to territory controlled by the palestinian authority to speak at the meeting of the palestinian national council , the de facto parliament . </s><s> according to a schedule released friday by the white house , clinton will visit gaza , the west bank and israel during a four-day trip that will begin on dec. 12 . </s><s> he is to meet with prime minister benjamin netanyahu of israel and yasser arafat , the palestinian leader , before returning to washington on dec. 15 . </s><s> clinton administration officials said the white house had not yet decided whether clinton would fly to the newly opened gaza international airport aboard air force one , given the symbolism of the president 's jet landing on palestinian soil with the trappings of a state visit . </s><s> officials said the white house was fearful of upsetting israeli leaders who are worried that the president 's planned visit to gaza appears to be a step toward american recognition of a palestinian state . </s><s> the white house said the president would `` speak to the israeli and palestinian people about the importance of the wye agreement and the need to continue to support the middle east peace process . '' </s><s> the meeting in gaza on dec. 14 is bound to be contentious , given that many prominent palestinians have charged that the wye agreement allows the israeli government to backtrack on promises made to the palestinians in their 1994 peace settlement . </s><s> the palestinians have insisted that they have already revoked clauses in the 1964 charter that called for israel 's destruction . </s><s> in january , arafat wrote to the white house , listing the anti-israel provisions that he said had been annulled . </s><s> but the letter did not satisfy the israelis . </s><s> and during the talks in maryland last month , arafat agreed to call a meeting of the national council to `` reaffirm '' the decision to revoke the clauses . </s><s> in order to guarantee passage of a motion to annul the provisions , arafat is being allowed under an agreement with the israelis and the united states to pack the council meeting in gaza with his loyalists , and to conduct the vote by a show of hands instead of a ballot . </s><s> during a recent interview with israeli television , clinton brushed aside concerns that his visit to gaza might be seen as a step toward u.s. recognition of a palestinian state . </s><s> `` that is not what i 'm doing in going there , '' he said . </s><s> `` i have tried strictly to adhere to the position of the united states that we would not take a position on any final status issue . '' </s><s> he said he was traveling to gaza at the recommendation of , among others , netanyahu . </s><s> `` the prime minister wanted me to go there and wanted us all to make this pitch , '' he said , adding that he would ask the palestinian national council `` to support the peace and to renounce the idea of animosity toward and opposition to the existence of the state of israel , and instead embrace the path not only of peace but of cooperation . ''	clinton will visit gaza , the west bank , israel on 4-day trip in december .	president clinton will attend gaza meeting to negotiate wye agreement terms	clinton to address palestinians in gaza , part of wye agreement	clinton to gaza , west bank , israel on dec 12 ; to bolster wye peace accord .

govt seek  budget reject job stimulation lack	italy s president scalfaro consult political leader new government	three days after the collapse of premier romano prodi 's center-left government , italy 's president began calling in political leaders monday to try to reach a consensus on a new government . </s><s> following the talks , which are expected to last several days , president oscar luigi scalfaro could ask prodi to try again with a new majority . </s><s> he could also name a new premier , or appoint a government of technocrats . </s><s> if scalfaro feels no candidate is capable of mustering a majority , he could call early elections . </s><s> because the president can not dissolve parliament during the last six weeks of his term , elections would have to be scheduled by december . </s><s> scalfaro has named prodi as caretaker premier for the interim . </s><s> prodi 's far-left ally , communist refoundation , provoked the crisis when it withdrew support for the government over the 1999 deficit-cutting budget , which it said did not do enough to stimulate job creation . </s><s> despite help from a breakaway faction of the communists , who on sunday formed a new party , prodi lost friday 's vote of confidence by a single vote . </s><s> prodi has said he wo n't take the job back unless his new government could stick to the policies of its old one , an unlikely scenario given the divided parliament . </s><s> an alternative to prodi could be massimo d'alema , leader of the democrats of the left , the largest party in prodi 's coalition . </s><s> in the case of a so-called `` technical '' government , the names of treasury minister carlo azeglio ciampi and foreign minister lamberto dini have been circulated . </s><s> a government of technicians would get italy through the volatile period of approving the 1999 budget and the launch of the common european currency , the euro , in january 1999 . </s><s> prodi presided over cost cuts that got italy into the debut of the european monetary union , outlasting all but one other post-world war ii italian government in the process .	scalfaro talks with political leaders ; try for consensus on in italy , the birds are going south , and so it seems could the italian government , as the bonds of compromise and political opportunism that bind a small leftist party to the government came undone sunday . </s><s> the latest threat to the government of prime minister romano prodi came after delegates to a two-day conference of the communist refounding party voted to reject the government 's proposed 1999 budget , imperiling the future of the center-left coalition . </s><s> officials in the prime minister 's office said sunday night that prodi would meet on monday with president oskar luigi scalfaro to discuss the political turbulence , though not to offer his resignation . </s><s> if the communist refounding 's parliamentary deputies abide by the resolution , which passed by a vote of 188-112 , it will destabilize italy 's government at a time when the outcome of the recent election in germany has already injected a note of uncertainty into the future of european economic and fiscal policy . </s><s> mauro zani , a spokesman for the democratic party of the left , the main party in prodi 's coalition , called the decision by communist refounding a `` misfortune for the entire country . '' </s><s> passage of the budget , he said , is essential `` to avoid disaster . '' </s><s> prodi 's coalition is a loose alliance of the former communists , known as the democratic party of the left , and prodi 's moderate catholic-oriented followers . </s><s> it is supported by communist refounding , a fringe group of hard-line leftists who broke with the mainstream communists after they overhauled the party following the collapse of communism in eastern europe . </s><s> despite frequent shocks , the alliance has held since 1996 , glued together mainly by the desire to meet the fiscal requirements to allow italy to adopt the single european currency . </s><s> as the jan. 1 date approaches for the introduction of the new money , the euro , italy must cut its key lending rates to bring them in line with those of bigger european neighbors , like germany . </s><s> a rate cut by the italian central bank is generally thought to hinge on passage of the budget bill . </s><s> if the bill is not passed , negative signals would be sent to global financial markets that are already upset because of the financial crises in asia , russia and latin america . </s><s> on sunday , prodi 's backers were still hoping that a sufficient number of communist refounding deputies would break ranks and back the budget when it comes up for a vote in parliament later this week . </s><s> if that fails , a centrist group that rescued prodi in june under similar circumstances and that is led by former president francesco cossiga announced it would support the budget , thus at least assuring parliamentary passage . </s><s> communist refounding and its mercurial leader , fausto bertinotti , have pushed prodi to the brink twice before . </s><s> the party forced him to offer his resignation last year over proposed budget cuts , but then backpeddled after the party 's rank and file protested . </s><s> in june , the hard-line leftists again refused to follow the prime minister , that time in a parliament vote for nato expansion , but the government muddled through with the help of cossiga 's party . </s><s> but one of the leaders of that centrist group , clemente mastella , said sunday that it would not support the government generally , leaving the future of prodi 's coalition highly uncertain .	communist refounding party rejects 1999 budget ; prodi 's coalition at risk .	italy 's government will destabilize if leftist party rejects 1999 budget	italy 's communists reject budget .  government , euro participation threatened	communist refounding party votes to reject prime minister prodi 's budget

rejection	cossuta  refounding chairman  resign protest budget decision	italian politics have long been enlivened by baroque feuds and shifting alliances . </s><s> and that time-honored tradition may have won the embattled government of prime minister romano prodi a momentary reprieve . </s><s> a leader of italy 's hard-line marxist faction , known as the communist refounding party , resigned monday in protest over his party 's decision to reject the government 's 1999 budget and imperil prodi 's slender majority in parliament . </s><s> `` prodi must realize that his majority no longer exists , '' said armando cossuta , chairman of the communist refounding party , a fringe group that broke with mainstream communists after they overhauled the party following the collapse of the soviet union in 1991 . </s><s> `` nevertheless we should do everything possible , until the last minute , to save this government and avoid this crisis . '' </s><s> cossuta was clearly unwilling to join the most hard-line wing of his party in withdrawing support from prodi and risk being branded as having torpedoed the first leftist italian government in 50 years . </s><s> but the leader of the communist refounding party in parliament , fausto bertinotti , seems to have no such compunctions . </s><s> on friday , he told journalists that he was not worried about forcing new elections that could return the right to power . </s><s> `` sometimes you have to take one step back in order to take two steps forward , '' he said with a shrug . </s><s> until now , however , the communist rank and file have disagreed with that view . </s><s> when bertinotti forced prodi to offer his resignation last year over proposed budget cuts , the rank and file protested , and he was forced to backpedal . </s><s> prodi met monday with president oscar luigi scalfaro and coalition leaders to devise a strategy . </s><s> he is expected to go to parliament on wednesday to open debate on the crisis and seek enough votes for the budget . </s><s> without it , the italian central bank is unlikely to cut its key lending rates , something italy must do to get in line with germany and other bigger european neighbors before the introduction jan. 1 of the single european currency , the euro . </s><s> but even if he gathers enough votes to pass the budget , prodi could still be left without a majority . </s><s> after two and a half years in office , his government is the second-longest in the postwar era . </s><s> but the fragile center-left coalition has held together mostly because italians were united for the last two years in an effort to reduce spending , inflation and government borrowing to meet the requirements for membership in the euro plan . </s><s> once that goal was achieved last spring , dissension quickly revived . </s><s> prodi 's backers are hoping that enough members of the communist refounding party will break ranks and follow cossutta to save the coalition . </s><s> if not , prodi is faced with two unappetizing choices . </s><s> he can resign and seek new elections , which carry the risk of bringing the opposition to power . </s><s> or he could seek to form a new majority without the communists by seeking an alliance with the small center-right party of francesco cossiga . </s><s> cossiga 's party came to prodi 's rescue in june , when the hard-line leftists refused to back prodi on nato expansion . </s><s> but prodi has repeatedly said he will govern only with the center-left majority that elected him in 1996 . </s><s> cossiga also suggested to reporters monday that he would not welcome any invitations to join a coalition led by prodi . </s><s> `` we would n't want this majority to get stained like monica lewinsky 's dress , '' he said .	prodi goes to scalfaro for help ; budget needed for jan. 1 switch to euro .	italy 's communist refounding party leader resigns to avoid political crisis	italian pm prodi resigns in protest of budget rejection	cossuta , refounding chairman , resigns in protest over budget decision

attack</s><s>washington nato resolution order strike	prodi lose confidence vote  stay caretaker new government	italian premier lose confidence vote fall power	confidence vote lose 1  instability cloud nato cooperation kosovo	romano prodi lose confidence vote parliament  313312	by only one vote , the center-left prime minister of italy , romano prodi , lost a confidence vote in parliament friday and was toppled from power . </s><s> the collapse of his government after two and a half years , the second-longest tenure since world war ii , suggested that the chronic political instability that marked italy for decades had sprung back to life . </s><s> though obliged to tender his resignation , prodi will remain in charge as a caretaker prime minister until a new government is formed . </s><s> he may get a second chance to form a new majority , but even if he does , negotiations to that end could take days and even weeks , clouding decisions on such urgent issues as the crisis in kosovo . </s><s> nato military planners preparing for possible air strikes against yugoslavia had expected to use key air bases in italy . </s><s> in his weakened position , prodi will have difficulty persuading parliament to approve nato strikes . </s><s> he will have similar problems passing the 1999 budget , which is necessary before italy can cut its lending rates , a requirement for joining the single european monetary unit , the euro , on jan. 1 . </s><s> immediately after friday 's vote of 313-312 , in a tense and at times raucous session , prodi met with president oscar luigi scalfaro to submit his resignation and discuss his options . </s><s> in the coming days scalfaro will consult with dozens of other leaders to ascertain whether prodi has enough lingering support to try to form a new government . </s><s> if not , the president is expected to turn to another political leader . </s><s> if no compromise is found , italy could be plunged into early elections . </s><s> but parties of all political stripes may be reluctant to push things that far , for opinion polls suggest that voters are no more enamored of the center-right opposition parties than they are of the governing majority . </s><s> prodi , an economist , is admired by his western allies as a down-to-earth leader who vowed to tame italy 's bloated economy and reckless government borrowing and actually lived up to his pledge . </s><s> by raising taxes , lowering interest rates and reducing the deficit , italy met the requirements for membership in the euro last spring , a feat that only a year before was considered impossible by german and french economists . </s><s> prodi was helped by a healthy global economy and a rare consensus among industrialists , labor unions and taxpayers , who feared that exclusion from the euro would condemn italy to third world status . </s><s> but his fiscal discipline was not followed by reform of a political system that is inherently fragile . </s><s> there are more than 40 parties in italy , and the government 's efforts to amend the constitution to introduce a two-party system failed . </s><s> `` unless the italian political system changes , italy is condemned to political instability , '' said sergio romano , a former diplomat and political science professor . </s><s> `` the country needs stability and credibility , and that will never happen as long as the government is hanging from a thread . '' </s><s> in 1996 prodi won with a patchwork quilt of center-left factions mostly made up of catholic moderates and leftists . </s><s> he relied on a fringe marxist group , the communist refounding party , for a majority in the lower house . </s><s> and that alliance , fragile from the beginning , finally frayed to the breaking point this week . </s><s> the hard-line leader of communist refounding , fausto bertinotti , said his party would vote against the 1999 budget and would also end its 28-month-old pact with the center-left coalition . </s><s> that position drove the moderate wing of communist refounding , worried that a vote against prodi would open the doors to a center-right government , to split away . </s><s> but the 20-odd deputies who defied bertinotti were not enough to squeeze prodi through . </s><s> `` i am not bitter , '' prodi said moments after his defeat . </s><s> `` even today i received a lot of support . '' </s><s> in the end the coup de grace was delivered by one of his own , a member of the coalition . </s><s> `` they have won by the treachery of one single person , '' sergio mattarella , a deputy in prodi 's coalition , angrily told reporters , referring to silvio liotta , a member of the italian renewal party . </s><s> foreign minister lamberto dini , who heads that party , said liotta would be expelled . </s><s> prodi has often said he would not govern with any other majority than the center-left one that elected him in 1996 . </s><s> but throughout his tenure , he was forced to seek temporary alliances to push through major policy decisions . </s><s> he struggled to the last to try to keep his original majority intact . </s><s> on thursday , in an effort to woo more moderate communists to his side , the prime minister , a staunch ally of the united states , warned that he would oppose a nato strike aimed at stopping serbian violence in kosovo unless the u.n. security council approved the attack . </s><s> washington maintains that nato does not need a new u.n. resolution to order a strike .	prodi loses confidence vote ; will stay as caretaker until new government .	italian premier loses confidence vote and falls from power	confidence vote lost by 1 .  instability clouds nato cooperation on kosovo .	romano prodi loses confidence vote in parliament , 313-312

, a news agency said . </s><s> in another mine explosion , a tractor driver was killed thursday in the republic , the interfax news agency reported , citing chechnya 's security officials . </s><s> village	head kidnap  uk engineer  find chechen road  investigating	four foreigner kidnap grozny  head found outside city	chechen authorities found the decapitated heads of four kidnapped foreigners tuesday along a highway near a remote village after a two-month search in the breakaway region in southern russia . </s><s> an associated press reporter saw the severed heads near the village of assinovskaya , about 40 kilometers ( 25 miles ) west of grozny , the chechen capital . </s><s> he did not see any sign of the bodies . </s><s> the heads were lined up on a piece of cloth along a main highway across southern russia , ntv television reported . </s><s> the heads were identified as those of the four abducted foreigners by umar makhauri , who had been a bodyguard assigned to the four when they were abducted oct. 3 by unidentified gunmen in grozny . </s><s> he said the bodies had not been found . </s><s> but chechen government officials at the scene said four bodies had been found without giving further details . </s><s> chechen president aslan maskhadov said in grozny that the bodies of four men had been recovered . </s><s> the hostages _ britons peter kennedy , darren hickey , and rudolf petschi , and new zealand 's stanley shaw _ were engineers . </s><s> they were working for granger telecom , a british telephone company , installing 300,000 telephone lines across chechnya . </s><s> maskhadov said chechen officials had caught one of the captors monday and he told police where the hostages were being held . </s><s> but that information reached the other captors , who decided to kill their captives , the itar-tass news agency quoted maskhadov as saying . </s><s> the chief executive of granger telecom , ray verth , said tuesday that chechen authorities had mounted a rescue attempt monday night that went `` tragically wrong . '' </s><s> no other details were available . </s><s> he said the company had `` opened a dialogue with the kidnappers and received confirmation that the hostages were alive as recently as last week . '' </s><s> `` their murder is an appalling and barbaric act and our thoughts go out to the families to whom we offer our deepest condolences . </s><s> we are a small tightly-knit company and everyone here is in a state of shock , '' verth said outside company headquarters in weybridge , south of london , where flags were flying at half-mast . </s><s> spokesmen at the british and new zealand embassies in moscow said they were checking on reports the four men had been killed , but could not comment . </s><s> the british foreign ministry in london said it was investigating urgently reports that bodies had been found . </s><s> chechen acting first vice premier turpal atgeriyev , who is heading the investigation into the killings , said authorities had several suspects in the abduction , but have failed to make any progress , according to the itar-tass news agency . </s><s> eamon hickey , the father of one of the missing men , said he heard the news and was hoping it would not be confirmed . </s><s> `` there is so much rumor and counter-rumor coming from out there that we do n't know what to think . </s><s> obviously we are hoping and praying that it does not turn out to be true , '' he said at his home in england . </s><s> chechen authorities had been searching for the missing men for the past two months . </s><s> british officials said they had not received any ransom demand for the missing men . </s><s> maskhadov said the deaths of the four men were a major blow to chechnya and its efforts to gain international recognition of its independence . </s><s> he blamed the rash of abductions in chechnya to unidentified `` outside forces '' and their chechen henchmen . </s><s> `` i am ready to answer before my people and the whole world for what happened , '' he was quoted as saying by the interfax news agency . </s><s> hostage-takings , usually for ransom , have become common in chechnya since the end of the breakaway republic 's two-year war for independence from russia in 1996 . </s><s> but victims are rarely killed . </s><s> since the beginning of 1998 , 176 people have been kidnapped in the north caucasus region of russia , including dozens of investigation	starovoitova outspoken  enemy  murder political  mourn 100s	dead russian lawmaker  many enemy   yeltsin lead investigation	starovoitova  yeltsin  chubais  putin  political murder  st petersburg	hundreds of people gathered saturday to mourn the shooting death of one of russia 's most prominent women , a potential presidential candidate whose killing was widely considered to be politically motivated . </s><s> president boris yeltsin said he would personally assume control over the investigation into the killing of galina starovoitova , who was gunned down friday night as she climbed the stairs to her apartment . </s><s> an aide was also shot and critically wounded . </s><s> the shooting occurred in a building along st. petersburg 's atmospheric griboedova canal , site of another notorious russian crime _ the murder that was the central event in fyodor dostoevsky 's 19th century masterpiece , `` crime and punishment . '' </s><s> like that fictional crime , which shone a light on social ferment in the st. petersburg of its day , the death of starovoitova was immediately seized upon as a seminal event in the russia of the late 1990s . </s><s> `` it is one of the black pages in our modern history , '' vladimir putin , director of the federal security service ( fsb ) told the interfax news agency . </s><s> `` it does n't do much to improve our reputation , the reputation of the country as a whole . '' </s><s> starovoitova , 52 , was an outspoken deputy in the lower house of parliament who inspired strong feelings from both her friends and enemies . </s><s> a leader of the liberal russia 's democratic choice party , she was planning to run for president in 2000 . </s><s> those close to her speculated about who might have wanted her dead , with some naming various prominent politicians as potential culprits . </s><s> `` whose path did she cross ? </s><s> the answer is simple : communists and gangsters , '' said former deputy prime minister anatoly chubais . </s><s> `` these are the two kinds of people in whose way she was standing . '' </s><s> putin , whose agency is in charge of the investigation , cautioned that there was still no evidence that her death was a political assassination . </s><s> interior minister sergei stepashin did not speculate about the motive for the crime , but told reporters that it was being investigated under a criminal code section that covers terrorism . </s><s> arriving at the st. petersburg airport from moscow , he said : `` i brought with me a team of experienced investigators . </s><s> i think we will clear it up soon . '' </s><s> yeltsin sent a telegram to gennady seleznyov , chairman of parliament 's lower house , the state duma , promising that the `` contractors and executors of the murder will be found and severely punished , '' the president also sent a telegram to starovoitova 's family , in which he called her `` one of the most vivid figures in russian politics , '' who `` consistently upheld the lofty ideals of freedom and democracy . '' </s><s> more than 200 people gathered in st. petersburg 's palace square to remember starovoitova . </s><s> people hugged quietly as they listened to speeches by her fellow politicians and friends . </s><s> the small stage was adorned with red roses , yellow carnations and photographs of the deputy with various people , including the late russian physicist and dissident , andrei sakharov . </s><s> `` we are united today by pain , which is bigger than politics , '' said viktor krivulin , a poet and candidate for the regional legislature . </s><s> `` politics , as i felt during the past night , has become the art of spitting on the soul . '' </s><s> others at the gathering said they were sure that starovoitova was killed by those who disliked her outspoken views . </s><s> `` she had too many enemies , '' said galina markelova , an aide to the lawmaker . </s><s> she said starovoitova had received many threats in the past . </s><s> `` it was doubtless a political murder , '' added vitaly milonov , the chairman of the young christian democrats . </s><s> police said two men followed starovoitova and her aide , ruslan linkov , 27 , and shot them on the stairs of her building friday evening . </s><s> linkov was shot twice . </s><s> he regained consciousness after a five-hour operation at the military medical academy , but remained in critical condition in intensive care . </s><s> a pistol with a silencer and and automatic rifle were found at the scene , itar-tass said . </s><s> a funeral is scheduled for tuesday in the settlement of gorelovo , near st. petersburg .	100 's mourn democratic choice party leader ; yeltsin to run investigation .	starovoitova outspoken , had enemies .  murder was political .  mourned by 100s .	dead russian lawmaker had `` too many enemies '' ; yeltsin leading investigation	starovoitova , yeltsin , chubais , putin , political murder , st. petersburg

common contract hit  fingerpointing	galina starovoitova s murder may watershed event russian politics	in modern russia , the crime was so common as to be mundane . </s><s> two thugs , armed with machine pistols and silencers , stalked and killed a powerful figure , then slipped away into the night . </s><s> police vowed to catch them and politicians expressed outrage . </s><s> usually , that would be the end of the story . </s><s> this time , though , the figure shot was one of the most prominent and popular women in russian politics , a prospective presidential candidate with friends in the highest reaches of the kremlin . </s><s> as outrage mounted sunday , it seemed clear that the killing of galina starovoitova was not going to be treated as a routine crime , and some said it might turn out to be a watershed event in russian politics . </s><s> `` this is impossible to tolerate any longer , '' said grigory yavlinsky , the leader of yabloko , another reform-oriented party . </s><s> `` we must stop feeling powerless before the increasingly cheeky scum . </s><s> we can not go on living as though everything is running as usual . '' </s><s> starovoitova , a member of parliament and a leader of the liberal russia 's democratic choice party , was walking up the stairs of her apartment building in st. petersburg with a young aide friday evening . </s><s> a team of assailants _ police believe it was a man and a woman _ appeared behind them and opened fire . </s><s> starovoitova , shot three times in the head , collapsed and died instantly , authorities said . </s><s> the aide , 27-year-old ruslan linkov , was critically wounded , but managed to telephone a news agency reporter before losing consciousness . </s><s> police have recovered two guns , and are hoping that linkov can provide a description of the killers . </s><s> he had regained consciousness but still could not speak sunday . </s><s> although it was still not clear who killed starovoitova or why , the killing had all the earmarkings of a contract hit _ a remarkably common crime in post-soviet russia . </s><s> most of the killings involve business deals and the corruption that has swamped the government and the economy . </s><s> until now , the most notorious of the killings was that of popular television host vladislav litsyev , who was shot outside his moscow home in 1995 . </s><s> but there have been hundreds of others . </s><s> st. petersburg has been especially plagued . </s><s> last year , the city 's deputy governor was gunned down on a central st. petersburg street . </s><s> in the past two months alone , hitmen have claimed the lives of a legislative aide , a high-ranking city official and a prominent banker . </s><s> so deeply has the toxin infected russian society that president boris yeltsin ordered an investigation last week into reports that his federal security service _ the domestic successor to the kgb _ had ordered the death of boris berezovsky , the nation 's most prominent businessman and the head of the commonwealth of independent states . </s><s> there is no indication that anyone attempted to carry out an assassination of berezovsky . </s><s> but yeltsin 's order was the equivalent of u.s. president bill clinton ordering an investigation into whether the fbi was plotting to kill microsoft chairman bill gates . </s><s> yet , as remarkable as that news was , it has been vastly overshadowed by the death of starovoitova . </s><s> television news since her death has carried reports of little else . </s><s> reaction has poured in from virtually every important figure in the country , and from surrounding nations . </s><s> yeltsin , calling her `` my comrade , '' declared that he would personally oversee the investigation into her death . </s><s> there was , in much of the reaction to starovoitova 's death , the sense that a line had been crossed . </s><s> perhaps it was because she was a woman , perhaps because she elicited impassioned support , or perhaps because people are simply fed up . </s><s> but , in more characteristic fashion , her death also led to a round of political finger-pointing . </s><s> colleagues of starovoitova declared _ without any apparent evidence _ that her communist foes in the duma , the lower house of parliament , were the most likely culprits in her death . </s><s> historian dmitry likachyov , one of the nation 's most revered and trusted figures , said her killing seemed to signal the `` outburst of a new red terror . '' </s><s> by late saturday , the name-calling had gone so far that interior minister sergei stepashin called a news conference to say there was no evidence that the communist speaker of the duma , gennady seleznyov , was involved in the killing . </s><s> seleznyov went on television to say he was saddened by her death . </s><s> `` but , '' he added , `` i would not like the deputies who sat on the same bench with galina starovoitova in the state duma ... to turn this into a political show . '' </s><s> it is too early to know where the recriminations and political maneuvering will lead . </s><s> for now , the only thing certain is the starovoitova has become the latest in a long line of russian martyrs .	starovoitova 's killing may be watershed event ; police have some evidence .	outrage at killing .  100s of others .  yeltsin overseeing investigation .	russians outraged at death of leader ; common contract hit ?  finger-pointing .	galina starovoitova 's murder may be a watershed event in russian politics

death	starovoitova honor martyr  bury alongside russian hero	starovoitova bury among national hero  lead killing	russian lawmaker bury beside great  mourn martyr  killer unknown	ordinary citizen top russian politico attend starovoitova s funeral	a slain russian lawmaker was honored tuesday as a martyr to democratic ideals in a stately funeral service in which anger mingled freely with tears . </s><s> afterward , galina starovoitova was to be buried alongside some of russia 's greatest national heroes . </s><s> the stirring tribute to starovoitova , a feisty liberal whose killing remains a mystery , was indicative of the depth of national feeling over her death . </s><s> `` to stop us , they want to scare us . </s><s> they will never succeed , '' former deputy prime minister anatoly chubais said at the funeral for starovoitova . </s><s> `` we will fulfill the goals she sacrificed her life for . '' </s><s> hundreds of people , including many of the country 's most prominent political figures , packed the grand marble hall of st. petersburg 's ethnography museum for the funeral . </s><s> an open casket , cloaked with black ribbons and flanked by a military honor guard , stood at the head of the hall . </s><s> at the end of the service , mourners passed grimly past it as classical music played . </s><s> outside , several thousand more mourners stood in the cold , waiting for the service to end so they could file in and pay their respects . </s><s> `` ordinary people should honor her memory , and make sure this never happens again , '' said one man , vadim olshevsky , the manager of a construction company . </s><s> but , he added bitterly , `` there 's little hope of that in our country . '' </s><s> among speakers at the service were former prime minister viktor chernomyrdin and yuri yarov , president boris yeltsin 's first deputy chief of staff , who represented the president at the service . </s><s> former prime minister sergei kiriyenko was also present . </s><s> yeltsin , who has said he will personally oversee the investigation into starovoitova 's killing , was in a moscow hospital , recovering from pneumonia . </s><s> `` the shooting in st. petersburg is a grim lesson for the whole of russia , '' yarov said . </s><s> `` irrespective of real motives for that murder , a crime of this magnitude is a political act , and society should know all the truth about it . '' </s><s> one national television channel turned over its daylong programming to funeral coverage and a memorial tribute . </s><s> newspapers carried page after page of coverage of her death . </s><s> her political party , russia 's democratic choice , called on all russians to turn out their lights in her memory for three minutes at 8 p.m. tuesday . </s><s> starovoitova was initially going to be buried in a simple cemetery in the st. petersburg suburb where her family lives . </s><s> but as outrage mounted over her killing , the government announced that she would be interred in the alexander nevsky monastery in the city 's center following the funeral at the ethnography museum . </s><s> among those buried at the alexander nevsky monastery are the composers peter tchaikovsky and modest mussorgsky and the author fyodor dostoevsky . </s><s> starovoitova was shot to death friday evening as she and an aide scaled the stairs to her apartment in st. petersburg . </s><s> the aide , 27-year-old ruslan linkov , was seriously wounded , but has been able to provide some description of the shooting to police . </s><s> acting on his information , investigators rounded up several suspects , officials said monday . </s><s> but a detective later said that investigators had learned nothing `` serious '' from linkov , according to the interfax news agency , and there were no further details about whether the suspects were still in custody . </s><s> igor kozhevnikov , head of investigations for the interior ministry , told interfax on tuesday that he was confident the case would be solved . </s><s> `` it will take time , '' he said , but added that investigators `` have tips , they have something to work on . '' </s><s> authorities are acting on the assumption that starovoitova 's death was a contract hit , a common event in post-soviet russia . </s><s> russian politicians and newspapers have speculated wildly about political motives for the killing , but police have said they have no idea why someone would have wanted her dead . </s><s> police said someone fired shots at the apartment of a member of the st. petersburg legislature monday night , interfax said . </s><s> no one was hurt . </s><s> it was not clear whether the shooting was related to starovoitova 's death .	starovoitova honored as martyr ; to be buried alongside russian heroes .	starovoitova buried among national heroes .  no leads on killing .	russian lawmaker buried beside greats ; mourned as martyr ; killers unknown .	ordinary citizens and top russian politicos attend starovoitova 's funeral

linkov  woman politics	mourners bearing flowers and candles gathered sunday outside the house on griboyedova canal where a russian legislator , galina staravoitova , was shot to death on friday night . </s><s> a key witness , ruslan linkov , 27 , mrs. staravoitova 's press aide , was reported to be regaining consciousness in a heavily guarded hospital ward where he was taken with gunshot wounds to the head and neck . </s><s> the police say the two were attacked in the stairwell of mrs. staravoitova 's building by two assailants , one of them a young woman . </s><s> the attackers reportedly fled through a back entrance to a waiting car . </s><s> two guns were found at the scene . </s><s> friends and relatives say mrs. staravoitova , a founder of russia 's democratic movement , had received death threats , but the motive for the killing remains unclear . </s><s> `` the choice of the target suggests a well-thought out plan , '' said sergei kozyrev , vice president of the russian association of scientific societies and a staravoitova supporter . </s><s> `` to kill a woman _ a woman in politics _ that has not happened in russia since stalin 's time . '' </s><s> setting aside past feuds , local democratic groups said sunday that they would unite in coming elections to the st. petersburg city council , combining their forces against what they say are criminals who have invaded local politics . </s><s> at a gathering sunday night in moscow , yegor gaidar , a former russian prime minister and a close ally of mrs. staravoitova , bitterly rejected suggestions that russia should adopt extraordinary security measures to stem the rise in political crime .	2 attackers kill starovoitova ; 1st woman in politics killed since stalin .	staravoitova founder of russia 's democratic movement .  press aide also shot .	two killed russian lawmaker ; fled , leaving guns ; motive unclear ; aide alive	russian legislator , shot , key witness ruslan linkov , woman in politics

counsel suggest atrocity perpetrator south africa	south african expert urge counsel apartheid killer torturer	south africa  counseling need side long apartheid struggle	torturers and bombers who carried out atrocities defending or fighting apartheid need counseling to ensure they do not repeat their crimes , an expert for south africa 's reconciliation body said thursday . </s><s> addressing local and international experts , charles villa-vicencio , research head of the truth and reconciliation commission , said ignoring the psychological needs of those who carried out human rights abuses could alienate a potentially dangerous sector of society . </s><s> `` we must give attention to the healing of perpetrators , not just for the sake of perpetrators , but for the sake of the nation as a whole , '' he said . </s><s> the conference , organized by the medical research council , is examining mental health issues raised by the truth commission , which is charged with probing crimes committed by all sides in the anti-apartheid struggle . </s><s> as the commission prepares to hand over its final report at the end of the month , south africans are examining its painful and traumatic exploration of their bloody past . </s><s> with the power to grant amnesty to many who tortured , bombed or maimed innocent civilians , the process has at some stage angered people in nearly all walks of life . </s><s> many whites see the panel as favoring the black liberation movements , while many blacks accuse it of being too soft on former state officials , especially top ranking ministers . </s><s> however , villa-vicencio appealed for tolerance in dealing with all those who have committed crimes , saying that the potential for wrongdoing existed in everyone . </s><s> `` we all , the entire human race , carry with us the capacity for evil , '' he said . </s><s> many of thursday 's speakers touched on the figure of police death squad leader eugene de kock , who was given jail terms totaling more than 200 years after a killing spree that costs dozens of lives . </s><s> de kock has applied for amnesty for his crimes . </s><s> dan stein , a specialist in neurobiology and stress disorders , said de kock typified many killers from all sides in the conflict by his sheer `` banality of evil '' . </s><s> `` many people have found him in interviews to be an ordinary , even likeable person , '' he said about the man whom subordinates dubbed `` prime evil . '' </s><s> ginn fourie , a physiotherapist whose student daughter was gunned down by black activists in a 1993 attack on a cape town bar , said it was necessary to help those whose circumstances compelled them to do wrong . </s><s> struggling to control her tears , fourie told delegates she had attended the amnesty hearings of her daughter 's killers and supported their successful bid to be freed from long jail sentences . </s><s> after describing how she hugged the three members of the black nationalist pan-africanist congress and urged them to seek counseling together with their victims , fourie earned a standing ovation from the 50-strong audience . </s><s> `` we must take the initiative in understanding others and start the process of reconciliation and healing our broken land , '' she said , her voice shaking with emotion .	apartheid expert says torturers and bombers will need counseling	amnesty , counseling suggested for atrocity perpetrators in south africa	south african expert urges counseling for apartheid killers and torturers	south africa : counseling needed for both sides in long apartheid struggle .

atrocity white ruler	a panel probing apartheid-era abuses has accused the african national congress of human rights violations , including torture and bomb attacks , the state broadcaster said monday . </s><s> the anc , which led the struggle against white rule and now is in power , previously has acknowledged it was told to expect implication in right violations . </s><s> the truth and reconciliation commission will release its final report on 2 1-2 years of investigation on thursday . </s><s> the report was expected to place overwhelming blame for the era 's abuses on white governments and their brutal security services . </s><s> president nelson mandela 's office received an advance copy on monday ahead of the handover ceremony , when retired archbishop desmond tutu , who chaired the comission , will present mandela with the report . </s><s> south african broadcasting corp. radio said it had been leaked a `` preliminary document '' which condemns the anc as politically and morally responsible for gross human rights violations during and after the fall of apartheid . </s><s> an anc spokesman , thabo masebe , said he believed the news report referred to a commission letter sent in advance `` informing us of its intention to implicate the anc in gross human rights violations . '' </s><s> commission officials could not immediately be reached for comment . </s><s> justice minister dullah omar told journalists in pretoria he had heard the news report , but would not comment . </s><s> former president f.w . </s><s> de klerk , meanwhile , plans to ask a court to prevent the truth commission report from implicating him in covering up state-sponsored terror . </s><s> `` obviously we will comply with the ruling of a court , '' omar said , but added he would `` regret '' any court-ordered delay . </s><s> the anc was nervous enough about the report to request a meeting with commissioners earlier this month . </s><s> the panel refused , to avoid appearing embarrassed . </s><s> the party says the accusations against it likely would center on the planting of land mines on border farms , abuses at its military camps in angola and bombings . </s><s> omar said he expected the report 's conclusions to set off debate but added it would `` lay the basis for reconciliation . show anc share blame apartheid human right violation	south african commission  apartheidera atrocity white power	the institution exploring apartheid 's horrors will issue a report that finds the african national congress shares blame for human rights violations as it struggled to overcome white rule . </s><s> the 3,500-page report by the truth and reconciliation commission culminates more than two years of nationwide hearings . </s><s> south african media released preliminary findings on monday , three days before its official release on thursday in pretoria , the capital . </s><s> the release of the document is a milestone in south africa 's transformation from white minority rule to democracy . </s><s> the commission , which has the power to grant amnesty , was tasked with promoting reconciliation by laying bare the what and why of apartheid-era atrocities . </s><s> with the anc now in power and facing an election in mid-1999 , a condemnation by the commission could prove damaging both to its electoral chances and moral standing . </s><s> there has been no doubt that the report 's overwhelming blame would be laid on white governments and their security forces during the years under scrutiny , 1960-1994 . </s><s> indeed , news reports monday said the truth commission would declare apartheid a crime against humanity and acknowledge that the anc and the more radical pan africanist congress were conducting a legitimate struggle against the former apartheid state . </s><s> but in preliminary findings sent to the parties last month , the commission also said the two movements were `` morally and politically accountable '' for gross rights violations , south african press association and south african broadcasting corp. said . </s><s> the preliminary finding said that despite anc policy against killing civilians , the line between military and civilian targets had been blurred , sapa said . </s><s> it condemned the planting of landmines in rural areas , the execution of enemy agents , torture and mistreatment of anc members in its exile camps and for killing political opponents . </s><s> it said the party must accept responsibility for the activities of anc women 's league president winnie madikizela-mandela , nelson mandela 's former wife , and her mandela united football club , accused of killings , torture and kidnappings . </s><s> the commission also said the pac was guilty of the deaths of civilians in its strategy in 1993 to drive white farmers off their land so it could be reclaimed by blacks . </s><s> justice minister dullah omar , meeting journalists in pretoria , would not comment on the news reports about condemnation of the anc . </s><s> `` i do expect various responses ( to the report ) . </s><s> i do not expect everyone to agree . </s><s> it will lead to healthy debate , '' he said . </s><s> he said that if the commissioners recommends prosecutions against anyone for abuses , it will be up to the national director of prosecutions to decide whether to proceed . </s><s> the director is appointed by the government . </s><s> the commission 's work is designed `` to help us establish the rule of law in south africa , and to establish the principle of accountability , '' omar said . </s><s> the anc already has prepared the ground for a negative finding , saying weeks ago that the commission had warned that harsh judgments were in the offing . </s><s> the anc was nervous enough about the report to request a meeting with commissioners earlier this month . </s><s> the panel refused , to avoid appearing biased . </s><s> on monday , it rejected `` with contempt '' suggestions anc officials themselves had leaked the findings . </s><s> constand viljoen , leader of the tiny right-wing freedom front , said the anc had done so to give the commission credibility by making it more even-handed . </s><s> publicly , the party has long defended its actions as those committed during a `` just war . '' </s><s> f.w . </s><s> de klerk , the last apartheid-era president , meanwhile , planned to ask a court to prevent the truth commission report from implicating him in covering up state-sponsored terror . </s><s> `` obviously we will comply with the ruling of a court , '' omar said , but added he would `` regret '' any court-ordered delay .	anc guilty of human of human rights violations in struggle to end apartheid	anc shares blame for human rights violations in anti-apartheid struggle	reports show anc shares blame for apartheid human rights violations	south african commission : apartheid-era atrocities not by just white powers

right abuse	avoid delay report  south african commission excise de klerk s name	a panel investigating apartheid-era atrocities said wednesday it will not implicate the last apartheid president , f.w . </s><s> de klerk , in human rights abuses after he threatened a court challenge . </s><s> de klerk said he would sue to block the long-awaited final report of the truth and reconciliation commission , which was due for release thursday . </s><s> the man who helped negotiate the end of apartheid objected to a finding by the commission that he was `` an accessory after the fact '' to bombings in the 1980s of the headquarters of a church group and of a labor federation . </s><s> former archbishop desmond tutu , the truth panel 's chairman , said the commission needed time to prepare to fight the legal challenge , and would `` excise '' de klerk 's name from the report to avoid delaying its release . </s><s> `` it upsets me deeply , '' tutu said . </s><s> `` we have been scrupulously fair to mr. de klerk and we reject the contention that we have been engaged in a vendetta against him . </s><s> `` but we must and will respect the courts and his rights under the constitution . </s><s> we fought hard for those rights and we can be proud in south africa that mr. de klerk now shares in them , '' he said in a statement . </s><s> `` all we are doing is postponing dealing with the matter , '' tutu later told the associated press . </s><s> `` the name will eventually appear after all the hoo-ha has died down . '' </s><s> de klerk , reached in london , said he could not comment before speaking with his lawyers because the matter was in the courts . </s><s> the commission was charged with promoting reconciliation by laying bare apartheid 's horrors . </s><s> it has held hearings around the country for more than two years , listening to victims and perpetrators seeking amnesty . </s><s> the release of the 3,500-page report represents a milestone for south africa 's transformation from white minority rule to democracy . </s><s> de klerk 's challenge was only part of the storm of criticism prompted by leaks of the report . </s><s> the african national congress , the liberation movement that helped defeat apartheid and now runs the country , on tuesday angrily rejected a finding that it too was guilty of human rights violations in its armed struggle . </s><s> the report will be a broad and detailed summary of south africa 's human rights history , from 1960 to 1994 , when all-race elections ended white minority rule . </s><s> it will parcel out moral condemnations and recommend individual prosecutions . </s><s> other threatened legal challenges have led to fewer individuals being named as rights violators than planned , the star of johannesburg reported wednesday . </s><s> in commenting on the newspaper report , tutu said that more than 400 people had been notified they would be implicated to give them a chance to respond . </s><s> only 15 successfully argued themselves out of the report , he said .	de klerk threatens to sue , will not be accused of human rights violations	desmond tutu to omit de klerk=b9s name from commission report to avoid suit	investigators will not implicate president de klerk in human rights abuses	to avoid delaying report , south african commission excises de klerk 's name .

divisiveness surround apartheid report	president nelson mandela acknowledged saturday the african national congress violated human rights during apartheid , setting him at odds with his deputy president over a report that has divided much of south africa . </s><s> the disagreement stems from thursday 's release of the report by the truth and reconciliation commission on horrors committed during apartheid . </s><s> rather than act as a salve and an aid to reconciliation , the report has caused divisiveness , even among former comrades-in-arms who fought apartheid . </s><s> as expected , the report called apartheid a `` crime against humanity . '' </s><s> but it also blamed the anc for gross human rights violations during its anti-apartheid struggle , saying the group tortured suspected spies and dissidents and killed innocent civilians with land mines and bombs . </s><s> some suspected traitors were killed in the anc 's camps abroad . </s><s> mbeki _ who became anc president last year and will likely be elected south africa 's next president in 1999 when mandela retires _ took a hard line saturday against the report , and indicated all anc members must do the same . </s><s> `` no member , 5th graf , 1st ld-writethru	mandela acknowledges human rights violations by african national congress	president nelson mandela concedes anc rights violations in apartheid era	mandela acknowledges anc violated human rights during apartheid	mandela agrees anc violated rights ; divisiveness surrounds apartheid report

accused right violator could drag six year	criminal case bring south african accuse violation	prosecute unrepented  apartheid criminal may take 6 year	criminal prosecutions for atrocities committed during the war against white rule could drag on for at least six years , a top prosecutor said monday . </s><s> key figures implicated in human rights abuses by the truth and reconciliation commission already are under investigation , the official , jan d'oliveira , told reporters . </s><s> they include two unnamed generals in the apartheid state 's security apparatus , president nelson mandela 's ex-wife winnie madikizela-mandela and officials of the african national congress , he said . </s><s> the remarks by d'oliveira , who recently was appointed a deputy national director of prosecutions , were the clearest signal yet that criminal cases would be brought against figures accused by the commission of gross human rights violations . </s><s> the commission released its report oct. 30 . </s><s> it chronicles the human rights abuses committed by apartheid governments and their operatives as well as by the african national congress and others fighting the racist system . </s><s> the issue of continuing prosecutions is significant . </s><s> many feel that dragging on criminal reckonings of the horrors of the apartheid era will only prolong bitterness and delay reconciliation . </s><s> but supporters of prosecution feel that denying justice to the victims is a worse evil . </s><s> on a practical level , highly public prosecutions of anc figures could have an impact on national elections next year , when the party will seek to consolidate its hold on power . </s><s> the panel 's chairman , archbishop desmond tutu , has called for a two-year time limit on prosecutions ; d'oliveira called the period `` wholly impractical . '' </s><s> the prosecutor did not name the other targets . </s><s> `` we have always worked on the principle of that we will prosecute the highest rank , '' he said . </s><s> the commission has the ability to grant amnesty to those who admit their misdeeds and are found to have acted with political motives . </s><s> the report said individuals who have not sought amnesty should be prosecuted . </s><s> madikizela-mandela has not sought amnesty . </s><s> the commission found her accountable for human rights violations committed by her bodyguards , who the report said killed and tortured suspected opponents . </s><s> madikizela-mandela was convicted in 1991 of kidnapping and being an accessory to an assault on four young men . </s><s> she was sentenced to six years in jail , but paid a dlrs 3,200 fine on appeal . </s><s> the anc official was among the most prominent anti-apartheid activists . </s><s> the two generals were implicated during truth commission testimony . </s><s> prosecutors are ready to move forward pending the amnesty application of one .	those accused of human rights violations could be brought to trial	prosecutions of accused rights violators could drag on for six years	criminal cases will be brought against south africans accused of violations	prosecuting unrepented , apartheid criminals may take 6 years ; should they ?
