implicate de klerk illegal act	de klerk remove release report apartheidera atrocity nears	facing a court challenge , the truth and reconciliation commission said wednesday that it would withhold , at least temporarily , the parts of its final report that implicate south africa 's last apartheid-era president , f.w . </s><s> de klerk , in illegal acts . </s><s> de klerk , 62 , who helped negotiate the end of south africa 's white supremacist government and shared the 1993 nobel peace prize with president nelson mandela for that work , had objected to a finding by the commission that he was `` an accessory after the fact '' in the bombings of the headquarters of a church group and of a labor federation in the 1980s . </s><s> the chairman of the 17-member panel , archbishop desmond tutu , said that although he took such action with `` great reluctance , '' the commission needed time to prepare to fight the legal challenge . </s><s> he said it would take de klerk 's name out of 3,500-page report to avoid delaying its release thursday . </s><s> `` it upsets me deeply , '' he said in a statement . </s><s> `` we have been scrupulously fair to de klerk , and we reject the contention that we have been engaged in a vendetta against him . '' </s><s> de klerk 's challenge was only part of the storm of criticism prompted by leaks about the report in the last few days . </s><s> within hours of the commission decision to withdraw its findings on de klerk , it was facing the possibility of a new suit _ this time from the ruling african national congress . </s><s> the anc also wants to block the commission findings about its conduct during the liberation struggle . </s><s> a spokesman for the party , thabo masebe , said the party would seek an injunction in the morning before the report is officially handed over to mandela . </s><s> while the commission 's report is expected to lay overwhelming blame on the former white government for atrocities , it has also found the anc responsible for human-rights violations , including the torture and killing of spying suspects , bombings in civilian areas and the killing of political enemies , including members of the rival zulu-based inkhata freedom party . </s><s> the decision on de klerk seems certain to damage the commission 's credibility . </s><s> the panel , created as a way of putting south africa 's brutal past to rest without the expense and political divisiveness of trials , has caused controversy from the start . </s><s> it has held more than 160 hearings throughout the country , listening to both victims and to perpetrators seeking amnesty . </s><s> but many whites say the commission is on a witch hunt aiming to humiliate former government officials and afrikaners in general . </s><s> de klerk has once before forced the commission officials to court and won an apology from them for calling him a liar . </s><s> some political analysts said wednesday 's events would only further the belief that the panel lacks impartiality . </s><s> `` the withdrawal of the findings ca n't help but be seen as a lack of certainty on their side , '' said sampie terreblanche , an economist and political analyst at the university of stellenbosch , who has supported the commission . </s><s> `` whether we like it or not , the whole report gets a knock from this . '' </s><s> de klerk 's spokesman , david steward , said the former president `` was very confident '' that he would win when the case goes to trial in march . </s><s> `` he is very happy to be in the courts now rather than dealing with the truth commission , '' steward said . </s><s> `` the fact that they agreed to withdraw creates the definite impression that they specifically concocted a case to involve mr. de klerk in a negative finding . '' </s><s> the anc has accused the commission of trying to `` criminalize '' the liberation struggle . </s><s> `` whatever the efforts to besmirch our struggle by denouncing it as a gross violation of human rights , '' the congress said in a statement . </s><s> `` the anc and the millions of people who were part of this struggle will always be proud of what they did to insure that , in the process of the destruction of a vile system , they did not themselves resort to vile methods of struggle on the basis that the means justified the end . '' </s><s> there are probably few subjects that get south africans more excited than the issue of the truth commission and whether it is a worthy cause or a waste of money . </s><s> the events of the last few days have only added to the debate . </s><s> for some , like pal martins , 34 , a former member of the anc 's armed wing , the fact all sides of the political spectrum are in an uproar is a good thing . </s><s> `` the mere fact that everyone is complaining means that the truth commission has done its work , '' he said . </s><s> but others say that too many questions are being raised about the panel 's competence . </s><s> `` the whole affair is beyond the pale , a mockery of justice , '' said roboy vonholdt , a 56-year-old sheep and ostrich farmer who believes that the commission has been a theatrical act . </s><s> `` we should all turn our backs on the past and move forward . </s><s> we need them and they need us . </s><s> let 's all make money and let good economic conditions prevail . '' </s><s> the commission 's report is supposed to be a broad and detailed summary of south africa 's human rights history , from 1960 to 1994 , when elections open to all races ended white minority rule . </s><s> it will parcel out moral condemnations and recommend individual prosecutions . </s><s> while de klerk was alone in court wednesday challenging the commission , tutu said wednesday that other threatened legal challenges had led to fewer individuals being named as rights violators than originally planned . </s><s> tutu said that more than 400 people had been notified that they would be implicated to give them a chance to respond . </s><s> some 15 successfully argued themselves out of the report or could not be reached and were therefore deleted from the report , he said . </s><s> the commission is required by law to give advance notification to anyone it intends to implicate in its report . </s><s> the commission had been expected to say that although de klerk did not order the bombings , he subsequently came to know that former law and order minister adriaan vlok and police commissioner johan van der merwe had been involved , but failed to report his knowledge to the police . </s><s> this could open him up to a criminal prosecution . </s><s> de klerk has not applied for amnesty in this matter or any other . </s><s> de klerk has said that when he learned about the bombings , vlok and van der merwe were already in the process of applying for amnesty , and he did not think it was necessary to report the matter .	commission to withhold report implicating de klerk in rights violations	commission will withhold de klerk=b9s name to avoid delay in report release	commission to withhold parts of report implicating de klerk in illegal acts	de klerk removed as release of report on apartheid-era atrocities nears .

winnie mandela also cite	south african panel find state commit human right violation	horror apartheid  white government prime responsibility  black share	following are excerpts from the final report issued by south africa 's truth and reconciliation commission on thursday : primary finding on the basis of the evidence available to it , the primary finding of the commission is that : the predominant portion of gross violations of human rights was committed by the former state through its security and law-enforcement agencies . </s><s> moreover , the south african state in the period from the late 1970 's to early 1990 's became involved in activities of a criminal nature when , amongst other things , it knowingly planned , undertook , condoned and covered up the commission of unlawful acts , including the extrajudicial killing of political opponents and others , inside and outside south africa . </s><s> in pursuit of these unlawful activities , the state acted in collusion with certain other political groupings , most notably the inkatha freedom party ( i.f.p . ) . </s><s> certain members of the state security council ( the state president , minister of defense , minister of law and order , and heads of security forces ) did foresee that the use of words such as `` take out , '' `` wipe out , '' `` eradicate , '' and `` eliminate '' would result in the killing of political opponents . </s><s> they are therefore responsible for deliberate planning which caused gross violations of human rights . </s><s> p.w . </s><s> botha during the period that he presided as head of state ( 1978-1989 ) according to submissions made to and findings made by the commission , gross violations of human rights and other unlawful acts were perpetrated on a wide scale by members of the south african defense force , including : the deliberate unlawful killing and attempted killing of persons opposed to the policies of the government , within and outside south africa . </s><s> the widespread use of torture and other forms of severe ill treatment against such persons . </s><s> the forcible abduction of such persons where were resident in neighboring countries . </s><s> covert logistical and financial assistance to organizations opposed to the ideology of the a.n.c . </s><s> and other liberation movements . </s><s> inkatha the commission finds that in 1986 , the south african defense forces ( s.a.d.f . ) </s><s> conspired with inkatha to provide the latter with a covert , offensive paramilitary unit ( or `` hit squad '' ) to be deployed illegally against persons and organizations perceived to be opposed to both the south african government and inkatha . </s><s> the s.a.d.f . </s><s> provided training , financial and logistical management and behind the scenes supervision of the trainees , who were trained by the special forces unit of the s.a.d.f . </s><s> in the caprivi strip . </s><s> the commission finds furthermore that the deployment of the paramilitary unit in kwazulu led to gross violations of human rights , including killing , attempted killing and severe ill treatment . </s><s> the commission finds the following people , among others , accountable for such violations : mr. p. w. botha , gen. magnus malan , chief mangosuthu buthelezi . </s><s> the a.n.c . </s><s> while it was a.n.c . </s><s> policy that the loss of civilian life should be `` avoided , '' there were instances where members of its security forces perpetrated gross violations of human rights in that the distinction between military and civilian targets was blurred in certain armed actions , such as the 1983 church street bombing of the south african air force headquarters . </s><s> in the course of the armed struggle , the a.n.c. , through its security forces , undertook military operations which , though intended for military or security force targets , sometimes went awry for a variety of reasons , including poor intelligence and reconnaissance . </s><s> the consequences in these cases , such as the magoo 's bar and durban esplanade bombings , were gross violations of human rights in respect of the injuries to and loss of lives of civilians . </s><s> individuals who defected to the state and became informers and/or members who became state witnesses in political trials . </s><s> were often labeled by the a.n.c . </s><s> as collaborators and regarded as legitimate targets to be killed . </s><s> the commission does not condone the legitimization of such individuals as military targets and finds that the extrajudicial killings of such individuals constituted gross violations of human rights . </s><s> the commission finds that , in the 1980 's in particular , a number of gross violations were perpetrated not by direct members of the a.n.c . </s><s> or those operating under its formal command , but by civilians who saw themselves as a.n.c . </s><s> supporters . </s><s> in this regard , the commission finds that the a.n.c . </s><s> is morally and politically accountable for creating a climate in which such supporters believed their actions to be legitimate and carried out within the broad parameters of a `` people 's war '' as enunciated by the a.n.c . </s><s> a.n.c . </s><s> camps the commission finds that suspected `` agents '' were routinely subjected to torture and other forms of severe ill treatment and that there were cases of such individuals being charged and convicted by tribunals without proper regard to due process , sentenced to death and executed . </s><s> winnie madikizela-mandela the commission finds that ms. madikizela-mandela was central to the establishment and formation of the mandela united football club , which later developed into a private vigilante unit . </s><s> it is the commission 's view that ms. madikizela-mandela was aware of the criminal activity and the disquiet it caused in the community , but chose deliberately not to address the problems emanating from the football club . </s><s> the commission finds that those who opposed ms. madikizela-mandela and the mandela united football club , or dissented from them , were branded as informers and killed . </s><s> the commission finds that ms. madikizela-mandela . </s><s> is accountable , politically and morally for the gross violations of human rights committed by the mandela united football club . </s><s> the commission finds further that mrs. madikizela-mandela herself was responsible for committing such gross violations of human rights . </s><s> business business was central to the economy that sustained the south african state during the apartheid years . </s><s> certain businesses , especially the mining industry , were involved in helping design and implement apartheid policies . </s><s> the white agriculture industry benefited from its privileged access to land .	most human-rights violations carried out by former south african state	most rights violations by state ; anc , ifp , winnie mandela also cited	south african panel finds the state committed most human rights violations	horrors of apartheid : white government prime responsibility ; blacks share .

report	commission offer amnesty confession  otherwise prosecution	south african may favor amnesty forego politically divisive trial	south african report  justice amnesty  forgive  go forward	the deal that south africa 's truth and reconciliation commission offered was simple enough : confess your crimes , apply for amnesty and you will go free . </s><s> if you do n't come forward , you will be prosecuted . </s><s> after more than two years of hearings into apartheid-era atrocities , the commission last week unveiled a 3,500-page report naming dozens of people it believes were up to their elbows in the gore but never applied for amnesty . </s><s> so the prosecutions should begin soon , right ? </s><s> not so fast . </s><s> the study was barely in the hands of president nelson mandela before talk of new amnesty deals had begun . </s><s> it seems that nearly all of south africa 's political parties _ including the ruling african national congress _ have key officials who could end up in the dock because of the report . </s><s> suddenly , there is lots of talk about how the country ca n't withstand a round of politically divisive trials , and many political analysts here are betting that an agreement `` of mutual benefit '' is in the offing . </s><s> already , three major political parties are calling for some kind of new amnesty , and the anc is n't closing the door . </s><s> anc spokesman thabo masebe said it was `` premature '' to talk of a general amnesty , but he acknowledged that the party was discussing an amnesty specifically tailored to violence by black south africans against other blacks that littered the kwazulu/natal province with bodies during the late '80s and into the '90s . </s><s> in choosing a truth commission rather than a nuremberg-style trial with which to close out its brutal past , south africa hoped for an idealistic reconciliation . </s><s> people would come clean and receive true forgiveness . </s><s> society would then be able to move on , its wounds cleansed and healed . </s><s> it was a model watched closely around the world by other societies wondering how to disentangle themselves from the grudges of a brutal past . </s><s> but given the chance , hundreds of south africa 's perpetrators did not come forward . </s><s> commission officials themselves say they were frustrated by the lack of cooperation , however exhaustive their report may seem . </s><s> it is perhaps too late , however , to press for more . </s><s> today 's south africa has urgent new problems to deal with _ unemployment , crime , white flight , too few schools and hospitals . </s><s> so it may wind up settling for a more pragmatic reconciliation _ one that gives amnesty to the unrepentant simply because it 's more practical for all concerned to move on . </s><s> in recent years , truth commissions have gained popularity in many places , notably chile , argentina and el salvador . </s><s> but south africa 's _ the biggest and most powerful , able to grant amnesty and to subpoena witnesses _ was supposed to be the real test . </s><s> certainly the commission forced the nation to see the gruesome details of its past , as sobbing survivors and stone-faced torturers told of smashed genitals and near suffocations . </s><s> and the commission 's work added much to the knowledge about what happened in south africa between 1960 and 1994 . </s><s> but it will be years before the effect of the commission can truly be judged . </s><s> has anyone really forgiven anyone else ? </s><s> will vendettas persist ? </s><s> no one can answer . </s><s> one thing seems clear , however : four years after south africa held its first non-racial elections , a growing number of south africans want to be done with the past . </s><s> raymond louw , the publisher of a respected weekly newsletter , southern africa report , says a new amnesty proposal could come up during the february session of parliament , in time to remove the issue from next year 's election campaigns . </s><s> `` you simply ca n't have this country torn apart by prosecutions , '' he says . </s><s> `` everybody is going to be howling for an amnesty . </s><s> they already are . '' </s><s> even as archbishop desmond tutu , the commission 's chairman , delivered the report , he seemed to be anticipating a push for a new amnesty and arguing against it . </s><s> he said such a move would be highly unfair to those who came forward . </s><s> he suggested instead that there be a two-year time limit , after which anyone not indicted would in effect get amnesty . </s><s> to be sure , there will be opposition to any proposals to limit prosecutions . </s><s> more than a dozen human rights and victims advocacy groups have already banded together to condemn such proposals as `` unconscionable . '' </s><s> the idea for a truth commission emerged as a compromise from the long negotiations that brought about south africa 's peaceful transition from a white supremacist state to a non-racial democracy . </s><s> during the talks , the white national party government pushed for a blanket amnesty , and the anc refused . </s><s> in the end , only about 250 former police officers came forward , most of them foot soldiers . </s><s> and only two high national party officials , former law and order minister adriaan vlok and police commissioner johan van der merwe , confessed _ to roles in ordering bombings . </s><s> in its report , the commission called the apartheid state the `` primary perpetrator '' of gross human rights violations and held such high ranking former officials as former president p.w . </s><s> botha , his former army chief , georg meiring , and the former intelligence chief , niel barnard , responsible . </s><s> these men , and others of lower rank , have not applied for amnesty for the anc , the most embarrassing prospect is the possible prosecution of mandela 's former wife , winnie madikizela-mandela , who is accused in the report of taking part in a number of assaults and abductions . </s><s> lesser-known officials could face charges too . </s><s> the anc is held responsible for at least 76 deaths in kwazulu/natal . </s><s> the anc 's problems are further complicated by its efforts to make peace with the largely zulu-based inkatha freedom party . </s><s> virtually no one from that party came forward to ask for amnesty . </s><s> yet the report found that inkatha , working with the white government , was responsible for widespread slaughter in kwazulu/natal and in the townships around johannesburg . </s><s> inkatha 's leader , chief mangosuthu buthelezi , and many key party officials stand accused of fomenting a wide range of abuses . </s><s> but prosecuting chief buthelezi could lead to new warfare in kwazulu . </s><s> part of the reluctance to go forward with prosecutions may be the result of still another factor : the judicial system is already overwhelmed with rising crime and the evidence from the apartheid era is old . </s><s> so why spend the time and the money ? </s><s> at the moment , only one political party is opposed to any form of new amnesty _ the tiny but influential democratic party , a liberal group that was not involved in the violence . </s><s> its head , tony leon , says a new amnesty would only prove that `` the more thuglike your behavior , the more you get away with . '' </s><s> but he concedes that his is a lonely voice . </s><s> `` at this point , '' he says , `` there is little enthusiasm for anything but closing the book on the past . ''	new calls for amnesty in wake of reconciliation commission report	commission offers amnesty for confession , otherwise prosecution	south africans may favor amnesty to forego politically divisive trials	south african report out ; justice or more amnesties , forgive , go forward ?

homosexual  hate crime  scarecrow  mckinney  henderson	at first , the passing bicyclist thought the crumpled form lashed to a ranch fence was a scarecrow . </s><s> but when he stopped , he found the burned , battered and nearly lifeless body of matthew shepard , an openly gay college student who had been tied to the fence 18 hours earlier . </s><s> on friday , the 22-year-old university of wyoming student was in a coma in critical condition . </s><s> at albany county courthouse here , russell henderson , 21 , and aaron mckinney , 22 , were arraigned on charges of kidnapping , aggravated robbery and attempted first-degree murder . </s><s> two women described as friends of the men , kristen leann price , 18 , and chastity vera pasley , 20 , have been charged as accessories after the fact to attempted first-degree murder . </s><s> shepard 's friends said that he did not know his alleged tormentors . </s><s> laramie police say the primary motive was robbery , although court papers filed friday indicate shepard 's homosexuality may also have been a factor . </s><s> shepard 's friends call the attack a hate crime . </s><s> `` he was very open about his sexuality , '' tina labrie , an anthropology student here , said of her friend . </s><s> `` i admired him for that because it is very courageous to be yourself even when others disagree . '' </s><s> a few hours before he was beaten , shepard , a slight 5-foot , 2-inch man who wore braces on his teeth , had attended a meeting of the lesbian , gay , bisexual , transgendered association , said walter boulden , a friend of shepard 's . </s><s> `` he was sitting at the bar , having a beer , when two men came up and talked to him , '' boulden , a 46-year-old university lecturer of social work here , said today between tears . </s><s> `` he indicated he was gay , and they said they were gay , too . '' </s><s> `` now , he is in a coma , '' continued boulden , who visited his friend at a hospital in fort collins , colo. , on thursday . </s><s> `` i do n't think anybody expects him to pull through . '' </s><s> shepard , who spoke arabic and german , studied at a boarding school in switzerland before moving back to the united states to attend the university of wyoming , the alma mater of his father , an oil rig safety inspector in saudi arabia . </s><s> matthew shepard was born in casper , the capital of wyoming 's oil belt , and spent much of his youth there . </s><s> but six weeks after returning to wyoming and enrolling as a freshman here , shepard fell into a depression , said ms. labrie and her husband , phillip . </s><s> accustomed to life in europe and denver , this foreign language student who wanted to become a diplomat found himself living in this isolated city of 27,000 people . </s><s> set in a treeless landscape defined by barbed wire fences , grazing cattle and a busy freight railroad line , laramie is a town where pickup trucks outnumber sport utility vehicles , where fall entertainment revolves around this saturday 's homecoming football game and the start of the hunting season in the nearby medicine bow mountains . </s><s> although wyoming often bills itself as the `` equality state , '' in reference to its being the first state to give women the vote , the state legislature has repeatedly voted down hate crime legislation on the grounds that it would give homosexuals special rights . </s><s> `` wyoming is not really gay friendly , '' marv johnson , executive director of the wyoming chapter of the american civil liberties union , said from cheyenne . </s><s> `` the best way to characterize that is by a comment a legislator made a few years back , when he likened homosexuals to gay bulls as worthless and should be sent to the packing plant . '' </s><s> shepard joined the campus gay association at the university within days . </s><s> one of his favorite haunts was the fireside bar , which drew a mixed crowd of college students and rodeo cowboys , gays and straights . </s><s> `` he definitely was n't drunk when he came in , '' recalled the bartender , matt galloway . </s><s> `` he was n't drunk when he went out . '' </s><s> calvin rerucha , the county attorney , charged in court documents today that mckinney and henderson posed as homosexuals and lured shepard out to mckinney 's pickup truck . </s><s> beating him inside the truck , the pair drove him one mile southeast to an isolated part of a new rural subdivision , the county attorney 's report charged . </s><s> there , it said , the men tied their captive to a post-and-rail fence and pistol-whipped him with a .357 magnum `` while he begged for his life . '' </s><s> relatives said that shepard also suffered burns on his body . </s><s> after nearly beating the young man to death , laramie police commander david o'malley said , the assailants stole his wallet and shoes and left him tied to the fence . </s><s> the police commander said that when his officers arrested the two men on thursday , they found in mckinney 's pickup truck a .357 magnum pistol covered with blood and shepard 's shoes and credit card . </s><s> he said they found shepard 's wallet at mckinney 's home . </s><s> the police commander said that the two women helped the two men dump their bloody clothing , and that they reported hearing the men make anti-gay remarks . </s><s> ms. pasley , a freshman art student at the university , lived with henderson . </s><s> ms. price lived with mckinney . </s><s> the police did not say what the other three did for a living . </s><s> on friday , friends and laramie residents struggled to understand the incident . </s><s> shepard , some said , may have felt a false sense of confidence because the local gay association completed plans on tuesday night for `` gay awareness week 1998 . '' </s><s> the weeklong series of events starts here sunday with a local observance of `` national coming out day '' and a lecture on monday by leslea newman , the author of `` heather has two mommies , '' a book about lesbian families . </s><s> `` if i were a homosexual in laramie , i would hang low , very low , '' said carla brown , manager of the fireside . </s><s> `` openly gay behavior is not only discouraged , it 's dangerous . ''	two arrested , charged with attempted murder of openly gay student	dying gay college student found lashed to fence ; four arrests made	two accused of attempted murder of homosexual wyoming university student	matthew shepard , homosexual , hate crime , scarecrow , mckinney , henderson

parade support beaten gay student	outpouring support gay college student critical condition	hundred laramie  wy demonstrate support brutallybeaten gay student	clinton  shepherd  equality state  hostility toward gay men lesbian	as a gay college student lay hospitalized in critical condition after a severe beating here , this small city , which bills itself as `` wyoming 's hometown , '' wrestled with its attitudes towards gay men . </s><s> on saturday , at the university of wyoming 's annual homecoming parade , `` pistol pete '' and his uniformed brass band were overshadowed by a larger group of marchers _ 450 people , many wearing yellow armbands and carrying signs in support of the 21-year-old student , matthew shepard , who suffered severe head injuries in the attack last week . </s><s> `` hate is not a small town value _ no to violence and evil , '' read one sign , as watchers applauded . </s><s> with passersby spontaneously joining the protest group , two women held another sign that read , `` no hate crimes in wyoming . '' </s><s> two candlelight vigils were held sunday night at churches near the campus . </s><s> at the poudre valley hospital in fort collins , colo. , where shepard 's health continued to deteriorate , the hospital has received so many flowers that nurses have started to distribute bouquets to other patients . </s><s> a vigil at the hospital on saturday evening drew about 500 people . </s><s> `` we live in the equality state , '' shannon rexroat wrote friday in a special edition of the branding iron , the campus newspaper . </s><s> referring to wyoming 's pioneer heritage as the first state to grant women the right to vote , ms. rexroat , the campus newspaper 's editor added : `` that means nothing to me anymore . </s><s> we live in a state where a young man was brutally beaten because he is gay . '' </s><s> but others recalled another side of `` wyoming 's hometown , ''which has a population of more than 26,000 . </s><s> jamie lewis , another editor , said that on friday he was handing out copies of the special edition when a passerby backed away from him and used an anti-gay epithet . </s><s> last week 's brutal assault bubbled out of an ongoing climate of hostility toward gay men and lesbians , leaders of the local unitarian church said in a letter published sunday in the city 's newspaper , the laramie daily boomerang . </s><s> `` this incident was atypical in its brutality , but not in its underlying motive , '' wrote jeffrey lockwood and stephen johnson . </s><s> gay people in laramie , they wrote , `` are frequently assaulted with derision , intolerance , insult and hostility _ if not guns and ropes . '' </s><s> ric turley , who dropped out of college here after one year in the 1970s , recalled driving here to see his family for christmas in 1993 and seeing a vandalized billboard on the main highway . </s><s> under a brace of pistols , an advertising appeal for a state history museum had been changed , he said , from `` shoot a day or two , '' to `` shoot a gay or two . '' </s><s> turley , who is gay and said he only came out after he had left wyoming , said that he immediately complained to the museum . </s><s> but returning a month later , he found the message had not been erased . </s><s> after complaining to the museum for a second time , he said he took a can of black spray paint and blotted out the word `` gay . '' </s><s> `` it was this kind of complacency and apathy that allowed this to happen , '' he said of the beating in which two local men have been charged , russell henderson and aaron mckinney . </s><s> according to the local police and prosecutors , the two men lured shepard out of a bar by saying they were gay . </s><s> then , the laramie police say , the pair kidnapped shepard , pistol-whipped him with a .357 magnum and left him tied to a ranch fence for 18 hours until a passing bicyclist spotted shepard , who was unconscious . </s><s> on sunday , the laramie police said that mckinney had been arrested on thursday at the same hospital in fort collins where shepard was being treated . </s><s> mckinney was being treated for a `` minor '' skull fracture unrelated to the fracas with shepard , said ben fritzen , a laramie police detective . </s><s> president clinton has condemned the attack , saying on saturday , `` i was deeply grieved by the act of violence perpetrated against matthew shepard . '' </s><s> clinton urged congress to pass the federal hate crimes prevention act , saying , `` there is nothing more important to the future of this country than our standing together against intolerance , prejudice and violent bigotry . '' </s><s> wyoming is one of 10 states that does not have a hate crime law . </s><s> the latest attempt died in the state legislature in cheyenne in february . </s><s> on saturday , wyoming 's governor , jim geringer , said he was `` outraged and sickened '' by the attack . </s><s> here in laramie , mckinney 's father , bill , also condemned the attack . </s><s> his pickup truck was apparently used in the kidnapping . </s><s> but he also complained about the massive attention by the national media . </s><s> the national press `` blew it totally out of proportion because it involved a homosexual , '' mckinney told the denver post . </s><s> `had this been a heterosexual these two boys decided to take out and rob , this never would have made the national news . '' </s><s> shepard grew up in casper until his sophomore year in high school , when his father , an oil rig safety engineer , was transferred to saudi arabia . </s><s> the young man completed high school at a boarding school in lugano , switzerland , where he learned italian and german . </s><s> on saturday , his parents , dennis and judy shepard , released a statement from fort collins thanking `` the american public for their kind thoughts about matthew . '' </s><s> `` he is a trusting person who takes everybody at face value and he does not see the bad side of anyone , '' the shepards wrote . </s><s> `` he has always strongly felt that all people are the same , regardless of their sexual preference , race or religion . '' </s><s> noting that their son was born prematurely and that his `` life has often been a struggle , '' they added , `` he is physically short in stature , but we believe he is a giant when it comes to respecting the worth of others . ''	hundreds march in homecoming parade in support of beaten gay student	outpouring of support for gay college student in critical condition	hundreds in laramie , wy demonstrate support of brutally-beaten gay student	clinton , shepherd , equality state , hostility toward gay men and lesbians

crime protection act  wyoming  gringer  matthew shepard  homosexual	matthew shepard , the gay college student who was kidnapped and severely beaten , died here monday , five days after he was found unconscious on a wyoming ranch where he had been left tied to a fence for 18 hours in near-freezing temperatures . </s><s> his death , announced at poudre valley hospital here , fanned the outrage that followed word of last week 's attack , spawning nationwide vigils , producing a call for federal hate-crimes legislation from president clinton and fueling debates over such laws in a host of western states , including wyoming , that have resisted them . </s><s> from denver to the university of maryland , people turned out to honor the the slight , soft-spoken 21-year-old shepard , a freshman at the university of wyoming , who became an overnight symbol of anti-gay violence after he was found dangling from the fence by a passerby . </s><s> two men and two women have been charged in the case . </s><s> the men were charged with attempted murder and are expected to face first-degree murder charges that could bring the death penalty . </s><s> `` there is incredible symbolism about being tied to a fence , '' said rebecca isaacs , political director of the national gay and lesbian task force in washington . </s><s> `` people have likened it to a scarecrow . </s><s> but it sounded more like a crucifixion . '' </s><s> gay leaders hope _ and christian conservatives fear _ that shepard 's death will galvanize congress and state legislatures to pass hate-crime legislation or broaden existing laws . </s><s> conservatives generally oppose such laws because they favor one group 's rights over another . </s><s> in the last two decades , 21 states and the district of columbia have passed laws that increase penalties for crimes that are committed because of a person 's race , religion , color , national origin , and sexual orientation . </s><s> another 19 states , including colorado , do not include sexual orientation in their hate-crime laws . </s><s> ten states , including wyoming , have no hate-crime laws at all . </s><s> in washington , clinton responded to news of shepard 's death by urging congress to pass the federal hate crimes protection act , which would make federal offenses of crimes based on sex , disability and sexual orientation . </s><s> wyoming has been one of the nation 's holdouts , rejecting three hate crimes bills since 1994 , most recently in february . </s><s> but monday , after shepard 's death , gov . </s><s> jim geringer appealed to lawmakers to reconsider their opposition . </s><s> `` i ask for a collective suggestion for anti-bias , anti-hate legislation that can be presented to the wyoming legislature for their consideration in january , '' geringer said . </s><s> the governor met monday morning with dennis shepard , the slain student 's father , and said that the elder shepard did not want his son 's death to become `` a media circus '' and that `` we should not use matt to further an agenda . '' </s><s> geringer said that shepard 's father also said : `` do n't rush into just passing all kinds of new hate-crimes laws . </s><s> be very careful of any changes and be sure you 're not taking away rights of others in the process to race to this . '' </s><s> leaders of gay rights groups interviewed monday said they would respect the family 's privacy by not attending the burial in casper , wyo. , on saturday . </s><s> but they added that they hoped the death would have an impact on legislators around the nation . </s><s> `` matthew 's death , i hope , will bring about a better and deeper understanding of hate crime laws , '' said elizabeth birch , executive director of the human rights campaign , a lesbian and gay rights group that has 250,000 members . </s><s> `` matthew 's death may lead to an awakening in wyoming and in the united states congress as the need for this legislation . '' </s><s> in 1996 , 21 men and women were killed in the united states because of their sexual orientation , according to the southern poverty law center , an alabama group that tracks violence against minorities . </s><s> according to the fbi , sexual orientation was a factor in 11.6 percent of the 8,759 hate crimes recorded in 1996 . </s><s> but christian conservatives warn that gay leaders want to use shepard 's death to expand hate rights laws and to curtail freedom of speech . </s><s> `` hate crimes laws have nothing to do with perpetrators of violent crime and everything to do with silencing political opposition , '' said steven schwalm , an analyst with the family research council , a washington group dedicated to defending `` faith , family and freedom . '' </s><s> `` it would criminalize pro-family beliefs , '' schwalm said . </s><s> `` this basically sends a message that you ca n't disagree with the political message of homosexual activists . '' </s><s> agreement came from john paulk , who was featured this summer in a series of advertisements about how he and his wife , anne , `` overcame '' homosexuality through religious conversion . </s><s> `` we have every right to speak out against an agenda that is contrary to biblical norms , '' said paulk , who describes himself as a homosexuality specialist for focus on the family , a christian group in colorado springs , colo. `` because we are standing up and opposing the homosexual agenda , we are being looked upon as advocating violence against homosexuals , when we categorically reject violence against homosexuals . '' </s><s> last thursday , the family research council unveiled a series of television advertisements that preach the `` healing '' of homosexuality through religious conversion . </s><s> gay leaders charge that these advertisements help create a hostile climate for homosexuals , a climate that can lead to violence . </s><s> hate crime laws that are on the books in 40 states have not impinged on freedom of speech , said brian levin , a criminal justice professor who directs the center on hate and extremism at stockton college , in pomona , n.j . </s><s> instead , he said , hate crime laws send a clear message that society does not tolerate attacks on minorities . </s><s> `` we want to deter the broken windows and simple assaults before they escalate , '' he said . </s><s> referring to murders of homosexuals , he added : `` these crimes are preventable . </s><s> offenders get emboldened if they are not punished the first time . '' </s><s> levin said that his research indicated that homosexuals suffered higher rates of violent crime than the population at large . </s><s> he also said that roughly half of the people who attack homosexuals are male , aged 22 or younger . </s><s> the two men charged in the killing of shephard are both white , russell henderson , 21 , and aaron mckinney , 22 . </s><s> `` with other crimes , violence is a means to an end . </s><s> with hate crimes , the violence becomes an unstoppable goal , '' levin said . </s><s> shepard suffered a dozen cuts around the head , face and neck , as well as a massive blow to the back of his skull . </s><s> `` because their social stature in society , gays are often viewed as appropriate targets , '' levin added . </s><s> citing the need for hate crime laws to send a clear message to gay bashers , levin said : `` the discourse in society leaves many of these people to believe that what they are doing is socially acceptable . '' </s><s> while some gay leaders saw crucifixion imagery in shepard 's death , others saw a different symbolism : the old west practice of nailing a dead coyote to a ranch fence as a warning to future intruders . </s><s> `` this university of wyoming student was beaten and left to die , tied to a fence like an animal because he was honest and open about being gay , '' beatrice dorhn , legal director of the lambda legal defense and education fund , said monday , `` matthew shepard 's horrible suffering and death can not be dismissed simply as the fault of deranged , isolated individuals . </s><s> his attackers are among millions of americans who constantly hear the message that gay people are not worthy of the most basic equal treatment , '' ms. dorhn said .	beating death of gay student sparks call for federal hate-crimes laws	death of mathew shepard brings call for hate-crimes legislation	death of beaten gay college student fanned nationwide outrage and vigils	hate crimes protection act , wyoming , gringer , matthew shepard , homosexual

mathew shepard s death	religious right group demonize gay day gay student beaten	family research council  republican  gay  scapegoated subhuman	on the same day americans learned last week that matthew shepard , a 5-foot-2 , 105-pound gay college student , had been tortured , strung up like an animal and left to die on a fence outside laramie , wyo. , the family research council was co-hosting a press conference in washington . </s><s> it was the latest salvo in a six-month campaign by the religious right , with the tacit , even explicit , approval of republican leaders , to demonize gay people for political gain in this election year . </s><s> this particular press conference was to announce a new barrage of ads _ a tv follow-up to a summer print campaign _ in which alleged former homosexuals who have `` changed '' implore others to do likewise `` through the power of jesus christ . '' </s><s> the commercials , gooey in style , end with a slogan : `` it 's not about hate ... </s><s> it 's about hope . '' </s><s> but it 's really about stirring up the fear that produces hate . </s><s> if these ads were truly aimed at gay people , they would n't be broadcast at extravagant cost to the wide general audience reached by tv , and they would n't be trumpeted in washington , insuring free national exposure , three weeks before election day . </s><s> the ads themselves , despite the sugar-coating of `` hope , '' ooze malice . </s><s> in one of them , homosexuality is linked to drug addiction and certain death by aids ; all of them implicitly posit that homosexuality is itself a disease in need of a cure . </s><s> matthew shepard has now been `` cured , '' that 's for sure . </s><s> as his uncle , r.w . </s><s> eaton , told the denver post , the 21-year-old matt , who aspired to a career in diplomacy and human rights , was `` a small person with a big heart , mind and soul that someone tried to beat out of him . '' </s><s> of his nephew 's shattered body eaton said , `` it 's like something you might see in war . '' </s><s> and a war it is . </s><s> go to the family research council 's web site and you will find a proud description of its readiness to `` wage the war against the homosexual agenda and fight to maintain the traditional meaning of `family . '' ' </s><s> the head of the family research council is gary bauer , a gop power broker and putative presidential candidate , who disingenuously goes on talk shows to say that his organization hates no one and deplores violence . </s><s> but if you wage a well-financed media air war in which people with an innate difference in sexual orientation are ceaselessly branded as sinful and diseased and un-american seekers of `` special rights , '' ground war will follow . </s><s> it 's a story as old as history . </s><s> once any group is successfully scapegoated as a subhuman threat to `` normal '' values by a propaganda machine , emboldened thugs take over . </s><s> two weeks after james byrd was savagely dragged to his death from a pickup truck in texas in june , i wrote a column about an ugly incident outside the gop state convention in fort worth , where a mob threatened a group of gay log cabin republicans who were protesting discriminatory treatment by their own party . </s><s> the gay-bashers had been directly preceded by steady saber-rattling from republican politicians : sen. james inhofe of oklahoma had likened james hormel , a gay nominee to an ambassadorship , to david duke ; pat robertson had wondered on tv if god might wreak havoc on disney world for its `` gay days '' ; the texas gop spokesman had likened log cabin to the ku klux klan . </s><s> just two days after this near-brush with violence in fort worth , trent lott was on tv seconding the religious right 's condemnation of gay people as sinful and sick . </s><s> a frightened gay texas republican who had been at the convention melee asked when i interviewed him then : `` do you have to have someone hurt and beat up and dragged from a truck to stop this ? '' </s><s> months later not even the murder in laramie has moved lott to apologize for his words , and still no major gop leader dares take on its `` religious '' wing and its crusade against people like matthew shepard . </s><s> in one of the new ads in that supposedly hate-free crusade , an ostensibly loving mother condemns her son for the `` bad choice '' of being gay . </s><s> is it that mother who speaks for american values , or is it matthew 's ? </s><s> `` go home , give your kids a hug , '' judy shepard said in a message read by a tearful hospital spokesman who announced her child 's death early monday morning , `` and do n't let a day go by without telling them you love them . ''	ad campaign by religious right seen as demonizing gays for political gain	family research council demonizes gays on day of mathew shepard 's death	religious right group was demonizing gays on same day gay student beaten	family research council , republican , gay , scapegoated as a subhuman

homophobia  antihate	last saturday morning , while matthew shepard lay comatose from a beating , a college homecoming parade passed a few blocks from his hospital bed in fort collins . </s><s> propped on a fraternity float was a straw-haired scarecrow , labeled in black spray paint : `` i 'm gay . '' </s><s> few people missed the message . </s><s> three days earlier , shepard , a gay university of wyoming freshman , was savagely beaten and tied to a ranch fence in such a position that a passerby first mistook him for a scarecrow . </s><s> tuesday , officials at colorado state university reacted with outrage to the fraternity float , opening an investigation and disciplinary procedures against the fraternity , pi kappa alpha . </s><s> the fraternity chapter immediately suspended seven members and said they had acted independently . </s><s> but in a week when candlelight vigils for shepard were being held on campuses across the nation , the scarecrow incident highlighted how hostility toward gay people often flourishes in high schools and universities , gay leaders said tuesday . </s><s> `` people would like to think that what happened to matthew was an exception to the rule but , it was an extreme version of what happens in our schools on a daily basis , '' said kevin jennings , executive director of the gay , lesbian and straight education network , a new york group dedicated to ending anti-gay bias in the schools . </s><s> shepard , a slightly built 21-year-old , died on monday morning from the injuries suffered in the beating . </s><s> he never regained consciousness after being discovered on the evening of oct. 7 , 18 hours after he was lashed to the fence . </s><s> two men , russell henderson , 21 , and aaron mckinney , 22 , were arraigned late monday night on first-degree murder charges . </s><s> their girlfriends , chasity pasley , 20 , and kristen price , 18 , have been arraigned as accessories after the fact . </s><s> in response to the killing , about 50 candelight vigils were scheduled this week , from texas to vermont , from wayne , neb. , to new york city . </s><s> at the poudre valley hospital in fort collins where shepard was in intensive care for five days , his parents , dennis and judy shepard , received about 6,000 electronic messages of condolences . </s><s> tuesday , when funeral arrangements were announced for friday in casper , wyo. , the hospital web site received 30,000 hits an hour . </s><s> friends at the university of wyoming in laramie , wyo. , have set up the matthew shepard memorial fund to raise money to pressure the state legislature to pass anti-hate crime legislation . </s><s> `` i see his name going down in gay history as a catalyst for renewed activism , '' said matt foreman , a former wyomingite who directs empire state pride agenda , a gay political organization in new york . </s><s> from around the nation tuesday , gay leaders stressed that campus homophobia is not restricted to college towns in the rocky mountain west . </s><s> last year , in a survey of almost 4,000 massachusetts high school students , 22 percent of gay respondents said they skipped school in the past month because they felt unsafe at school , and 31 percent said they had been threatened or injured at school in the past year . </s><s> these percentages were about five times greater than the percentages of heterosexual respondents . </s><s> the survey was conducted at 58 high schools by the massachusetts department of education . </s><s> in a separate study of nearly 500 community college students in the san francisco area , 32 percent of male respondents said they had verbally threatened gay people and 18 percent said they had physically threatened or assaulted gay people . </s><s> the study was conducted this year by karen franklin , a forensic psychologist who is a researcher at the university of washington . </s><s> surveys of gay college students conducted in the late 1980s at yale university , oberlin college , rutgers university and penn state found that 16 percent to 26 percent had been threatened with violence , and that 40 percent to 76 percent had been verbally harassed , said the national gay and lesbian task force , a lobbying group based in washington . </s><s> last year , a student group in des moines , iowa , called concerned students , recorded hallway and classroom conversations at five high schools on 10 `` homophobia recording day . '' </s><s> they estimated that the average des moines high school student hears about 25 anti-gay remarks every day . </s><s> `` nine out of 10 `teaching tolerance ' courses weed out gays , '' foreman said . </s><s> `` there are a lot of people preaching anti-racism and anti-semitism . </s><s> but it is still very much ok to make anti-gay jokes , to express anti-gay sentiments . '' </s><s> in a survey of the nation 's 42 largest school districts , 76 percent do not train teachers on issues facing gay students , and 42 percent do not have policies to protect students from discrimination based on sexual orientation , said the gay , lesbian and straight education network , which conducted the survey last month . </s><s> in fort collins , while hospital officials struggled with an electronic avalanche of condolences , city police detectives were investigating a different kind of e-mail . </s><s> on monday , hours after shepard 's death , two gay organizations , the rainbow chorus and the lambda community center , received identical messages applauding shepard 's murder . </s><s> the messages closed with the words : `` i hope it happens more often . ''	anti-gay float in homecoming parade results in suspension of seven students	nation reacts to anti-gay sentiment after shepard 's beating and death	study shows hostility toward gays flourishes in schools and universities	scarecrow , pi kappa alpha , matthew shepard , campus homophobia , anti-hate

one want make people s life well	thousand mourn shepard  house resolution call kill outrageous	gay student mourn thousand funeral nationwide friday	gephart  shepard  antihomosexual  kitch  funeral  casper  kreifels	matthew wayne shepard , the gay student who was beaten in the dead of night , tied to a fence and left to die alone , was mourned at his funeral friday by 1,000 people , including many who had never met him . </s><s> `` matt believed that if he had made one person 's life better , he had succeeded , '' his cousin , the rev . </s><s> anne kitch , said in a homily that was carried beyond the packed pews of st. mark 's episcopal church , through a filled parish hall , across the street to a packed presbyterian church and across casper on an am radio station . </s><s> `` judging from the world 's response , '' she said , `` matt will have made a difference in the lives of thousands . '' </s><s> as the first snowstorm of the fall blanketed casper , fresh flowers filled the red brick church here where shepard had been baptized as a teen-ager and where he once wore the white robes of an episcopal acolyte . </s><s> `` there is an image that comes to mind when i reflect on matt on that wooden cross rail fence , '' said the rev . </s><s> royce brown , the pastor of st. mark 's , in a eulogy . </s><s> `` i replace that image with that of another man hung upon a cross . </s><s> when i concentrate on that man , i can release the bitterness inside . '' </s><s> shepard , a 21-year-old freshman at the university of wyoming , had dreamed of working one day for human rights . </s><s> in death , he has become a national catalyst for a new drive to guarantee for gay people the right to physical safety . </s><s> his death hit a nerve in the nation this week , eliciting dozens of candlelight vigils and rallies for tolerance , several statements of sadness from president clinton , and a congressional resolution . </s><s> thursday , the house of representatives passed by voice vote a resolution that condemned shepard 's killing as `` outrageous '' and that urged each member of congress and every u.s. citizen `` to denounce this outrageous murder of another human being . '' </s><s> in one of the largest rallies , about 1,000 people , including members of congress of both parties , gathered on the steps of the capitol in washington to condemn the shepherd 's killing and to urge passage of a federal bill that would add extra penalties to crimes motivated by a victim 's sexual orientation , gender or disability . </s><s> house minority leader dick gephardt urged passage of the bill , leading the crowd in a chant of `` now ! </s><s> `` we will never forget the love that the world has shared with this kind , loving son , '' said shepherd 's father , dennis , his father , outside casper city hall , as his mother , judy , stood by , weeping . </s><s> he said the family was `` touched beyond measure '' by `` the thousands of e-mail comments , web-site messages , phone calls and cards offering help , consolation , sympathy and support . '' </s><s> before the funeral , about a dozen protesters , largely from kansas and texas , waved signs with anti-homosexual messages . </s><s> but mourners stood in front of them , singing `` amazing grace '' and holding umbrellas to block the sight of the spectacle from friends and family members entering the church . </s><s> on hearing of the protest , laramie 's city council held an emergency meeting thursday night and unanimously passed an ordinance banning protests during funerals . </s><s> wyoming gov . </s><s> jim geringer had warned in advance that anti-gay protesters were `` just flat not welcome . '' </s><s> the governor , a republican , added , `` what we do n't need is a bunch of wingnuts coming in . '' </s><s> shepard was born in casper and attended elementary school , junior high and several years of high school and college here . </s><s> with flags at casper 's public schools flying at half-staff friday , many mourners were his old classmates . </s><s> others traveled here , one driving from as far away as new jersey , out of a sense of solidarity . </s><s> `` i 've had a pit in my heart and my stomach since i heard this , '' said steve pietrangelo , who drove 300 miles to wait three hours in cold rain and snow to attend the funeral of a man he never met . </s><s> `` i just wanted to pay my respects to him and his family . '' </s><s> touching people of all walks of life , shepard 's murder has elicited calls for tolerance of homosexuals from unexpected quarters . </s><s> at the university of wyoming this fall , football players will wear yellow and green stickers on their helmets in memory of shepard . </s><s> organizers said that yellow signifies tolerance and green symbolizes peace . </s><s> in casper , a conservative city of 51,000 , located in the heart of wyoming 's oil belt , tolerance has become the watchword . </s><s> `` prejudice against homosexuals is just as redneck as anti-black bias , '` the casper star-tribune , wyoming 's largest newspaper , wrote in its main editorial on sunday . </s><s> `` violence against our homosexual friends and neighbors has created a most un-american climate of fear in wyoming and the rest of the nation . '' </s><s> monday , jason marsden , the newspaper 's political reporter , wrote lovingly that , `` matthew shepard is still my friend , and not just because we are both members of the loose-knit community of gay people striving to make our way in this sometimes hostile place called wyoming . '' </s><s> `` matt was very short and hard to hug , '' marsden recalled of the young man who had grown up in casper . </s><s> `` but it was worth trying , because he 'd hug you with everything in his little , fragile frame . '' </s><s> in a week of spiritual reflection , aaron kreifels , the university of wyoming freshman who found his battered classmate oct. 7 , attributed the chance discovery to `` god 's plan . '' </s><s> on that afternoon , kreifels , an 18-year-old architectural engineering student , had nearly completed a rigorous six-mile ride on a mountain bike up and down cactus canyon , in public lands east of laramie . </s><s> kreifels recalled in an interview thursday that his only mishap of the ride , `` i hit this big limestone rock and did one over the handlebars . '' </s><s> dusting himself off and looking around in the fading light of the day , kreifels recalled , `` i noticed something out of my eye that looked like a scarecrow . </s><s> i walked around the fence , and as i got closer , i noticed the hair . '' </s><s> shepard , his hands bound behind his back with a nylon cord and tied to a fence post , was lying on the ground , face up , unconscious . </s><s> `` sometimes i wonder why i found him alive , if he was going to die , '' kreifels reflected , before traveling to spend this weekend at home with his parents in grand island , neb . </s><s> `` but i guess god wanted his parents to be with him . ''	matthew shepard eulogized as one who wanted to make people 's lives better	thousands mourn shepard ; house resolution calls killing outrageous	gay student mourned by thousands at his funeral and nation-wide on friday	gephart , shepard , anti-homosexual , kitch , funeral , casper , kreifels

mob tie  privatization deal	turkish prime minister press resign  link shady business mob	ankara , turkey ( ap ) - prime minister mesut yilmaz on wednesday faced intense pressure to step down after allegations that he interfered in a privatization contract and helped a businessman linked to a mobster secure loans . </s><s> deniz baykal , leader of the center-left republican party whose backing in parliament helps yilmaz 's minority government , said he would withdraw his support unless the premier resigned immediately . </s><s> two opposition parties threatened to press for a motion to censure the government . </s><s> the allegations were made by businessman korkmaz yigit , who claimed that yilmaz and gunes taner , the economy minister , had encouraged him to buy the state-run bank turkbank , offering him loans from other state banks to ensure that his offer was the highest bid . </s><s> yigit 's allegations were carried tuesday night on two of his tv channels which showed a videotape he had made to explain his version of the story before his detention monday evening for questioning about the bidding . </s><s> yigit bought the bank at a public auction in august for dlrs 600 million . </s><s> the government suspended the privatization last month after a lawmaker released an audio tape of a conversation supposedly between yigit and mobster alaattin cakici . </s><s> on that earlier tape , cakici was heard assuring yigit that he will fend off rival bidders . </s><s> it was not clear who made the tape , which got into the hands of an opposition deputy . </s><s> yigit claimed yilmaz and taner were aware of cakici 's involvement in the bidding for the bank but urged him nevertheless to go ahead with the bidding . </s><s> yilmaz has said that an intelligence report revealing yigit 's ties with cakici only reached him after yigit won the tender . </s><s> yigit said the premier had also encouraged him to buy mass-circulation national newspaper milliyet , apparently to ensure the paper 's backing to his center-right motherland party in elections next year . </s><s> milliyet 's sale to yigit was canceled after the scandal . </s><s> cakici was arrested in france in august . </s><s> turkey has requested his extradition . </s><s> last month state minister eyup asik resigned after allegations he had been in close contact with cakici .	yilmaz pressed to demand islamic virtue inclusion else wo nt join ecevit govt	chance new  secular  turkish government fade  ecevit	the chances for a new , strictly secular government in turkey faded wednesday when a potential coalition partner insisted on giving the islamic party a share of power . </s><s> the military , self-appointed guardians of turkey 's secular system , is adamantly opposed to the inclusion of islamic virtue , the largest party in parliament . </s><s> premier-designate bulent ecevit needs turkey 's two-center right parties to hammer together a secular coalition , but tansu ciller , the ex-premier who commands 99 votes in parliament , rebuffed him wednesday . </s><s> ecevit already has the support of her arch-rival , outgoing premier mesut yilmaz , head of the other center-right party . </s><s> but mrs. ciller said wednesday she would not join forces with yilmaz , whose government collapsed nov. 25 over a mafia scandal . </s><s> instead , she reiterated her demand for a government that would include virtue . </s><s> `` we do not oppose mr. ecevit 's premiership . </s><s> we will support him , but only if all parties represented in parliament are included , '' mrs. ciller said . </s><s> it was not clear what ecevit 's next move would be . </s><s> he might try to form a fragile minority coalition . </s><s> he might also admit defeat and return the task of forming the government to president suleyman demirel . </s><s> demirel could then choose any member of parliament to head the government until elections in april .	ecevit fails to form a secular government ; two key secular parties monday in his efforts to form a broad-based , coalition government , on condition that his government stick to turkey 's secular principles . </s><s> the islamic-oriented virtue party , however , withheld immediate support for yalim erez . </s><s> news reports said virtue was holding out for a number of cabinet seats that reflected its standing as the largest party in parliament . </s><s> `` we are neither saying `yes ' nor saying `no ' at this point , '' virtue leader recai kutan said . </s><s> erez denied that the two had discussed cabinet posts . </s><s> erez , an independent lawmaker , is trying to form a coalition government that would include cabinet members from several parties , including virtue . </s><s> the coalition would run the country only until parliamentary elections set for april . </s><s> erez took over efforts to form a government last week after veteran leftist bulent ecevit gave up , unable to convince turkey 's bickering center-left personal honesty  begin work form new government	bulent ecevit ask form new government follow ouster msut yilmaz	ecevit try form majority govt yilmaz  ciller party	ecevitcareer politician  intellectual  social democrat  turkish military	a week after the turkish government fell in a corruption scandal , president suleyman demirel on wednesday asked a veteran left-wing politician known for his personal honesty , bulent ecevit , to form a new government . </s><s> ecevit , who served as prime minister three times in the 1970s , said he would immediately begin working to fashion a government that could command a majority in the faction-ridden parliament . </s><s> he also suggested that although parliament has set april 18 as the date for a new election , he might seek to remain in power for a longer period . </s><s> `` it is wrong to see this government as simply an election government , '' he said . </s><s> `` there are problems that will not wait until an election . '' </s><s> military commanders , who hold ultimate power in turkey , have quietly told senior political figures , including demirel , that they do not want a quick election . </s><s> they fear it will produce a parliament just as divided as the present one , perhaps with the islamic-oriented virtue party as the largest bloc . </s><s> the commanders are also hoping to exclude two of the country 's leading politicians , outgoing prime minister mesut yilmaz and former prime minister tansu ciller , neither of whom they trust , from posts in the new government . </s><s> ecevit must now try to build a government that includes their center-right parties but not them as individuals . </s><s> in a meeting this week the country 's senior policy-making body , the national security council , in which military officers have a strong say , set three priorities for the coming months . </s><s> it said that whatever government emerges from forthcoming negotiations should dedicate itself to fighting religious fundamentalism , kurdish nationalism and criminal gangs that have infiltrated the state apparatus . </s><s> among ecevit 's immediate challenges will be to resolve a political crisis with italy that broke out last month when the kurdish rebel leader abdullah ocalan was arrested in rome and then asked for political asylum there . </s><s> turkey wants ocalan sent here for trial , but italy says it can not extradite him as long as turkey retains the death penalty . </s><s> ecevit ( pronounced eh-che-vit ) is among the few senior turkish politicians who favors the abolition of capital punishment . </s><s> together with demirel , ecevit is often cited by turks who complain about the continued dominance of a geriatric political elite here . </s><s> he is 73 and has been in politics for most of his adult life . </s><s> early in his career ecevit emerged as a spokesman for turkey 's downtrodden masses . </s><s> perhaps more than any other figure , he legitimized social democratic ideology in a climate where leftist sympathies were often considered subversive . </s><s> at the same time , however , he has shown himself to be a fierce nationalist . </s><s> he was prime minister when turkey sent troops to occupy northern cyprus in 1974 and is still considered a hard-liner on cyprus . </s><s> he is also uncompromising in his opposition to kurdish nationalism . </s><s> during his terms as prime minister in the 1970s , ecevit successfully undermined efforts to move turkey toward membership in the european union , then called the european economic community . </s><s> he considered it an instrument of capitalist exploitation . </s><s> ecevit has also disturbed the united states by flirting with anti-western ideologies . </s><s> in the early 1990s , during an interval when he worked as a journalist , he traveled to iraq and wrote a series of articles favorable to saddam hussein . </s><s> he recently called for better relations between turkey and iraq , and maintains some of the anti-imperialist positions and suspicion of capitalism that he developed in the 1960s . </s><s> the democratic socialist party , which ecevit heads , is a closely held family fiefdom . </s><s> he and his wife carefully screen applicants for membership and veto those whose personal loyalty to ecevit is suspect . </s><s> `` during his terms as prime minister in the '70s , ecevit did not appear to be a consensus builder , '' said ilter turan , a professor of political science at bilgi university in istanbul . </s><s> `` it seems that nowadays he is more accommodating , so from that perspective he may not be bad choice . '' </s><s> `` on many issues that turkish society is encountering now , he represents an orientation which does not seem to be totally in tune with the times , '' turan said . </s><s> `` that would include his position on issues like privatization , integrating turkey more fully into the international system , and the devolution of central authority . </s><s> he has failed to grasp where the world is heading . </s><s> he looks at and analyzes the world in categories that are no longer useful or appropriate . '' </s><s> almost alone among turkish politicians , ecevit lives modestly and has avoided any hint of personal or financial scandal . </s><s> he speaks fluent english , and his reading tastes run to poetry and intellectual journals such as the new york review of books . </s><s> he has translated the works of t.s . </s><s> eliot into turkish and published several volumes of his own poems .	ecevit , known for personal honesty , begins work to form new government .	bulent ecevit asked to form new government following ouster of msut yilmaz	ecevit tries to form majority govt with yilmaz , ciller parties but not them	ecevit-career politician ; intellectual ; social democrat : turkish military .

md	canada  remembrance day  sniper  abortion  training  ru486  prochoice	while veterans and civic leaders devote wednesday 's national holiday to honoring fallen soldiers , remembrance day has become a chilling vigil for canadians in the front lines of the abortion-rights movement . </s><s> there is immediate fear , because an anti-abortion gunman is believed to be at large . </s><s> and there is long-term anxiety , because even in this country where abortions are legal and publicly funded , women may find access diminishing . </s><s> there is speculation the sniper 's timing is linked to remembrance day because some anti-abortion activists use the day to commemorate aborted fetuses . </s><s> three times since 1994 , a sniper has used this time of year to fire into the home of a canadian doctor who performs abortion , each time wounding the target . </s><s> the attacks were spread across canada _ ontario , manitoba and british columbia . </s><s> u.s. and canadian investigators now believe those attacks were linked to two shootings of abortion-providing doctors in upstate new york , including the oct. 23 slaying of dr. barnett slepian at his home near buffalo . </s><s> an american anti-abortion activist , james kopp , is wanted for questioning about the shootings . </s><s> police say they do n't know which side of the border he is on , fueling uneasiness at clinics and hospitals throughout canada . </s><s> `` you must realize canada has the largest undefended border in the world , '' said keith mccaskill , a police inspector in winnipeg , manitoba , and spokesman for the investigation . </s><s> many women 's clinics have tightened security , and doctors who provide abortions have been urged to take precautions . </s><s> `` i would suggest they be extremely aware of their day-to-day goings on , whether during their business day or after hours , '' said toronto detective rick stubbings . </s><s> across canada , there have been reports of obstetrician-gynecologists modifying their practices or deciding to stop performing abortions . </s><s> some wear bulletproof vests and hang sheets over windows of their homes . </s><s> abortion-rights groups say most doctors are not backing down . </s><s> `` there 's a great deal of sadness , '' said susan fox , director of a clinic in edmonton , alberta , that provides abortions . </s><s> `` but there 's also a feeling of determination that we wo n't be deterred or scared by these actions . '' </s><s> marilyn wilson , executive director of the canadian abortion rights action league , sees a long-term threat because fear of violence may intimidate young doctors from entering the field . </s><s> `` there are almost no doctors who have stopped performing these procedures , even under the current reign of terror , '' she said . </s><s> `` but young doctors with families would n't necessarily want to do this . </s><s> they may not be willing to put their lives at risk . '' </s><s> the abortion debate is only one of several factors contributing to a shortage of obstetrician-gynecologists in canada . </s><s> the national society that oversees the speciality says there are about 1,400 doctors in the field , a shortfall of 600 , and most are in their 50s or 60s . </s><s> the society says long hours and limits on fees paid by the public health-care system are causing burnout and deterring medical school graduates as they choose a specialty . </s><s> another problem is that few canadian medical schools offer training in abortion . </s><s> women in canada 's big cities generally have adequate access to abortions . </s><s> those in rural areas often face long journeys , and the province of prince edward island prohibits abortions at its six hospitals , forcing women there to travel to new brunswick or nova scotia . </s><s> abortion-rights groups say the situation would improve if the ru-486 abortion pill were available in canada . </s><s> no drug company has applied for permission to market the pill , either fearing boycotts or doubting its profitability . </s><s> the government has been urged to make a public appeal to drug companies , but the health department says this ca n't be done . </s><s> `` it would be a conflict of interest , '' said bonnie fox-mcintyre , a department spokeswoman . </s><s> `` as a regulator we have to stay at arm 's length , so we can judge an application impartially . '' </s><s> abortion was illegal in canada until 1988 . </s><s> now there is no abortion law of any sort , about 100,000 abortions are performed annually , and polls indicate roughly three-quarters of canadians favor pro-choice policies . </s><s> yet public support does n't spare doctors from fear . </s><s> dr. henry morgentaler , who led efforts to overturn the old abortion law and whose toronto clinic was bombed in 1993 , says he and his colleagues are sacrificing personal freedom as they reluctantly increase security measures . </s><s> `` unfortunately , doctors who are committed to providing these services will have to accept a certain diminishment of their enjoyment of life , '' he said .	canadians fear remembrance day may bring anti-abortion rights violence	canadian abortion-rights movement fears anti-abortion gunman at large	anti-abortion violence feared in canada as remembrance day nears ; fewer mds	canada , remembrance day , sniper , abortion , training , ru-486 , pro-choice
