soldiers on friday blocked off the street in front of a house where members of a terrorist gang are believed to have assembled the bomb that blew up the u.s. embassy , killing 11 people . </s><s> wearing gloves and masks , detectives from the tanzanian criminal investigation division could be seen searching the yard of the house that is surrounded by a high fence . </s><s> residents , who were questioned thursday by tanzanian police and fbi agents , told reporters friday there were four regular visitors to the house . </s><s> they all came at night and used a white 1989 suzuki samuri , which is in police custody . </s><s> two men , tanzanian rashid saleh hemed and egyptian mustafa mahmoud said ahmed , have been formally charged by a tanzanian magistrate in the aug. 7 embassy bombing . </s><s> police are looking for two other suspects identified ahmad khalfan , a tanzanian of omani origin and fahad , a kenyan of yemeni origin . </s><s> a relative of hemed told the associated press the embassy building . </s><s> the relative , who spoke on condition of anonymity , said in addition to khalfan , the three other visitors to the house were fahad , ahmed and hussein . </s><s> he did not furnish second names for them , and it was not clear whether ahmed was the same egyptian charged in the dar es salaam bombing . </s><s> residents said police showed them photographs , but they kenya	german police raided several locations near bonn after receiving word of a terrorist threat against the u.s. embassy , but no evidence of a planned attack was found , officials said wednesday . </s><s> police , including agents of an elite anti-terrorist unit , checked several suspects during raids in an industrial zone and other sites tuesday , but no arrests were made , said eva schuebel , spokeswoman for the federal prosecutor 's office in karlsruhe . </s><s> the agency said it had received `` credible information '' that middle east terrorists had stockpiled arms and explosives at the sites , but none were found . </s><s> the agency 's investigation is continuing , schuebel said . </s><s> `` for now , we can no longer speak of an immediate threat to the u.s. embassy , '' she said . </s><s> the embassy had no comment . </s><s> security was tightened at u.s. installations worldwide after the aug. 7 bombings of the u.s. embassies in kenya and tanzania . </s><s> saudi dissident osama bin laden is wanted by u.s. officials for those attacks . </s><s> a suspected top aide of bin laden , mamdouh mahmud salim , is jailed in germany pending a u.s. extradition request , raising concern about reprisals on german soil . </s><s> u.s. authorities charge salim helped finance , train and arm members of a terrorist organization , including the alleged bombers of the u.s. embassies in kenya and tanzania . </s><s> in september , german police stepped up security at the u.s. consulate in hamburg after receiving a tip about a possible threat .	german police react to possible bin laden  us enemy  hero islamic militant	islamic group threaten retaliation osama bin laden arrest	islamic militant call bin laden hero  kill 224  wound 5000 africa	pakistan  islamic militant group  sipahesahaba  retaliation  bin laden	an islamic militant group on thursday threatened to retaliate if saudi dissident osama bin laden is arrested , and described washington 's no . </s><s> 1 enemy as a `` hero '' to muslims worldwide . </s><s> bin laden , believed to be in afghanistan , and a top aide were indicted wednesday by a u.s. district court in the u.s. embassy bombings in africa and are accused of conspiring to kill americans outside the united states . </s><s> the state department also announced a reward of up to dlrs 5 million for bin laden 's capture . </s><s> `` it is a challenge to the entire muslim world ... bin laden is a hero of the muslim world , '' said omar warsi , a leader of pakistan 's militant sunni muslim group , sipah-e-sahaba , or guardians of the friends of the prophet . </s><s> `` if anything happens to him , america will be responsible . '' </s><s> many sipah-e-sahaba followers are fighting in neighboring afghanistan alongside the taliban army , which rules 90 percent of afghanistan and has imposed a strict version of islamic law in those areas . </s><s> warsi 's group is well-armed with everything from machine guns to rocket launchers . </s><s> in pakistan , it has been blamed in killings of hundreds of shiite muslims , whom the group reviles as non-muslims based on a centuries-old dispute over who was the proper successor to the prophet mohammed . </s><s> harakat-ul-ansar , a pakistan-based organization labeled a terrorist group by the united states , said , however , that foreigners in pakistan `` have nothing to fear from us . '' </s><s> harakat is considered a strong supporter of bin laden , and several harakat followers were killed in the u.s. missile attack on alleged bin laden terror sites in afghanistan . </s><s> `` what the united states does is their business , '' said abdul bassit , a harakat follower . </s><s> he added , however , that the united states should know bin laden `` is a good muslim , and all the muslim world thinks he is a good muslim . '' </s><s> the taliban say bin laden is a respected guest who will not be extradited . </s><s> however , they have set up a judicial inquiry to accept evidence of bin laden 's involvement in terrorist activity and have promised to prosecute him if the evidence warrants it . </s><s> washington blames bin laden 's group , al qaeda , for the aug. 7 bombings of u.s. embassies in kenya and tanzania that killed 224 people , including 12 americans , and injured an estimated 5,000 people . </s><s> the united states retaliated aug. 20 , firing tomahawk cruise missiles at suspected bin laden training camps in eastern afghanistan . </s><s> at least 26 people were killed , but damage to the area was not considered extensive . </s><s> the u.s. embassy in pakistan evacuated nonessential staff and family members prior to the august bombing of afghanistan , fearing retaliation . </s><s> while some embassy workers are back , their dependents and about 30 percent of the staff have not been allowed to return . </s><s> embassy officials said no fresh security warnings followed wednesday 's indictment . </s><s> security measures already in place include cement barricades blocking the road leading to the u.s. embassy in islamabad and razor-sharp barbed wire topping the brick-walled compound . </s><s> in the northwestern pakistani city of peshawar , on the border with afghanistan , the u.s. consulate is surrounded by barbed wire and protected by an armored personnel carrier and dozens of armed police .	osama bin laden : us enemy , but hero to islamic militants	islamic group threatens retaliation if osama bin laden is arrested	islamic militant calls bin laden hero ; killed 224 , wounded 5,000 in africa .	pakistan , islamic militant group , sipah-e-sahaba , retaliation , bin laden

embassy bomber jail new york deny outside	restriction impose two held bombing us embassy africa	two suspect african embassy bombing isolate new york city jail	bombing  us embassy  kenya  tanzania  odeh al  owahli  segregate	federal prison officials have cut off virtually all communications for two men being held in manhattan in the bombings of the u.s. embassies in kenya and tanzania . </s><s> a federal prison official said monday that the government moved under a rarely used federal rule that allows prison officials to limit an inmate 's contacts to prevent future `` acts of violence and terrorism . '' </s><s> a spokesman for the federal prosecutor 's office declined to say whether the authorities foresaw further threats of terrorism . </s><s> but the law allows officials to impose restrictions where they believe there is `` a substantial risk '' that an inmate 's communications `` could result in death or serious bodily injury . '' </s><s> under the provision , approved by the justice department , prison officials may segregate prisoners from other inmates , and cut off their correspondence , visits , interviews with the news media and use of the telephone . </s><s> it was not clear yesterday which of these restrictions would be applied to the two bombing suspects , mohamed saddiq odeh and mohamed rashed daoud al-'owhali . </s><s> the rule does permit communications with their lawyers . </s><s> a bureau of prisons official in washington confirmed that the two men are joining a group of about six inmates throughout the country being held under the restrictions . </s><s> the total population of federal prisons exceeds 108,000 inmates . </s><s> others similarly restricted include sheik omar abdel rahman , the egyptian cleric convicted in the conspiracy to blow up landmarks in new york , and ramzi ahmed yousef , convicted of masterminding the world trade center bombings in 1993 . </s><s> michael a . </s><s> young , the lawyer representing odeh , said he was `` somewhat concerned because these are pretrial defendants , after all . '' </s><s> `` you ca n't punish them in advance of any determination of whether they are guilty or innocent , '' he said . </s><s> leonard f. joy , al-'owhali 's lawyer , said his initial impression is that some of the restrictions could hinder his ability to represent his client .	suspected us embassy bombers jailed in new york denied outside	restrictions imposed on two held in bombing of u.s. embassies in africa	two suspects in african embassy bombings isolated in new york city jail .	bombing , u.s. embassy , kenya , tanzania , odeh and al ' owahli , segregate

bombing	osama bin laden indict conspire bomb us embassy africa	bin laden aide indict bomb african embassy  reward  search	reward  238count indictment  bin laden  atef  terrorism  embassy bombing	a federal grand jury in manhattan returned a 238-count indictment wednesday charging the saudi exile osama bin laden with conspiring to bomb two u.s. embassies in africa in august and with committing acts of terrorism against americans abroad . </s><s> government officials immediately announced that they were offering two rewards of $ 5 million each for information leading to the arrest or conviction of bin laden and another man charged wednesday , muhammad atef , who was described as bin laden 's chief military commander . </s><s> bin laden is believed to be living in afghanistan under the protection of the taliban , the islamic fundamentalist movement that rules that country . </s><s> atef 's whereabouts are unknown . </s><s> prosecutors also unsealed an earlier indictment , issued in june , that included similar but less detailed charges against bin laden . </s><s> that indictment was returned before the embassy bombings and was the result of a two-year investigation into his activities in somalia and saudi arabia , as well as reports that he had connections to a circle of islamic militants in brooklyn . </s><s> the new indictment , which supersedes the june action , accused bin laden of leading a vast terrorist conspiracy from 1989 to the present , in which he was said to be working in concert with governments , including those of sudan , iraq and iran , and terrorist groups , to build weapons and attack american military installations . </s><s> but the indictment gives few details of bin laden 's alleged involvement in the embassy attacks . </s><s> the indictment does not , for example , specify whether prosecutors have evidence that bin laden gave direct orders to those who carried out the attacks . </s><s> nothing in the document indicates why the original indictment was kept secret for months , but the secret charges were returned about the time that american officials were plotting a possible raid into afghanistan to arrest bin laden . </s><s> mary jo white , the u.s. attorney in manhattan , said , `` it 's very common to have sealed indictments when you 're trying to apprehend those who are indicted . '' </s><s> both indictments offer new information about bin laden 's operations , including one deal he is said to have struck with iraq to cooperate in the development of weapons in return for bin laden 's agreeing not to work against that country . </s><s> no details were given about whether the alleged deal with iraq led to the development of actual weapons for bin laden 's group , which is called al qaeda . </s><s> the government said wednesday that bin laden 's group had used private relief groups `` as conduits for transmitting funds '' for al qaeda . </s><s> the groups were not identified . </s><s> prosecutors also said bin laden 's group had conducted internal investigations of its members and their associates , trying to detect who might be acting as informants , and had killed those who had been suspected of collaborating with `` enemies of the organization . '' </s><s> the government indicated earlier that its knowledge of bin laden 's activities stemmed in part from the cooperation of one such informant , who it said wednesday had worked for bin laden , transporting weapons and explosives , helping to buy land for his training camps and assisting in running his finances . </s><s> while the june indictment against bin laden suggested that the government had a great deal of knowledge of his dealings in the months before the embassy attacks , the new charges are an indication of how quickly the government has worked to solve the embassy attacks , which occurred just three months ago . </s><s> ms. white said bin laden was charged with `` plotting and carrying out the most heinous acts of international terrorism and murder . '' </s><s> citing the more than 250 people killed in the embassy attacks and the more than 1,000 wounded , she added , `` in a greater sense , all of the citizens of the world are also victims whenever and wherever the cruel and cowardly acts of international terrorism strike . '' </s><s> the investigation of bin laden is continuing , said ms. white and lewis d. schiliro , assistant director of the fbi in new york , whose agents have fanned out around the world to look into the embassy attacks . </s><s> `` our investigative strategy is clear , '' schiliro said . </s><s> `` we will identify , locate and prosecute all those responsible , right up the line , from those who constructed and delivered the bombs to those who paid for them and ordered it done . ''	federal grand jury indicts osama bin laden in us embassies bombings	osama bin laden indicted for conspiring to bomb u.s. embassies in africa	bin laden and aide indicted for bombing african embassies ; reward , search .	reward , 238-count indictment , bin laden , atef , terrorism , embassy bombings

commander next president lebanon	army commander emile lahoud lebanon s next president  syria s support	syria okay army commander lahoud next president lebanon	syria support gen emile lahoud succeed hrawi president lebanon	the commander of lebanon 's army will become the country 's next president after winning the crucial backing of syria , the powerbroker in lebanon . </s><s> `` congratulations , your excellency the general , '' lebanese prime minister rafik hariri told army commander emile lahoud in a telephone conversation monday that was headlined on the front-page of the leftist newspaper as-safir . </s><s> lebanese media said the matter was settled monday at a meeting in damascus between outgoing president elias hrawi and syrian president hafez assad , whose country dominates its weaker , smaller neighbor . </s><s> agriculture minister shawki fakhoury , a hrawi confidant , said tuesday that lahoud is expected to be elected by the 128-member parliament at an extraordinary session on oct. 15 . </s><s> the election is a formality since other candidates have little chance now that syria has thrown its weight behind gen. lahoud . </s><s> in another formality before the election , the parliament will amend the constitution , which forbids senior public servants from running for president . </s><s> the new president must be sworn in on nov. 24 , the day hrawi leaves office at the end of his six-year term . </s><s> the choice of lahoud , a maronite catholic , will continue a 55-year-old tradition under which the president is a maronite , the prime minister a sunni muslim and the parliament speaker a shiite muslim . </s><s> agreement among the three officials is essential for the smooth running of the government . </s><s> since lahoud has a good relationship with hariri and speaker nabih berri , little change was expected in government policy . </s><s> lahoud 's nomination ends weeks of suspense over the identity of the next head of state . </s><s> lahoud , a 62-year-old naval officer trained in britain and the united states , enjoys wide public and political support at home and has good relations with syria . </s><s> but the choice could not have been sealed before a final say from assad , who keeps 30,000 troops in this country . </s><s> his word is referred to in the beirut media as `` the password . '' </s><s> lahoud , elevated from rear admiral to general and appointed army commander in 1988 amid a rebellion in the fractured military during the 1975-90 civil war , is credited with rebuilding the 55,000-strong lebanese army and in ending the reign of militias . </s><s> in lebanon , the army commander heads the air force , navy and the ground forces . </s><s> many hope he will copy his success with the military in government , which is plagued by nepotism and waste of public funds . </s><s> but some fear that a military man in the nation 's highest office could mean a return to the use of intelligence services to track civilian life _ the case under fouad chehab , the only other army commander to become president , who ruled from 1958 to 1964 . </s><s> `` the election of a military man is a threat to democracy in lebanon , '' raymond edde , a christian politician living in self-imposed exile in france , told the an-nahar newspaper .	backed by syria , lebanon 's army commander will be next president of lebanon	army commander emile lahoud lebanon 's next president , has syria 's support	syria okays army commander lahoud to be next president of lebanon .	syria supports gen. emile lahoud to succeed hrawi as president of lebanon

parliament on tuesday ratified a constitutional amendment to clear the way for the election of the army 's commander , gen. emile lahoud , as president . </s><s> lahoud has received the backing of syria , the main power broker in the country , making the election by lebanon 's pro-syrian parliament later this week just a formality . </s><s> a total of 113 deputies voted for the amendment and four deputies against , including the general 's cousin , nassib lahoud , a presidential aspirant . </s><s> eleven deputies were absent . </s><s> among those who were absent was walid jumblatt , a cabinet minister who had said he would boycott the session to protest the choice of a military man even though lahoud has wide public and political support . </s><s> the 128-member legislature is expected to meet thursday to elect lahoud after outgoing president elias hrawi signs the constitutional amendment . </s><s> the amendment to article 49 of the constitution revokes a ban on senior civil servants from running for the presidency . </s><s> the new president will be sworn in nov. 24 , the day hrawi leaves office . </s><s> hrawi has served for nine years , including a three-year extension in 1995 to his six-year term . </s><s> lahoud , a maronite catholic , will keep alive a 55-year-old tradition under which the president is a maronite , the prime minister a sunni muslim and the parliament speaker a shiite muslim . </s><s> lahoud , appointed army commander in 1989 amid a rebellion in the fractured military during the 1975-90 civil war , is credited with rebuilding the 55,000-strong lebanese army and in ending the reign of militias . </s><s> many hope he will copy his success with the military in the government , which is plagued by nepotism and waste of public funds . </s><s> but some fear of military dominance of public life .	constitutional change made for army commander to be lebanon 's president	constitutional amendment clears way for lahoud 's election pm	lebanon  prime minister s reappointment question  economy good  corrupt	prime minister  hariri  lahoud  parliament  hrawi  corruption  decree	prime minister rafik hariri 's efforts to win a fourth term in office have hit a snag after he failed to receive the expected speedy appointment from new president emile lahoud . </s><s> hariri is still the front-runner to form the next government but saturday 's daily star newspaper quoted sources as saying that hariri was `` outraged '' that only 62 of the 128 members in parliament declared their support for him during a meeting with lahoud friday . </s><s> according to the constitution , a president must begin his term by appointing the prime minister and a cabinet through a decree issued after consulting with parliament members . </s><s> a presidential decree was expected friday but nothing came through after a meeting between lahoud and hariri . </s><s> hariri had even scheduled friday a traditional meeting between the prime minister-designate and former prime ministers , but that was canceled . </s><s> the state-run national news agency said that while only 62 deputies told lahoud they supported hariri , the rest refused to divulge their choice or left it to the president to decide . </s><s> a tv station owned by hariri said he won the backing of at least 100 deputies . </s><s> the delay reflects the tug-of-war among the power brokers in the country . </s><s> under a formula aimed at preventing the recurrence of the 1975-90 civil war , power in lebanon is shared equally by a maronite christian president , a sunni muslim prime minister and a shiite parliament speaker . </s><s> while the christian lahoud may have no objection to appointing the sunni hariri , it is possible that parliament speaker nabih berri 's 19 shiite supporters in the legislature are holding out to emphasize their value . </s><s> the leading an-nahar and other newspapers said the delay could last for days . </s><s> but in the end , it is hariri that is most likely to be renamed on the strength of his record in office . </s><s> hariri , lebanon 's top businessman , has almost single-handedly created a multibillion dollar program to rebuild a country destroyed by the civil war . </s><s> he is also credited with stabilizing the currency and restoring confidence in the postwar economy . </s><s> but his government under former president elias hrawi were dogged by accusations of corruption . </s><s> hariri , who has been prime minister since 1992 , was appointed three times during the extended term of former president elias hrawi . </s><s> he has remained in office as caretaker prime minister since lahoud succeeded hrawi on tuesday . </s><s> lahoud , a general who as army commander rebuilt the military from 1989 until his election by parliament in october , has pledged in his inauguration speech tuesday to clean up the corruption-plagued administration .	pm hariri expects fourth term but new president not quick to government	hariri  rebuilder lebanon  decline lahoud invitation form new govt	lebanon  prime minister wo nt form new govt  prelude power struggle	lebanon s prime minister hariri decline invite select new cabinet	prime minister rafik hariri has declined an informal invitation from lebanon 's new president to form the next government , sparking a political crisis in this country as it rebuilds from its devastating civil war . </s><s> sources close to the prime minister , whose cabinet has been in care-taker capacity since last tuesday 's swearing in of emile lahoud as president , said hariri turned down the invitation from lahoud to select a new cabinet . </s><s> there has been no formal announcement from lahoud reappointing hariri as prime minister . </s><s> although hariri 's move could be a bargaining tactic , since he remains the front-runner for the premiership , the apparent tension between the two powerful men could affect lebanon 's economic stability as it recovers from the 1975-90 civil war . </s><s> hariri , 53 , the architect of lebanon 's multibillion dollar postwar reconstruction program , has been in power since 1992 . </s><s> a billionaire businessman who made his fortune in saudi arabia , hariri is credited with restoring economic confidence and stabilizing the national currency . </s><s> lahoud , 62 , commander of lebanon 's army who was propelled to power with widespread popular backing , pledged in a tough inauguration speech to clean up the graft-riddled administration . </s><s> the british-trained general made his name rebuilding the army after it disintegrated in the civil war . </s><s> previous disputes among government leaders have cost the central bank hundreds of millions of dollars in its efforts to stabilize the lebanese pound . </s><s> such political disputes in lebanon in the past were solved only with the intervention of syria , the main power broker in this country . </s><s> damascus supports both lahoud and hariri . </s><s> lahoud had been expected to issue a presidential decree last week asking hariri to form the next government . </s><s> the decree was to be issued after the president polled members of the 128-seat parliament on their choice for prime minister . </s><s> but many legislators , who in the past gave their overwhelming support to hariri , did not name him and , instead , left it to the president to select a prime minister . </s><s> the two leaders met friday , but no presidential decree followed . </s><s> the sources close to hariri , speaking on condition of anonymity , said the prime minister 's decision to bow out came because he did not feel lahoud was following constitutional procedures in selecting the premier . </s><s> the hariri camp argues that the president can poll parliament members on their choice for prime minister but can not accept a mandate to name a person of his choice . </s><s> the dispute , in fact , appears to be the opening salvo of a struggle on how lebanon will be governed during lahoud 's six-year term . </s><s> toward the end of former president elias hrawi 's nine years in office , hariri virtually had a free hand in running the country .	political power struggle ?	lebanon 's prime minister hariri declines invite to select new cabinet

news agency</s><s>money market	hariri bow premier dispute new lebanese president pm	hariri claim pm appointment lahoud violates constitution  bow	lebanon  prime minister bow  support wan  blame new president	prime minister hariri  claim constitution violation  bow	prime minister rafik hariri , the business tycoon who launched lebanon 's multibillion dollar reconstruction from the devastation of civil war , said monday he was bowing out as premier following a dispute with the new president . </s><s> he accused president emile lahoud of violating the constitution and demanded that he acknowledge it before he could reconsider his position . </s><s> hariri 's move could be a ploy to gain more power as a new government is formed , but the crisis atmosphere generated by the possible departure of the billionaire businessman could affect lebanon 's economic recovery . </s><s> `` i 'm not a candidate , '' hariri said in a live interview with cnn . </s><s> he demanded that lahoud admit that he acted unconstitutionally by allowing 31 parliament deputies to authorize him to name a prime minister instead of naming one themselves . </s><s> such an action `` might put the country in danger , '' hariri warned . </s><s> asked if there was a risk of renewed conflict in lebanon over the alleged tampering with the constitution , hariri said : `` if the president continues with this , i do n't know what will happen . '' </s><s> but the dispute between the two leaders appears to be over who will have the upper hand in governing the nation of 3.2 million . </s><s> lahoud , 62 , is an army commander who wants to assert his authority at the start of his six-year presidential term . </s><s> hariri , 53 , virtually has had a free hand in running the country since he became premier six years ago under former president elias hrawi . </s><s> a brief meeting on monday between the two did not help resolve the disagreements . </s><s> hariri 's cabinet has been serving in a caretaker capacity since lahoud 's inauguration last tuesday . </s><s> lahoud on monday set the stage for choosing a new prime minister when he scheduled a fresh round of consultations with parliament for tuesday and wednesday . </s><s> in a statement , lahoud said hariri was asked but declined to form the next government after a previous round of consultations . </s><s> the offer came after the 128 legislators polled by the president gave hariri a majority but fell short of the near unanimous backing he had received in his previous three mandates since 1992 . </s><s> hariri is credited with restoring economic confidence and stabilizing the national currency . </s><s> his globe-trotting travels to drum up political and economic support were sometimes instrumental in drawing international financial aid and investment . </s><s> but he was faulted for declining living standards at home and a rise in corruption in government . </s><s> lahoud pledged in a tough inauguration speech to clean up the graft-riddled administration . </s><s> the general enjoys widespread popular backing after succeeding in rebuilding an army fractured by civil war . </s><s> central bank officials on monday tried to calm fears about a run on the lebanese pound by announcing that the bank was ready to intervene with its foreign currency reserves if necessary , the state-run national news agency reported . </s><s> it added that the money markets remained stable .	hariri bowing out as premier after dispute with new lebanese president pm	hariri claims his pm appointment by lahoud violates constitution , bows out	lebanon : exile labor dissenter  trial begin political dissenter	liu  xu  dissident  labor right  exile  wei  wang  china  prison	china released a respected , but ailing labor rights campaigner from a prison work camp sunday and immediately sent him into exile in the united states . </s><s> releasing liu nianchun appeared to be an attempt by the government to blunt international criticism over monday 's upcoming trial of prominent dissident xu wenli . </s><s> xu is the third leading member of a would-be opposition political party put on trial for subversion in a three-week crackdown that has seen at least 32 dissidents arrested or interrogated . </s><s> beijing police sunday detained one of xu 's china democracy party colleagues , zha jianguo , to prevent him from attending the trial , xu 's wife said . </s><s> although pleased that liu nianchun was free , human rights groups decried the chinese government 's timing as manipulative . </s><s> `` we do n't want to give any credit to the chinese government for this cynical game it is playing , '' said xiao qiang , director of new york-based human rights in china . </s><s> after 3 1/2 years in prison , liu was taken from the tuanhe labor camp on the outskirts of beijing , driven to the capital 's airport and put on a canadian air flight , ultimately bound for new york , his mother and brother said . </s><s> accompanying liu into exile was his wife , chu hailan , and their 11-year-old daughter , the family said . </s><s> liu nianchun 's release follows the same pattern china used in freeing its two most famous dissidents , wei jingsheng in nov. 1997 and wang dan in april . </s><s> authorities released liu on medical parole , exactly five months before the end of his prison term , provided he go into exile , said his brother and exiled democracy campaigner , liu qing . </s><s> liu nianchun , 50 , has been in ill-health for at least two years . </s><s> in an exam authorities finally agreed to provide last month , doctors discovered liu had tumors in his mouth , stomach and bowels , liu qing said . </s><s> like wang and wei , the united states and other western governments have lobbied china to release liu . </s><s> chinese leaders have been forcing well-known dissidents into exile throughout the 1990s , finding that once abroad they lose their influence among dissidents at home . </s><s> in the only official comment on the release , the xinhua news agency reported that judicial departments took into account liu 's health and behavior in the labor camp in approving his parole for medical treatment . </s><s> `` i am very happy for liu nianchun , but at the same time sending people directly from prison into exile is a type of human rights violation and persecution , '' liu qing said in a telephone interview from his home in new york 's brooklyn borough . </s><s> liu nianchun was one of the most respected figures in the fractured , persecuted dissident community . </s><s> his more than 3 1/2 years in prisons and labor camps was a sad illustration of the way china 's communist party rulers punish people they deem a threat . </s><s> liu was imprisoned three times in the past 17 years . </s><s> his last arrest came after he signed a petition calling for labor rights in may 1995 . </s><s> liu was never put on trial . </s><s> fourteen months passed before his wife , chu hailan , first learned of his fate and whereabouts : a three-year spell in a labor camp in the frigid , remote northeast . </s><s> his term was the maximum police may impose on criminal suspects without trial . </s><s> labor camp officials later extended liu 's sentence by a year for trying to escape , a charge chu claimed was fabricated . </s><s> inside the labor camp , liu once started a hunger strike to protest his treatment . </s><s> he was beaten with cattle prods and confined to a room of 2 square meters ( 2 square yards ) where he could only sit or stand . </s><s> his wife endured police harassment , beatings and detentions in campaigning for his release . </s><s> chu was dragged away and hit by security forces when she tried to hand a letter to u.n. human rights chief mary robinson outside a beijing hotel in september .	china exiles rights campaigner to u.s. to soften trial of noted dissident	china frees imprisoned dissidents then exiles them to end their influence	china exiles labor dissenter ; trial to begin against political dissenter .	liu , xu , dissidents , labor rights , exile , wei , wang , china , prison

china labor right campaigner nianchun year prison camp sunday exile state	china sends two dissident jail try organize opposition party	china give 2 activist long prison term organize opposition party	china go democracy party  2 leader sentence decade jail	harsh sentence chinese dissident  wenli  13 year  youcai  11 year	in stern judgments capping a decisive crackdown on dissidents , chinese courts sentenced two prominent democracy campaigners to 13 and 11 years in prison monday for trying to organize an opposition political party . </s><s> the 13-year prison term given xu wenli after a 3 1/2-hour trial in beijing was the longest for a chinese dissident in three years . </s><s> his colleague in the china democracy party , wang youcai , was sentenced to 11 years , in a verdict announced by a court in hangzhou four days after his trial . </s><s> xu 's conviction deprives the would-be opposition group of a potent organizer and the fractured dissident community at large of a strong and moderating voice . </s><s> xu remained defiant during his tightly controlled trial on subversion charges . </s><s> he refused to answer questions from prosecutors and judges and responded only to those from his lawyer , the court-appointed attorney , mo shaoping , said . </s><s> when the court asked if he would appeal , `` xu wenli said he would not appeal , '' mo said , quoting his client as saying `` this is political persecution . '' </s><s> xu 's daughter also criticized the verdict . </s><s> `` all he wanted to do was to advocate free speech and make sure the party registers peacefully . </s><s> but the government failed this test , and now my father has to go to jail again for it , '' said daughter xu jin , a graduate student at boston university . </s><s> security forces have orchestrated a concerted crackdown , trampling china 's slim legal safeguards to crush the china democracy party . </s><s> in three weeks , at least 32 people have been detained or questioned and xu , wang and another leading member , qin yongmin , have been put on trial . </s><s> all three were charged with trying to subvert china 's communist party-led system . </s><s> xu and qin were given less than four days to prepare their defenses . </s><s> last thursday , wang and qin faced trials without legal counsel after police detained or scared off potential lawyers . </s><s> no verdict has been announced in qin 's case . </s><s> judges in beijing and hangzhou found that xu and wang plotted subversion by founding branches of the china democracy party in both cities and accepting money from abroad , the official xinhua news agency said in a rare mention of dissident activities . </s><s> the courts ruled the two should be `` severely punished '' as repeat offenders , xinhua said in an indirect reference to their previous democracy campaigning . </s><s> wary of the china democracy party 's appeal , scores of uniformed and plainclothes police sealed off beijing 's no . </s><s> 1 intermediate people 's court monday for xu 's trial . </s><s> foreign reporters were kept 500 meters ( yards ) away from the building . </s><s> xu 's wife was the only friend or family member given permission to watch the proceedings , along with an audience selected by court officials . </s><s> she was escorted from her home to the courthouse by three plainclothes officers . </s><s> hours after the verdict , he xintong still had not returned home nor had she contacted her daughter . </s><s> police detained at least two of xu 's democracy party colleagues and kept watch on the houses of others . </s><s> `` members of the china democracy party will struggle to the end for the realization of democracy , '' said gao hongmin , whose home was under surveillance . </s><s> gao , who helped xu organize the party 's beijing branch , said authorities would not be able to arrest all the party 's supporters . </s><s> in just six months , the party attracted enough of a following to try to register branches in 14 provinces and cities . </s><s> the u.s. government and exiled dissidents , many of whom supported the party 's efforts , denounced the sentences and called for the dissidents ' release . </s><s> `` we are deeply disappointed with both the guilty verdict and the extremely harsh sentence given to mr. xu , '' said u.s. embassy spokesman bill palmer . </s><s> `` no individual should be arrested , tried or sentenced for exercising internationally recognized freedoms . '' </s><s> xu , 55 , edited an underground journal in the democracy wall movement 20 years ago and spent 12 years in prison , mostly in solitary confinement . </s><s> since his parole ended last year , he has been behind-the-scenes advisor to a host of dissident activities . </s><s> he supported qin yongmin , another democracy wall veteran , in setting up an independent human rights monitor and advised others to run for local legislative seats in beijing . </s><s> xu became openly involved in the china democracy party in november . </s><s> wang youcai , a student leader of the tiananmen square democracy demonstrations in 1989 and now 32 , publicly declared the china democracy party 's formation in june and said the group intended to challenge the communist party 's 49-year ban on opposition politics . </s><s> police have sporadically detained supporters of the democracy party . </s><s> the decisive move came on nov. 30 as chinese communist party leader jiang zemin returned from japan , ending a busy two years of diplomatic forays . </s><s> in a speech broadcast nationwide on friday , jiang warned against subversives trying to bring down the system and vowed never to copy western democracy . </s><s> to allay international criticism , china released a respected labor rights campaigner , liu nianchun , from 3 1/2 years in prison camps on sunday and sent him into exile in the united states .	china sends two dissidents to jail for trying to organize opposition party	china gives 2 activists long prison terms for organizing opposition party	china goes after democracy party ; 2 leaders sentenced to decade in jail .	harsh sentences for chinese dissidents - wenli , 13 years ; youcai , 11 years

sacrifice cause democracy	china democracy party continue fight  underground  communism s foe warn	china democracy party  zha  legally subversive  communist  xu  wang  qin	his friend and political mentor is jailed , robbing their budding opposition political party of its most potent organizer , but zha jianguo is not afraid . </s><s> a bag packed with toothbrush , toothpaste and medicine lies ready at his beijing home for the day chinese police take him away . </s><s> he has told police interrogators he expects to be jailed , likely for a few years less than the 13 given china democracy party leader xu wenli on monday . </s><s> `` democracy is a process , and in that process a small number of people will be sacrificed , '' zha , a 47-year-old former manager of a computer design company and vice chairman of the party 's beijing branch , told the associated press in an interview thursday . </s><s> `` we want to use our sacrifice to arouse the people , and we believe that sacrifice is worthwhile . '' </s><s> with a mixture of defiance and cool clarity about the chances for success , zha said he and other china democracy party members will continue organizing and campaigning for change . </s><s> his tenacity holds despite the summary trials and harsh punishments for xu , wang youcai and qin yongmin _ prominent party principals from the provinces who were sentenced to 11 and 12 years _ and despite threatening signs from the ruling communist party . </s><s> chinese president jiang zemin warned in a speech published wednesday that political subversives threatened what he called china 's fragile social order . </s><s> `` whenever any element that undermines stability raises its head , it must be resolutely nipped in the bud , '' jiang said . </s><s> zha maintains that such tactics are unnecessary . </s><s> in its manifestoes , the democracy party espoused peaceful means to target `` the undemocratic system , not the political power of the communist party . '' </s><s> `` we believe elections held after the establishment of a democratic system should decide who has the power , '' said zha . </s><s> what many the world over consider democracy is legally subversive in china for threatening the communist party-led system . </s><s> in the past month , authorities have arrested and convicted xu , qin and wang and detained or interrogated at least 29 other party members . </s><s> police took zha from his home sunday afternoon and held him for nearly 24 hours to keep him from xu 's trial . </s><s> until the crackdown , the china democracy party distinguished itself from past attempts at opposition by its openness . </s><s> organizers publicly announced their intention to set up the party . </s><s> they tried to register with authorities . </s><s> statements were faxed to foreign media and human rights groups to circumvent china 's state-controlled media . </s><s> now , the party 's members _ about 500 by zha 's count _ are being driven underground . </s><s> party members will concentrate on increasing ranks and will be more guarded in the use of telephones and faxes and their occasional meetings , zha said . </s><s> `` if xu and the other two were the first round , then the second round is very likely and it will be bigger , '' zha said . </s><s> `` in such an unbalanced contest , we are forced to use more secretive means . '' </s><s> the arrests of xu , wang and qin deprive the party of its more influential members , zha said . </s><s> all had proven track records , xu and qin as dissident editors in the democracy wall era movement 20 years ago , wang as a student leader of the tiananmen square democracy demonstrations in 1989 . </s><s> `` but from another aspect , this has strengthened the resolve of even more party members to struggle on , '' zha said of the arrests . </s><s> zha got interested in politics as a radical youth , following mao tse-tung 's appeals to go to the countryside in 1968 . </s><s> when he returned to beijing in 1989 , he marched in the tiananmen protests and continued his activism . </s><s> friends introduced him to xu wenli in 1995 . </s><s> having been released from prison two years before , xu was still not openly involved in dissident politics , but he held court in his beijing home to discuss china 's future .	china democracy party vows to campaign for change despite jiang 's warnings	chinese rights activist expects to be sacrifice in cause of democracy .	china democracy party continues fight , underground ; communism 's foes warned	china democracy party , zha , legally subversive , communist , xu , wang , qin

i</s><s>sentence wife life</s><s>xu day please plant tree	china s arrest dissident could destroy china democracy party	long sentence activist signal treaty wo nt ease political control	china  two prodemocracy politician give long jail term  us critical	xu  subversion  wang  qin  china democracy  international covenant  zemin	by sentencing two of the country 's most prominent democracy campaigners to long prison terms , china on monday took its harshest steps yet in its current crackdown on organized political opposition . </s><s> after a trial that lasted just three and a half hours , xu wenli _ at 55 the dean of the dissident movement , and a man who has already spent 12 years in prison for advocating democracy _ was sentenced to 13 years for `` subversion of state power . '' </s><s> xu 's alleged crimes included helping to organize a new political party , calling for an end to communist rule in interviews with foreign journalists , calling for independent labor unions and , prosecutors said , accepting $ 500 from a dissident abroad . </s><s> he was defended by a lawyer who was appointed by the court just four days ago and met his client only once . </s><s> also sentenced monday , to 11 years in prison , was wang youcai , 32 , founder of the china democracy party , which has now been suppressed . </s><s> wang was tried on subversion charges on thursday in a brief court session , with no defense lawyer , in the eastern city of hangzhou . </s><s> the punishment of a third veteran democracy campaigner , qin yongmin , 44 , has not been announced . </s><s> his trial began in the central city of wuhan on thursday and may reconvene on tuesday , relatives said . </s><s> a similarly long sentence is expected . </s><s> monday 's sentences , which came just six months after president clinton 's visit to beijing , where he publicly challenged china 's leaders to move quickly toward political reform , were harshly criticized by the state department . </s><s> they also appeared to spell the effective end here of the china democracy party , which these three men , along with hundreds of lesser-known individuals , tried to organize in recent months . </s><s> the long sentences also crushed the hopes of many liberal intellectuals here that china 's warming relations with the united states in recent years and its signing of global treaties on human rights might bring a significant easing of political controls . </s><s> xu was tried monday morning in the beijing intermediate court . </s><s> when after a brief recess the three-judge panel announced his 13-year sentence , xu stood up and shouted , `` i protest ! '' </s><s> said his wife of 28 years , he xintong . </s><s> then , said ms . </s><s> he and lawyers who were present , he shouted that the judges were unfair and that he would not appeal his case because the proceedings were illegitimate . </s><s> with the sentencing of xu , china 's communist government has silenced one of its most energetic and persistent critics , one who has given over his adult life to the cause of democracy . </s><s> xu first came to prominence during the democracy wall movement of the late 1970s , then served 12 years in prison , much of it in solitary confinement . </s><s> in the last several months , sensing a new opportunity to speak out and making constant use of fax machines and e-mail , he and qin tried to draw attention to china 's obligations under two international covenants it has signed _ one on economic and cultural rights , and one on civil and political rights . </s><s> in the face of several temporary detentions and stiff warnings , they continued their activities . </s><s> wang , in contrast , first became involved in dissident activities in 1989 , while a graduate student in physics in beijing , when he became a leader of the tiananmen square demonstrations . </s><s> after the student movement was smashed by the army , he was on the most-wanted list , then was arrested and spent two years in prison . </s><s> during clinton 's visit to china in june , wang announced the formation of the china democracy party . </s><s> hundreds around the country , including xu and qin , began promoting the idea . </s><s> but while the government has allowed somewhat freer discussion of political topics in universities and obscure journals in the last year , it has not allowed any challenges _ in print or in the form of organized groups _ to the principle of communist party rule . </s><s> in a speech on friday celebrating 20 years of economic reforms , the president and communist party chief , jiang zemin , emphasized the primacy of the party , saying , `` the western mode of political systems must never be adopted . '' </s><s> after learning of monday 's sentences , the american embassy here , which has spent the last two years building improved relations between china and the united states , issued a strong condemnation of what it termed the `` deplorable decisions . '' </s><s> `` we are deeply disappointed with both the guilty verdicts and the extremely harsh sentences , '' the statement said . </s><s> `` no individual should be arrested , tried and sentenced for exercising internationally recognized freedoms , including those guaranteed in the international covenant on civil and political rights , to which china has committed itself . '' </s><s> like thursday 's trials , both of which proceeded with no defense attorneys because prospective lawyers had been warned off by police or detained , monday 's proceeding showed that in cases involving security issues , police and courts could write their own rules . </s><s> according to the criminal procedure law , defendants are to be notified at least 10 days before a trial , but xu was told only four days ago that his trial would be monday . </s><s> his wife , who until monday had not been allowed to contact him since his arrest on nov. 30 , was told three days ago . </s><s> under the law , defendants also have the right to a lawyer of their choice , but xu was assigned a lawyer by the court late last week . </s><s> before monday morning 's trial , the lawyer , mo shaoping , saw his client only for one brief meeting , an associate of mo 's said . </s><s> xu 's wife refused to meet the lawyer before the trial . </s><s> `` meeting him would be tantamount to cooperating with the whole charade , '' she said in a telephone interview this weekend . </s><s> responding to the accusations during monday morning 's trial , xu 's lawyer argued that xu had engaged in the peaceful expression of his own views and that this could not amount to subversive activities against the state , an associate of the lawyer said . </s><s> but in a decision that was clearly preordained , the court declared xu guilty and sentenced him to spend what may be much of the rest of his life in prison . </s><s> born in 1943 in the southeastern province of jiangxi , xu was interested in politics even as a teen-ager , his wife said . </s><s> in the 1960s , as an idealistic marxist , he decided to get his learning in society rather than attend a university . </s><s> he served in the navy for five years , then became an electrician with the beijing railroad before becoming involved with the democracy movement and going to prison . </s><s> on monday afternoon , in a police station hours after the trial finished , xu was allowed a half-hour with his wife . </s><s> `` he told me he 'd be able to handle the pain , '' she later recounted in a telephone interview . </s><s> `` he said that this would give him time to think things over and calmly reflect on what has happened . '' </s><s> he , who has been married to xu since 1971 , said she expected to see him in monthly visits to prison . </s><s> the couple has a daughter , xu jin , who is a graduate student in fine arts at boston university . </s><s> in an earlier interview , soon after her husband was arrested on nov. 30 , ms . </s><s> he said xu had told her , `` i ca n't change the way i am . '' </s><s> if he received a long sentence , he told his wife , she should go on and enjoy her life . </s><s> `` and if i die , '' xu said as they parted that day , `` please plant a tree for me . ''	china 's arrest of dissidents could destroy china democracy party	long sentences for activists signal treaties wo n't ease political controls	china : two pro-democracy politicians given long jail terms ; us critical	xu , subversion , wang , qin , china democracy , international covenants , zemin
